83.Mohammad Shafi: So the terribly rumbling sound seized them in the morning

84.Mohammad Shafi: And what they earned availed them not

85.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them, but by due authority. And the Hour is most surely going to come. So fogive things — those that are forgivable.

86.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord is indeed the Knowledgeable Creator of all things

87.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We have given you seven of the repeated Verses and the Glorious Qur'aan

88.Mohammad Shafi: Pine not for that which We have given some of them to enjoy, nor grieve for them. And be kind to the believers

89.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "I am indeed the plain warner."

90.Mohammad Shafi: It is as though what We have sent down is on those who make divisions therein

91.Mohammad Shafi: Those that tear the Quran into shreds

92.Mohammad Shafi: And, by your Lord, We shall certainly question them al

93.Mohammad Shafi: As to what they did

94.Mohammad Shafi: Declare then openly what you are commanded with, and turn away from the polytheists

95.Mohammad Shafi: We shall certainly provide you sufficient protection against those who scoff

96.Mohammad Shafi: Those who worship others besides Allah. They shall soon know their folly

97.Mohammad Shafi: And We do know that your (Prophet's) heart is distressed at what they say

98.Mohammad Shafi: Hymn then the praise of your Lord, and be of those who prostrate to Him

99.Mohammad Shafi: And worship your Lord until there comes to you that certain composure

1.Mohammad Shafi: Allah's command is already issued! So, hasten it not. Glorified and highly exalted is He above what they worship besides Him

2.Mohammad Shafi: He sends down the angels, on whom He pleases of His subjects, with the inspiration of His command: "Give the warning that there is no god but Me, and so fear Me."

3.Mohammad Shafi: He has created the heavens and the earth with the Truth and due Authority. He is far too high and exalted above what they worship besides Him

4.Mohammad Shafi: He (Allah) created man from tiny fertilized ovum. And, lo, he has become an open adversary

5.Mohammad Shafi: And He created the cattle. You get from them warm clothing and other benefits. And from them you get meat to eat

6.Mohammad Shafi: And you feel good when you drive them back home, and when you send them out to pasture

7.Mohammad Shafi: And they carry your heavy loads to lands you could not reach but with much difficulty. Your Lord is indeed Kind, Merciful

8.Mohammad Shafi: And horses, mules and asses for you to ride upon and as assets, and He creates what you do not know

9.Mohammad Shafi: And upon Allah is the determination of the Path and the deviations from it. And if He had so willed He would have certainly guided you all

10.Mohammad Shafi: He it is Who sends down water from the sky. You drink thereof, and therefrom you get the shrubbery upon which you let your cattle graze

11.Mohammad Shafi: He causes the green cultivated fields, the olives, the palm trees, the grapes and all kinds of fruits to grow for you thereby. There is indeed a sign in this for a people who think

12.Mohammad Shafi: And He has made the night, the day, the sun and the moon to work for you. And the stars are made subservient by His command. There are indeed signs in this for a people who ponder

13.Mohammad Shafi: And what He has created on the earth are of different hues and colours. There is a sign in this for a people who reflect

14.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who has made the sea subservient so that you may eat fresh flesh from it and bring out of it jewels you wear. And you see the ships cut through it so that you might seek His bounty and be thankful

15.Mohammad Shafi: And He has cast firm anchors [mountains] in the earth lest it should shake with you. And rivers and roads, that you may find your way

16.Mohammad Shafi: And they find their way by landmarks and the stars

17.Mohammad Shafi: Is He then Who creates like the one who does not? Do you not then reflect

18.Mohammad Shafi: And if you would count Allah's favours, you won't be able to do it. Allah is certainly indeed Forgiving, Merciful

19.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you do openly

20.Mohammad Shafi: And those, whom they pray to besides Allah, have not created anything; they are themselves created

21.Mohammad Shafi: They are dead — not living — and they know not when they shall be raised

22.Mohammad Shafi: The object of your worship is Allah, the One and Only! And those, who do not believe in the Hereafter, are defiant in their hearts, and arrogant

23.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does indeed, without doubt, know what they hide and what they declare. He does not, indeed, love those who are arrogant

24.Mohammad Shafi: And when they are asked, "What is it that your Lord has sent down?" They say, "Stories of the ancients."

25.Mohammad Shafi: By saying so they are going to bear not only their own entire burdens on the day of Resurrection, but also of the burdens of those whom they led astray with misinformation. Is it not too bad what they bear

26.Mohammad Shafi: Those before them plotted. But Allah struck their edifice at its foundations, so that the roof fell down on them from above them. And the punishment came to them from whence they knew not

27.Mohammad Shafi: Then on the Resurrection Day He will disgrace them and ask, "Where are they whom you worshipped besides Me, and for whose sake you caused discord?" Those who are endowed with knowledge will say, "Indeed, the disgrace and the evil, this day, shall be upon those who had suppressed the Truth."

28.Mohammad Shafi: Those that the angels caused to die while they indulged in deeds, which were ultimately injurious to their own selves. Then they would submit, "We didn't do anything bad." Aye! Allah does indeed know what you did

29.Mohammad Shafi: Enter then the gates of Hell, to be there forever! And the dwelling place of the arrogant people is certainly bad

30.Mohammad Shafi: And those who fear Allah are asked, "What is it that your Lord has sent down?" They say, "That which is good." There is goodness for those who do good deeds in this world. And certainly the abode of the Hereafter is better. And excellent certainly is the abode of those who fear Allah

31.Mohammad Shafi: They shall enter gardens of perpetuity, having rivers flowing beneath them. They shall have, in them, what they please. Thus does Allah reward those who fear Him

32.Mohammad Shafi: Those that the angels caused to die while they did good deeds, the angels saying to them, "Peace upon you! Enter the garden as a reward for what you did."

33.Mohammad Shafi: They do not wait for anything but that the angels should come to them or that the Commandment of your Lord should come to pass. This is what those before them did. And Allah oppressed them not, but they oppressed themselves

34.Mohammad Shafi: So the bad things they did shall afflict them and the things they mocked at shall besiege them

35.Mohammad Shafi: And they who worship others besides Allah say, "Had Allah so willed, we would not have worshipped anything besides Him. Nor would our fathers do it. And we would not have prohibited anything without His Command." This is what those before them did. Are the Messengers then responsible for anything but the plain and clear conveyance of the divine Message?h

36.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We raised in every community a Messenger saying, "Worship Allah and shun whatever is worshipped other than Allah." So there were some, among them, whom Allah guided and there were others who were destined to be misguided. Travel in the land then, and see what the end of those who rejected the divine Message was

37.Mohammad Shafi: Even if you are anxious for their guidance, Allah does not indeed guide him who willfully goes astray. And there shall be none to help them

38.Mohammad Shafi: And they swear by Allah most solemnly that Allah will not raise anyone who dies. Yea! It is a promise binding on Him, but most people know it not

39.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will raise the dead so that He might make matters, in which they differ, clear to them, and that those who suppress the Truth might know that they were liars

40.Mohammad Shafi: When We intend a thing, We just say "Be" and it is

41.Mohammad Shafi: And those who migrate for Allah's sake after they are oppressed, We will certainly resettle them in a good position in this world. And the reward of the Hereafter is certainly much greater, if they but know

42.Mohammad Shafi: Those that are patient and have trust in their Lord

43.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not send before you any but men to whom We revealed our Verses/signs. Ask the people of the divine Reminder/Book if you do not know.

44.Mohammad Shafi: We had sent only men, to the earlier people, with clear signs/evidences and scriptures. And We have sent down to you the Reminder (the Qur'aan) that you may make clear to mankind what has been sent down for them, and that they may think about it

45.Mohammad Shafi: Do they then who plan evil deeds feel confident that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them, or that punishment may not overtake them from whence they know not

46.Mohammad Shafi: Or that He may not seize them while they are on the move, and so they cannot escape

47.Mohammad Shafi: Or that He may not seize them with fear and/or slow destruction? And your Lord is indeed Kind, Merciful

48.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not see that anything, which Allah has created, casts its shadow right and left in humble prostration to Allah

49.Mohammad Shafi: And to Allah does prostrate any creature that is in the heavens and that is in the earth, and the angels too do protrate. And they do not show pride

50.Mohammad Shafi: They fear their Lord over them. And they do what they are commanded

51.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah tells human beings not to take two gods. He is Allah, the One and Only. "So Me alone should you hold in awe."

52.Mohammad Shafi: And whatever is in the heavens and the earth is His, and the way of life ought to be for Him ever. Will you then fear any being other than Allah

53.Mohammad Shafi: And the good things, you have, are all from Allah. Then when anything bad afflicts you, to Him do you complain loudly

54.Mohammad Shafi: And yet when He removes the hardship from you, lo, some of you worship others besides their Lord

55.Mohammad Shafi: And so they become ungrateful for what We have given them. Enjoy then for now! You shall soon come to know your real destiny

56.Mohammad Shafi: And they set apart a portion of what We have given them for those of whom they know nothing. By Allah, you shall most certainly be questioned about that which you have been concocting

57.Mohammad Shafi: And they arbitrarily attribute daughters (angels) to Allah. HE is too glorious to have any such creaturely attribute. And, for themselves, they would have what they desire (sons)

58.Mohammad Shafi: And when news of a daughter being born is given to any of them, his face becomes darkened with suppressed anger

59.Mohammad Shafi: He hides himself from the people because of the stigma of the news given to him. Shall he keep it despite the disgrace, or bury it in the dust? Verily, their judgment is vicious.

60.Mohammad Shafi: An example of evil applies to those who believe not in the Hereafter. And the best/loftiest example applies to Allah. And He is the Omnipotent, the Wise

61.Mohammad Shafi: And had Allah seized mankind for their unjust acts, He would not have left, on the earth, even a single creature. But He gives them a definite time limit. And when their time comes, they shall not be able to postpone it for a moment nor prepone it

62.Mohammad Shafi: And they assign to Allah what they hate for themselves. And their tongues philosophically cover up the lie to say that for them there shall be nothing but the good. There is no doubt that for them there shall be the Fire and that they shall be hastened thereto

63.Mohammad Shafi: By Allah, We did certainly send Messengers to peoples that existed before you. Then the Satan made their deeds seem good to them. And he became their walihof the day (period). And they shall have a painful punishment

64.Mohammad Shafi: And We have not sent down the Book to you but to make clear to them what they differ in, and as Guidance and Mercy for people who believe

65.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah it is Who sends down water from the sky and therewith gives life to the earth after its death. There is indeed a sign in this for people who listen

66.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, in the cattle there is a lesson for you. We give you pure, potable drink of milk out of what they consume in their bellies, and drawn from excreta and blood.

67.Mohammad Shafi: And from the fruits of the palm-tree and the vine, you get intoxication as well as good food. There is indeed a sign in this for a people who ponder

68.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord inspired the bee to "have hives in the mountains, in the trees and in the buildings."

69.Mohammad Shafi: "And then eat of all the fruits and tread the paths of your Lord submissively." A beverage of various colours comes forth from within it, wherein there is curative value for mankind. There is indeed a sign in this for people who reflect

70.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah it is Who has created you. It is He then Who causes you to die. And among you there may be someone who, after having acquired knowledge, is reduced to such a decrepit state of life that he knows nothing. Allah is indeed Knowledgeable, Powerful

71.Mohammad Shafi: And it is Allah Who has given some of you more/better provisions than to others. Would then those who are thus favoured give away their provisions to their slaves so that they become equal therein? Do they then deny this privilege that Allah has given them

72.Mohammad Shafi: And it is Allah Who has made spouses for you from among yourselves, and through your spouses He has given you sons, daughters and their further families. And He has provided wholesome food for you. Do they believe then in the falsehood and suppress the fact that it is Allah Who has given them the good things they enjoy

73.Mohammad Shafi: And they worship, besides Allah, those that possess nothing, in the heavens and the earth, wherewith to sustain their worshippers. Nor have those any power to possess anything

74.Mohammad Shafi: So liken not anything to Allah! Indeed, Allah knows and you do not

75.Mohammad Shafi: Allah gives an example: a slave — property of another person — who has no power over anything, and, on the other hand, a free man whom We have given a good provision from Ourselves and he spends from it secretly and openly. Are the two alike? To Allah is due all praise! But, most of them know not

76.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah gives another example, of two men, one of whom is dumb, unable to do anything, and a burden on his master. He is not good at whatever task the master gives him. Can he be held equal to him who enjoins what is just, and is himself on the right path

77.Mohammad Shafi: And with Allah is the knowledge of the unseen/secrets of the heavens and the earth. And the happening of the Hour is but as a momentary sight or consuming even less time. Allah indeed can do anything

78.Mohammad Shafi: And it is Allah Who brought you out from the wombs of your mothers, knowing nothing. And He gave you hearing and sight and intellect that you may be grateful.

79.Mohammad Shafi: See they not how the birds are enabled to be in mid-air above? None keeps them there but Allah! Indeed, there are signs in this for people who believe

80.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah has facilitated for you rest, security and solace in your houses. And He has facilitated for you tents.of the skins of cattle which you find light to carry when you travel and when you stay out. And of the animal wool, fur and hair, He has given you assets and possessions for a time

81.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah has made for you shelters from what He has created, and places of retreat in the mountains. And He has provided for garments for you to protect you from the heat and for armour to protect you in your armed conflicts. Thus does He complete His favour upon you in order that you submit to Him

82.Mohammad Shafi: And if, even then, they turn away, the responsibility on you (Prophet Muhammad) is only to deliver Allah's Message clearly to the people

83.Mohammad Shafi: They are aware of Allah's favour, yet they deny it! And most of them are those who suppress the Truth

84.Mohammad Shafi: And One Day We will raise a witness out of every community. Then shall no leeway be given to those who suppress the Truth, nor shall they be allowed to solicit favours

85.Mohammad Shafi: And when those who are wicked experience the punishment, its severity on them shall not be decreased, nor shall they be given any respite

86.Mohammad Shafi: And when those who worship others besides Allah see those others, they shall say, "Our Lord! These are our other gods whom we prayed to besides You." But they will retort, "Certainly indeed you are liars!"

87.Mohammad Shafi: And they shall tender submission to Allah on that day. And what they used to concoct shall depart from them

88.Mohammad Shafi: For those who suppress the Truth and cause hindrance in Allah's Path, We will add punishment over punishment because they have been spreading corruption

89.Mohammad Shafi: And One Day We will raise in every people a witness against them from among themselves, and bring you as a witness against these. And We have revealed to you the Book explaining everythingclearly, and as a guidance, mercy and good news for those who submit.

90.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does indeed enjoin justice, kindness and giving things to near and dear ones. And He forbids obscenity, abomination and rebellion. He admonishes you that you may remember and take heed

91.Mohammad Shafi: And fulfill Allah's covenant when you make one. And break not oaths after affirming them; for, then, you have indeed made Allah stand surety for you. Allah does indeed know what you do

92.Mohammad Shafi: And be not like the woman who disintegrates her well-spun yarn into fibres.You take your oaths as means of interference in one another's affairs so that one community gets bigger than another. Allah has not but put you on trial by this; and He will certainly make clear to you, on the Resurrection Day, that, about which you differed

93.Mohammad Shafi: And if Allah had so willed, He would certainly have made you a single community. But He causes whom He wills to go astray and guides whom He wills to go on the Right Path. And you will certainly be questioned as to what you did

94.Mohammad Shafi: And take not your oaths as means of interference in one another's affairs, lest a footstep should stumble after it is firmly taken and you should taste adversity because you hindered someone from Allah's Path. And grievous punishment should be your lot

95.Mohammad Shafi: And trade not covenant with Allah, for petty gains. That which is with Allah is certainly better for you, if you but knew

96.Mohammad Shafi: What is with you gets exhausted and what is with Allah endures. And We will certainly give to those who are patient their reward for the good things they did

97.Mohammad Shafi: Whoever, male or female, does good work, and he/she is a believer, We will certainly make him/her live a good and clean life, and We will certainly give them their reward for the good things they did

98.Mohammad Shafi: And when you recite the Qur'aan, seek refuge with Allah from the accursed Satan

99.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed he (Satan) has no authority over those who believe and have trust in their Lord

100.Mohammad Shafi: His authority is only over those who befriend him and over those who worship him besides Allah

101.Mohammad Shafi: And when We change one Message for another — and Allah knows best what He reveals they say, "You are only a forger." Nay, most of them know not

102.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "The Holy Spirit has authoritatively revealed it (the Qur'aan) as from your Lord, in order that it may stabilise those who believe and give guidance and good news for those who submit."

103.Mohammad Shafi: And We are certainly aware that they say, "A certain man it is who teaches him." The person they are alluding to speaks a foreign tongue, and this is clear Arabic tongue

104.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does indeed not guide those who do not believe in His Messages. And they shall have a painful punishment

105.Mohammad Shafi: Those that believe not in Allah's Messages, it is they who concoct the lie. And those are the liars

106.Mohammad Shafi: Allah's Wrath is on people who deny Allah after having believed in Him, not on those compelled while their hearts are at rest with faith, but on those that open their minds to suppression of the Truth. And they shall have the most severe punishment

107.Mohammad Shafi: That is because they love this worldly life more than the Hereafter, and because Allah does not guide people who suppress the Truth

108.Mohammad Shafi: These are the people on whose hearts, hearing and eyes Allah has set a seal. And they take no heed

109.Mohammad Shafi: No doubt, in the Hereafter, they will be the doomed ones

110.Mohammad Shafi: And then, on the other hand, your Lord is indeed Forgiving and Merciful on those who migrate after they are persecuted, then struggle hard and are patient

111.Mohammad Shafi: On that Day every one shall come, pleading for one's own self. And every one shall be paid one's full dues, and they shall not be wronged

112.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah gives an example of a village/town, safe and secure, to which its means of subsistence came in abundance from every quarter. Then it became ungrateful to Allah's favours. And Allah made it wear the garb of hunger and fear because of what they wrought

113.Mohammad Shafi: And, of course, a Messenger from among them had come to them, but they rejected him. So disaster struck them because of their wickedness

114.Mohammad Shafi: Eat then of what Allah has given you, lawful and wholesome. And be grateful for Allah's favours, if Him it is that you worship

115.Mohammad Shafi: HE has forbidden you only carrion (what dies of itself), blood, flesh of swine and that over which any name, other than that of Allah, has been invoked. But if anyone is driven by necessity — and not desire — and does not exceed limits, then Allah is indeed Forgiving, Merciful

116.Mohammad Shafi: And describe not anything falsely, with your tongues, as being lawful or unlawful so as to concoct a lie and ascribe it to Allah. Indeed, those who concoct a lie and ascribe it to Allah shall not prosper

117.Mohammad Shafi: They will enjoy a little and then have a painful punishment

118.Mohammad Shafi: And for those who were Jews, We prohibited what We have related to you already.h And We did them no wrong, but they wronged themselves

119.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord is indeed Forgiving and Merciful to those who do an evil act in ignorance, then turn in repentance after that and make amends

120.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham was indeed an institution by himself, firmly committed to Allah. And he was never a polytheist

121.Mohammad Shafi: He was ever grateful for Allah's favours. HE chose him and guided him to the Straight Path

122.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave him a good life in this world, and, in the next, he will indeed be among the good, righteous people

123.Mohammad Shafi: We then instructed you to follow Abraham's lifestyle steadfastly. And he was not of the polytheists

124.Mohammad Shafi: The Sabbat was ordained only for those who differed about it, and your Lord indeed will judge between them on the Resurrection Day concerning that about which they differed

125.Mohammad Shafi: Call people to the Path of your Lord with wisdom and good counsel, and argue with them in the best possible manner. Your Lord does indeed know who go astray from His path, and who follow it

126.Mohammad Shafi: And if you retaliate, then retaliate with the like of that with which you were afflicted. But if you are patient, it will certainly be better for those who are patient

127.Mohammad Shafi: And be patient and your patience is not but by Allah's Grace. And grieve not for them, and do not distress yourself at what they plot

128.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is indeed with those who fear Him and with those who do good deeds

1.Mohammad Shafi: Glorified He is Who took His devotee on a night journey from the Sacred Place of Worship (at Makkah) to the Distant Place of Worship, the precincts of which We have blessed, so that We may show to him some of Our signs. It is He indeed Who hears, sees, everything.

2.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave Moses the Book and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel, "Entrust none but Me for management of your affairs!"

3.Mohammad Shafi: They were offspring of those whom We bore with Noah on the Ark. He was indeed a grateful subject

4.Mohammad Shafi: And We had decreed, in the Book, to the Children of Israel, "You will surely make mischief on the earth twice, and you will surely rise to great heights of haughtiness."

5.Mohammad Shafi: So when the first of the two prophecies came to pass, We let loose over you Our subjects of mighty strength; and they ravaged through the houses. And it was a prophecy accomplished.

6.Mohammad Shafi: Then We gave you back the turn to prevail against them, and aided you with wealth and children and made you a numerous predominant force

7.Mohammad Shafi: If you do good deeds, you do it for your own good. And if you do bad deeds, you do it to your own detriment. So when the second prophecy would come so that they (your enemies) disgrace you and enter the Place of Worship as they had entered it the first time, and that they might destroy utterly whatever they lay their hands on.

8.Mohammad Shafi: It may be that your Lord will have mercy on you. And if you revert to disobedience, We too will revert to punishing you. And We have made Hell a prison for those who suppress the Truth

9.Mohammad Shafi: This Qur'aan does indeed guide to that which is straight and stable. And it gives the good news to the believers who do good work that they shall have a great reward

10.Mohammad Shafi: And the Qur'aan warns those who do not believe in the Hereafter that We have prepared a painful punishment for them

11.Mohammad Shafi: And man prays for evil as he ought to pray for good. And man is ever hasty

12.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made the night and the day as two signs. We efface the sign of the night and make the sign of the day clear, so that you may seek favour from your Lord, know the calendar and keep accounts. And We have explained everything in details

13.Mohammad Shafi: And We have tied every man's actions to his neck. And We will bring out for him on the Resurrection Day a record thrown wide open

14.Mohammad Shafi: "Read your record! You yourself are sufficient as an auditor against you this day."

15.Mohammad Shafi: One that goes on the right path does so for one's own self. And one that goes astray does so to one's own detriment. And no bearer of a burden bears the burden of another, nor do We punish until We send a Messenger

16.Mohammad Shafi: And when We wish to destroy a town, We send Our commandment to its wealthy people who lead easy lives, but they defiantly disobey! So the divine Word takes effect against that town, and We deal with it destructively

17.Mohammad Shafi: And many a generation, after Noah, did We destroy! And your Lord has a sufficient knowledge of and is a sufficient Witness to His subjects' faults/mistakes/sins

18.Mohammad Shafi: As for one who desires instant gains in this present life, We do hasten therein, to whom We will, what We please. Then We make the Hell burn, to disgrace and reject that one

19.Mohammad Shafi: And as for one who desires the Hereafter and strives for it as one ought to strive and is a believer, the strivings of such people are duly accepted

20.Mohammad Shafi: We do aid all — these (mentioned in Verse above) as well as those (mentioned in Vers

21.Mohammad Shafi: See how We have favoured some of them over others. And, of course, the Hereafter is much superior in ranks and favours

22.Mohammad Shafi: Worship none but Allah lest you remain disgraced, forsaken

23.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord has commanded that you shall worship none but Him, and that you shall be good to your parents. If either or both of them reach old age while with you, you shall not utter even a word of the slightest annoyance or reproach to them. And speak to them kindly

24.Mohammad Shafi: And be submissively and compassionately protective of them, and pray, `O my Lord! Have mercy on them as they had brought me up during my childhood.

25.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord knows what is in your minds. If you are good, then He does indeed forgive those who often turn to Him in penitence

26.Mohammad Shafi: And give to the near of kin his/her due, and to the needy and the wayfarer their dues. And be not a spendthrift

27.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed, the spendthrifts are brothers of the satanic people and the Satan is ever ungrateful to his Lord

28.Mohammad Shafi: And if you are not in a position to help them out and you are yourself seeking mercy from your Lord, speak to them a kind word

29.Mohammad Shafi: And do not make your hand tied to your neck nor extend it to its utmost limit, lest you should be left blamed and impoverished

30.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord does indeed enlarge means of subsistence for those He wills and restrict for those He wills. He does indeed have full knowledge of and does constantly keep watch on His creatures that always ought to obey Him

31.Mohammad Shafi: And kill not your children for fear of poverty. We give them sustenance as We give it to you. Killing them is indeed a great wrong

32.Mohammad Shafi: And go not near fornication/adultery! It is indeed an abomination and an evil path

33.Mohammad Shafi: And do not kill any one, whose killing Allah has forbidden, unless duly authorized to do so. And whoever is slain unjustly, We have of course given to his heir power to retaliate. But let him not then exceed just limits in killing. He does indeed deserve help

34.Mohammad Shafi: And come not near the property of the orphan except as propriety demands till he attains his maturity. And keep the promise you make. The promise shall indeed be questioned about

35.Mohammad Shafi: And give full measure when you give anything by measure, and weigh with a true balance. This is fair and yields a better result in the end

36.Mohammad Shafi: And follow not that of which you have no knowledge! The hearing, the sight and the mind shall all be questioned thereon

37.Mohammad Shafi: And walk not on earth exultantly, for you cannot tear the earth nor reach the mountains in height

38.Mohammad Shafi: All that — the evil thereof — is hateful in the sight of your Lord

39.Mohammad Shafi: This is of what your Lord has revealed to you of wisdom. And worship not any god other than Allah lest you should be thrown into Hell, blamed, rejected

40.Mohammad Shafi: Has then your Lord chosen sons for you, and taken daughters for Himself from among the angels!? What you say is indeed very grave

41.Mohammad Shafi: And We certainly have explained things variously in this Quran that they may take heed. But it adds nothing but aversion to their credit

42.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "If, as they say, there were other gods along with Him, then certainly they would have sought a way to the Lord of the Throne."

43.Mohammad Shafi: Glorified He is and exalted extremely high above what they say

44.Mohammad Shafi: The seven heavens, the earth and whoever or whatever is in them declare His glory. And there is not a thing but glorifies Him with His praise, but their glorification you understand not. He is indeed Considerate, Forgiving

45.Mohammad Shafi: And when you recite the Qur'aan, We place between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a hidden barrier

46.Mohammad Shafi: And We have placed a veil on their hearts and deafness in their ears lest they understand it. And when you mention only your Lord (and not their deities other than Allah) in the Qur'aan, they turn their backs in aversion

47.Mohammad Shafi: We know best what they listen to when they listen to you, and when they talk secretly among themselves. Then the wicked people say, "You follow none but one who is under a magic spell."

48.Mohammad Shafi: See what they liken you to! That is because they have gone astray and cannot find the way

49.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask, "When we shall have become bones and dust (after death), shall we even then be raised up as a new creation!? "

50.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Even when you become stones or iron,"

51.Mohammad Shafi: "Or some other creation that is too hard to be revived to life in your minds!" Then they will ask, "Who will revive us?" Say, "He Who created you the first time." Then they will shake their heads at you in disbelief and say, "When will it be?" Say, "Maybe it is near. "

52.Mohammad Shafi: On that Day of Resurrection, He will call you, and you shall respond uttering His praise. And you will think that you had remained in the grave for only a little while

53.Mohammad Shafi: And say to My human creatures, who all ought to obey Me, that they speak that which is most appropriate and proper. Indeed, the Satan sows discord among them. The Satan is indeed an open enemy to man

54.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord knows you. He will have mercy on you, or He will punish you, as He wills. And We have not sent you as the manager of their affairs

55.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord knows those who are in the heavens and the earth. And We have certainly favoured some of the prophets over others. And We gave Dawood the Psalms

56.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Call on whom you want to, besides Him! They cannot remove the distress from you nor can they change it."

57.Mohammad Shafi: They themselves — whom they call upon — seek the means of getting closest, among themselves, to their Lord. And they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is a thing to be afraid of

58.Mohammad Shafi: And not a village/town/city but We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. This stands recorded in the Divine Ordinance

59.Mohammad Shafi: And nothing prevented Us from sending miracles except that the ancients rejected them. And We gave Thamood the she-camel — a manifest miracle — but they wronged her. And Weh do not send miracles but to warn.

60.Mohammad Shafi: And We did say to you, "Your Lord has indeed kept mankind under His control. And We did not make the visionwhich We showed you — as also the tree cursed in the Qur'aan — but a trial for mankind. And We warn them. But it only adds to their utter transgression."

61.Mohammad Shafi: And when We asked the angels to prostrate to Adam, they prostrated. But Iblees did not. He said, "Shall I prostrate to him whom You have created of dust?"

62.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "Do you see whom You have honoured above me? If You should give me parole till the Day of Resurrection, I will most certainly keep a tight leash on his progeny but for a few of them."

63.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Get out of here! And Hell is the due recompense to you and to all those who, among them, will follow you."

64.Mohammad Shafi: "And beguile whom you can of them with your voice, and cover them with your thinking and your behaviour, and be their partner in wealth and children, and feed them with promises." And the Satan promises them not but to deceive

65.Mohammad Shafi: "Indeed, you have no authority over all those whom I have created and who all obey Me. And your Lord is sufficient as a Guardian/Manager of their interests."

66.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord is He Who navigates the ships for you in the sea that you may seek things out of His grace. He is indeed ever Merciful to you

67.Mohammad Shafi: And when, while on the sea, distress strikes you, all, but He, whom you pray to, desert you. Then when He brings you back safe to the land, you turn away from Him. And man is ever ungrateful

68.Mohammad Shafi: Do you then feel secure that He will not crush you under a landslide or send upon you a violent storm? Then you may not find anyone to save you

69.Mohammad Shafi: Or, do you feel secure that He will not take you back into it (sea) another time, then send on you a stormy wind and thus drown you on account of your ungratefulness? Then you may not find anyone to help you against Us in the matter

70.Mohammad Shafi: And verily We have been liberal to the children of Adam, and We have carried them in the land and the sea, and We have provided them with wholesome good things, and We have preferred them, in granting favours, over most of our creations

71.Mohammad Shafi: On the Day of Resurrection, We will call every people with their Imam. Then those shall read their books, every one of whom will be given his book in his right hand. And they shall not be wronged a bit

72.Mohammad Shafi: And he, who is blind in this world and has strayed away from the Path, shall also be blind in the Hereafter

73.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, they wanted to turn you away from that which We have revealed to you, so that you concoct against Us something else. And then they would certainly have taken you as a friend.

74.Mohammad Shafi: And had We not made you firm, you would almost certainly have inclined to them a little

75.Mohammad Shafi: In that case We would certainly have doubled for you the suffering in life and in death. Then you would not have found any one to help you against Us

76.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, they wanted to make you unsettled in the land in order to drive you therefrom. And in that case they would not have lived there after you but a little

77.Mohammad Shafi: This was Our custom with regard to those of Our Messengers whom We had sent before you, and you shall find no change in Our custom

78.Mohammad Shafi: Establish ritual prayer during the interval from the time the sun sets till the darkness of the night spreads completely. And recite the Qur'aan at dawn. The recitation at dawn is indeed to be in the presence of a congregation

79.Mohammad Shafi: And keep awake part of the night reciting it (Qur'aan). This is an additional thing for you (the Messenger) to do. Maybe your Lord will raise you to a praiseworthy position.

80.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "My Lord! Grant me a truly sound entry into and a truly sound exit from any course of action I undertake in this world. And My Lord! Grant me Your powerful support in whatever good I do."

81.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "The Truth has come and the falsehood has perished. The falsehood is bound to perish."

82.Mohammad Shafi: And We reveal, of the Quran, that which is a healing and a mercy to the believers. And it adds to nothing but doom of the wicked people

83.Mohammad Shafi: And when We bestow some favour on man, he keeps himself arrogantly aloof. And when anything bad happens to him, he is in despair

84.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Every one goes his own way. And your Lord knows who it is that is guided to the right path."

85.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask you about the soul. Say, "The soul is one of the commands of my Lord. And you are not given knowledge but a little thereof."

86.Mohammad Shafi: And if We so will, We could certainly take away that which We have revealed to you. Then you would not find anyone to guard it for you against Our doing s

87.Mohammad Shafi: Except for Mercy from your Lord! His favour upon you is indeed abundant

88.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Even if men and jinn should join together and help each other to bring about the like of this Quran, they would not be able to do it."

89.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly, in this Quran, We have variously explained every aspect of life for mankind. But most of them did not but reject it ungratefully.

90.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "We will not believe in you until you cause a fountain to gush forth from the earth for us."

91.Mohammad Shafi: "Or there are for you a garden of date-palms and grape-vines with rivers flowing luxuriantly through them."

92.Mohammad Shafi: "Or you cause the heaven to come down upon us in pieces as you think it would, or you bring Allah and the angels before us."

93.Mohammad Shafi: "Or you have a house of gold, or you ascend into heaven, and we will not believe in your ascent until you bring down to us a book for us to read." Say, "Glorified is my Lord! Am I anything but a mortal man sent with a divine Message?"

94.Mohammad Shafi: And nothing prevented people from believing when the divine Guidance came to them except for what they said, "Has Allah raised a mortal man as His Messenger!?"

95.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Had angels been the normal inhabitants on earth, We would certainly have sent down to them from the heaven an angel as divine Messenger."

96.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Allah suffices as a witness between me and you. HE is indeed well aware and minutely observant of all His human creatures."

97.Mohammad Shafi: And the one, whom Allah guides, is the one who is guided. And the one, whom He leaves to go astray, you shall not find any awliya for him besides Him. And We will gather them together, on the Day of Resurrection, all lying on their faces — blind, dumb and deaf. Their abode shall be in Hell. We will increase the intensity of the blazing Fire, whenever it abates, for them

98.Mohammad Shafi: This is their retribution because they suppressed the truth of Our Messages/Verses/Signs and because they said, "What! When we shall have become bones and dust, shall we then indeed be raised up as a new creation?"

99.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not see that Allah — Who created the heavens and the earth and appointed an end for them wherein there in no doubt — is able to create their like?hBut the wicked people do not but suppress the Truth

100.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Even if you were in control of the treasures of the Mercy of my Lord, you would miserly hold on to it for fear of exhausting it. And man is stingy."

101.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Moses nine clear signs. Ask the Children of Israel about them. When he came to them, Pharaoh told him, "I do indeed consider you, O Moses, to be a man bewitched."

102.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "You do know that none but the Lord of the heavens and the earth has sent down these as clear evidence. And I do indeed consider you, O Pharaoh, to be a man doomed."

103.Mohammad Shafi: Then Pharaoh wanted to get them destabilised in the land. And We drowned him and those with him all together

104.Mohammad Shafi: And, afterwards, We said to the Children of Israel, "Settle down in the land. Then when the second prophecy would come to pass, we will bring you together in one place."

105.Mohammad Shafi: And in truth have We sent itdown, and in truth has it come down. And We have not sent you but as the giver of good news and as a warner

106.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made divisions in the Qur'aan and sent it down in stages, so that you recite it to the people at intervals

107.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Believe in it or not; but they indeed, who are given the knowledge before it, fall down on their faces in humble prostration, when it is recited to them."

108.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "Glorified is our Lord! The prophecy of our Lord was bound to be fulfilled."

109.Mohammad Shafi: And they fall down on their faces weeping, and it adds to their humility

110.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Pray to Allah or pray to the Gracious One; you may pray to Him by any of His beautiful names. And say your ritual prayer neither too loudly nor in an undertone, but choose a suitable tone in between."

111.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "To Allah is due all praise, Who has taken no son to Himself. And He has no partner in His absolute sovereignty, and has no infirmity to protect against. And do proclaim His greatness!"

1.Mohammad Shafi: All praise is due to Allah, Who sent down the Book to His devotee and made it flawless

2.Mohammad Shafi: That shall remain immutable and straight so that it might warn them of severe punishment from Him and give good news to the believers, who do good deeds, that they shall have a good reward (Paradise)

3.Mohammad Shafi: They (the believers) shall stay therein for ever

4.Mohammad Shafi: And warn those who say, "Allah has a son."

5.Mohammad Shafi: They know nothing of it, nor did their fathers know. A grave word it is that comes out of their mouths! They speak nothing but a lie

6.Mohammad Shafi: Then maybe you (Prophet) will kill yourself with grief, on their account, if they do not believe in this Pronouncement (Qur'aan)

7.Mohammad Shafi: We have indeed made whatever is on the earth as an adornment for it, and We put them on trial to see which of them do good deeds

8.Mohammad Shafi: And We will indeed turn everything thereon into barren soil

9.Mohammad Shafi: Did you perchance consider the Men of the Cave and the story about them as among Our extraordinary signs

10.Mohammad Shafi: When the youths sought refuge in the cave, they said, "Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Thee, and facilitate for us the right course in our affair."

11.Mohammad Shafi: So We put a seal on their ears for a number of years in the cave

12.Mohammad Shafi: Then We raised them up to see which of the two groups was best able to compute the time they had remained there in their unconscious state

13.Mohammad Shafi: We relate to you their story in truth. They were indeed youths who believed in their Lord and We favoured them with more guidance

14.Mohammad Shafi: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and said, "Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We pray not to any god besides Him; for, then, certainly, we would have uttered an abominable thing."

15.Mohammad Shafi: "These, our people, have taken gods besides Him! Why do they not produce any clear evidence in their support? Is there, then, anyone committing a greater wrong than one who concocts a lie against Allah!?"

16.Mohammad Shafi: "And when you leave them and what they worship besides Allah, go to the cave for refuge. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and facilitate ease in your affair."

17.Mohammad Shafi: And you would see the sun bypass their cave, as it rose in the morning on the right; and as it declined in the afternoon on the left, it would pass them by while they lay in the spacious space in the cave. This is one of the signs of Allah. The one whom Allah guides, is the one rightly guided, and the one whom He misleads, you shall not find for that one any wali to direct him to the right path

18.Mohammad Shafi: And you might think them awake, but they were asleep. And We made them turn to the right side and to the left, and their dog squatted on its outstretched forelegs at the entrance. Had you come upon them you would certainly have run away from them, and you would certainly have been overwhelmed with fear of them

19.Mohammad Shafi: And so We roused them to make enquiries among themselves. One of them asked, "How long have you been here?" They said, "We have been here for a day or less than a day." Some said, "Your Lord alone knows how long you have been. Now send one of you with this silver coin of yours to the city, and let him find and bring some good food for you. And let him ensure that none comes to know about you."

20.Mohammad Shafi: "For indeed if they should find you out, they would stone you to death or force you back into their religion. And, then, you will never get salvation."

21.Mohammad Shafi: And thus We made people to stumble upon them (the Men of the Cave) that they (people) might know — when they quarrelled among themselves in their affair — that Allah's promise is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour. And they (the people who came to know the story of the Men of the Cave) said, "Erect a monument over them." Their Lord is well aware of them. Those who had authority over people's affairs said, "We will certainly raise a place of worship over them."

22.Mohammad Shafi: Some of the people would later say, "They (the Men of the Cave) were three, the fourth being their dog." and some others would say, "Five, the sixth being their dog," making conjectures about what is unknown. And still others would say, "Seven, and the eighth was their dog." Say, "My Lord knows their number. None but a few know it. So argue not about them except for what you do know, and make no enquiries concerning them with any of the people."

23.Mohammad Shafi: And never say about anything, "I will indeed do it tomorrow."

24.Mohammad Shafi: Without adding, "If Allah pleases." And remember your Lord when you forget and say, "Maybe my Lord will guide me to better conduct than this."

25.Mohammad Shafi: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and some add nine to the number

26.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Allah knows how long they remained. To Him belong secrets of the heavens and the earth. HE sees them and He hears! There is no walih for them besides Him, and He does not share His Sovereignty with any one."

27.Mohammad Shafi: And recite what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord! There is none who can alter His words. And you shall find no provider of shelter besides Him

28.Mohammad Shafi: And be yourself patient with those who pray to their Lord, morning and evening, desiring His good pleasure. And let not your eyes stray away from them, desiring glamour of life in this world. And follow not him whose heart We have made neglectful to Our remembrance and who follows his carnal desires and is reckless in his deeds

29.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "This is the truth from your Lord. So he who wants to, let him believe, and he who wants to, let him suppress the Truth." We have indeed prepared for those who indulge in wrong-doing a fire, the flames of which shall encompass them. And if they cry for help, they shall be given water like molten brass which will scald their faces. What a miserable drink and what a miserable resting-place

30.Mohammad Shafi: We shall indeed not let the reward, of those who believe and do good, go waste

31.Mohammad Shafi: These it is for whom are gardens of perpetuity beneath which rivers flow. Reclined comfortably on decorated couches, they will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold, and they will wear green robes of fine silk and heavy brocade. What an excellent reward and how beautiful a resting place

32.Mohammad Shafi: And tell them the parable of two men. For one of them We made two gardens of grape vines, and We bordered them both with date-palms. And between the two gardens We made cornfields

33.Mohammad Shafi: Each of the gardens yielded its fruits, and nothing went wrong therein. And We caused a spring to gush forth in their midst

34.Mohammad Shafi: And he had good yield. So he said to his companion in a conversation with him, "I have more wealth than you, and I command greater respect among the people."

35.Mohammad Shafi: And he entered his garden; and he was unfair to himself. He said, "I do not think that this will ever perish."

36.Mohammad Shafi: "And I do not think the Hour will ever occur. And even if I am returned to my Lord I will certainly find there a better place than this."

37.Mohammad Shafi: His companion answered, "Do you deny Him Who created you from dust, then from a tiny seed of fertilized ovum and then shaped you into a man?"

38.Mohammad Shafi: "But as for me, He, Allah, is my Lord, and I do not associate anyone with my Lord."

39.Mohammad Shafi: "And why did you not say when you entered your garden that it is as Allah has willed and that there is no power but with Allah? If you see me inferior to you in wealth and children,"

40.Mohammad Shafi: "Then maybe my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and send a thunderbolt from heaven on your garden so that it shall become just a barren land."

41.Mohammad Shafi: "Or its waters should sink deep into the ground so that you are unable to find it."

42.Mohammad Shafi: And the yield of his gardens was caught in a disastrous wave of destruction. And he started wringing his hands for his investments therein, which had turned upside down. And he said, "Alas! I should not have associated anyone with my Lord."

43.Mohammad Shafi: And he had no manpower to help him besides Allah, nor could he help himself

44.Mohammad Shafi: There! Allah is the only True Wali. He is best in giving rewards and the best to go to in the end

45.Mohammad Shafi: And tell them that the life of this world is like water which We send down from the sky. Spring forth therewith all kinds of vegetation on the earth. Then it (vegetation) becomes dry and brittle and the winds scatter it. And Allah has the ability to do all things

46.Mohammad Shafi: Wealth and children are but an adornment of the life of this world. And the abiding good deeds are better, for reward and hope, with your Lord

47.Mohammad Shafi: And on the Day when We will cause the mountains to move away and you will see the barren earth, We will gather them and leave none of them behind

48.Mohammad Shafi: And they shall be lined up before your Lord. "Verily, you have come to Us in the state We created you at first. But you had thought that We had not fixed any appointment for you."

49.Mohammad Shafi: And the Book shall be produced. And you will see the sinners scared of its contents. And they will say, "Oh, woe to us! What a book is this! It omits nothing, small or big, but mentions them all." And whatever they had done, they shall find it there. And your Lord causes no wrong to anyone

50.Mohammad Shafi: And when We asked the angels to prostrate to Adam, they all did prostrate, but Iblees did not! e was a jinni, and he swerved from the commandment of his Lord. Would you then take him and his progeny, rather than Me, as awliya, and they are your enemies? What a miserable exchange for the wrongdoers

51.Mohammad Shafi: I did not make them witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor of the creation of their own selves. And there was no question of my taking those who mislead as helping hands

52.Mohammad Shafi: And on the Day when He shall say, "Call those whom you considered to be My associates!" So they shall call them, but they shall not respond to them. And We shall place a destructive barrier between them

53.Mohammad Shafi: And the sinners shall see the Fire, and they shall know that they are going to fall into it. And they shall find no way out therefrom

54.Mohammad Shafi: And We have certainly explained in this Quran, for the benefit of mankind, examples of every kind. And man is, in most things, quarrelsome

55.Mohammad Shafi: And nothing prevents people from believing and asking forgiveness of their Lord — when the guidance has already come to them — except that what happened to the ancient peoples should overtake them or that the punishment should confront them

56.Mohammad Shafi: And We do not send Messengers but as givers of good news and of warnings. And those who suppress the Truth resort to falsehoods that they may extinguish the truth thereby. And they hold My Verses/signs and warnings in ridicule

57.Mohammad Shafi: And who is worse in wickness than he who is reminded of the Verses/signs of his Lord, but turns away therefrom and forgets what his two hands have sent before ? We have indeedh placed covers over their hearts, and deafness in their ears, lest they should understand it (Lord's Verses/signs). And if you call them to guidance, they will not follow it ever

58.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord is Forgiving, full of Mercy. Was He to catch them for what they earn, He would certainly have hastened the punishment for them. But there is an appointed time for them from which they shall find no escape

59.Mohammad Shafi: And these towns We destroyed when they acted unjustly — We had fixed an appointed time for their destruction

60.Mohammad Shafi: And when Moses said to the youth accompanying him, "I will not stop until I reach the confluence of two rivers even if I have to continue this journey for a long time."

61.Mohammad Shafi: So when they reached the confluence, they forgot their fish, and it burrowed its way into the sea

62.Mohammad Shafi: But when they had gone farther, he said to his young companion, "Take out our breakfast. We have certainly met with fatigue in this journey of ours."

63.Mohammad Shafi: The youth said, "You know when we took some rest on the rock, I forgot about the fish — and nothing but the Satan made me forget to tell you about it — when, strangely, it found its way into the river!"

64.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "That was the spot we had sought for!" They then retraced their footsteps back to the spot

65.Mohammad Shafi: There they found one of Our devotees. We had favoured him with mercy from Us and We had given him some knowledge from Us

66.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said to him, "May I follow you so that you teach me of the right knowledge you have been taught?"

67.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "You can never have patience with me."

68.Mohammad Shafi: "And how can you have patience in matters over which you do not have comprehensive knowledge?"

69.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "Allah willing, you shall find me patient and I shall not disobey you in any matter."

70.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "If you would follow me, question me not about any thing until I myself speak to you about it."

71.Mohammad Shafi: And both of them went out on a journey. And there arose no problem between them until when they boarded a boat he (Moses' new companion) made a hole in it. Moses said, "Have you made a hole in it to drown the people thereon? Certainly you have done a grave thing."

72.Mohammad Shafi: Moses' companion said, "Did I not say that you will not be able to have patience with me?"

73.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "Hold me not responsible for a thing I forgot, and burden me not with difficulty in my affair."

74.Mohammad Shafi: And they both went on until, when they met a boy, he (Moses' companion) killed him. Moses said, "Have you killed an innocent person otherwise than for manslaughter? Certainly you have done a condemnable thing."

75.Mohammad Shafi: Moses' companion said, "Did I not tell you that you will not be able to have patience with me?"

76.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "If I ask you about anything after this, keep me not in your company. Verily, you shall have then an excuse, provided by me, for you to do so."

77.Mohammad Shafi: And they both went on until, when they came to a town, they requested its people to give them some food, but they refused to feed them as guests. They then found in it a wall which was about to collapse and Moses' companion set it right. Moses said, "You could certainly have taken some wages for it."

78.Mohammad Shafi: Moses' companion said, "This shall be the parting between me and you. I will now inform you of the true perspective of my actions over which you could not have patience."

79.Mohammad Shafi: "As for the boat, it belonged to some poor men who worked on the river. And I wished to make it defective as there was, across them, a king who seized every boat by force."

80.Mohammad Shafi: "And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared lest he should trouble them with disobedience and ingratitude."

81.Mohammad Shafi: So we desired that their Lord would give them in his place a boy better than him in purity and more compassionate

82.Mohammad Shafi: "And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphaned boys in the city, and there was beneath it a treasure belonging to them, and their father was a righteous man. So your Lord desired that they should attain their maturity and take out their treasure as a mercy from your Lord. And I did not do it of my own accord. This is the true perspective of my actions over which you could not have patience."

83.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask you about Zulqarnain. Say, "I will recite an account of him to you."

84.Mohammad Shafi: We did indeed give him authority on earth and means to pursue any thing he did

85.Mohammad Shafi: So he followed a means

86.Mohammad Shafi: And when he reached a place as the sun declined in the west, he found it declining on a oligotrophic spring. And he found a people living near it. We said, "O Zulqarnain! Cause them to suffer or treat them well."

87.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "We will punish only the one who is wicked. He shall then be returned to his Lord, and He will punish him with a severe punishment."

88.Mohammad Shafi: And as for him who believes and does good deeds, he shall have good reward, and We will make Our command easy for him

89.Mohammad Shafi: Then he followed another means

90.Mohammad Shafi: And when he reached a place as the sun rose in the East, he found it rise on a community to whom We had given no shelter therefrom

91.Mohammad Shafi: And thus We had put a limit to the knowledge he (Zulqarnain) could have.

92.Mohammad Shafi: Then he followed yet another means

93.Mohammad Shafi: And when he reached a place between two mountains, he found beyond these a people who could hardly understand a word

94.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "O Zulqarnain! Gog and Magog do indeed make mischief in this land. May we then give you expenses so that you raise a barrier between us and them?"

95.Mohammad Shafi: Zulqarnain said, "What my Lord has given me is better than what you would give me. So you assist me with labour only and I will construct an obstruction between you and them."

96.Mohammad Shafi: "Bring me iron sheets." And when he had filled up the gap between the two mountain sides, he said, "Blow!" And when he had turned it red hot, he said, "Bring me molten brass to pour over it."

97.Mohammad Shafi: So they were not able to scale it nor could they breach it

98.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "This (construction of the barrier/gate) is a mercy from my Lord. But when the prophecy of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to the ground, and the prophecy of my Lord has ever to come true."

99.Mohammad Shafi: And, one day, We shall let the different communities of mankind get mixed up with one another like waves.And then the trumpet will be blown, and We shall gather them all together

100.Mohammad Shafi: And We shall present the Hell, that Day, for display before those who had suppressed the Truth

101.Mohammad Shafi: — Those whose eyes had a cover against seeing My Reminder (Qur'aan) and who were unable to listen to it

102.Mohammad Shafi: Do they then who suppress the Truth think that they can take My subjects as awliya, besides Me? We have indeed prepared Hell as the destination of those who suppress the Truth

103.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Shall We inform you who the greatest losers are in their deeds?"

104.Mohammad Shafi: "They are those whose efforts in the life of this world are misdirected and they think that they are doing good work!"

105.Mohammad Shafi: Those are the people who suppress the Truth in the Verses/signs of their Lord and of the appointment with Him. So their deeds have become null and void. And so We will not assign any weightage to their deeds on the Day of Resurrection

106.Mohammad Shafi: That Hell is their recompense because they suppressed the Truth and held My Verses/signs and My Messengers in ridicule

107.Mohammad Shafi: For those who believe and do good deeds, their bestowal shall indeed be the gardens of paradise

108.Mohammad Shafi: They will abide therein; they will never seek any transfer therefrom

109.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "If the sea were ink for the words of my Lord, the sea would surely be exhausted before the words of my Lord are exhausted, though We were to bring the like of it (sea) in aid."

110.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I am only a man like you. It is revealed to me that the Entity you should worship is One and Only. So, whoever hopes to meet his Lord, he should do good deeds, and worship none besides his Lord." h

1.Mohammad Shafi: About such initials at the beginning of certain Chapters, please see study note : (Manzil I)

2.Mohammad Shafi: This is a narration of the mercy of your Lord on His devotee Zachariah

3.Mohammad Shafi: When he prayed to his Lord silently

4.Mohammad Shafi: He prayed, "My Lord! My bones have indeed become weak and my head shining white. And, my Lord! I have never been disappointed in my prayer to You."

5.Mohammad Shafi: "And indeed I worry about what my relatives will do after me. And my wife is barren. So bestow upon me a proper heir from You."

6.Mohammad Shafi: "Who shall be an heir to me and an heir to the children of Jacob. And make him, my Lord, one in whom You are well pleased!"

7.Mohammad Shafi: [The divine response was,] "O Zachariah! We do indeed give you the good news of a boy whose name shall be Yahya (John). We had not given this name to anyone before."

8.Mohammad Shafi: Zacharia said, "O my Lord! How can I have a son, and my wife is barren, and I have myself grown too old!?"

9.Mohammad Shafi: [The divine response was,] "So shall it be. Your Lord says, `It is not at all difficult for Me, and indeed I created you before, when you were nothing.'"

10.Mohammad Shafi: Zachariah said, "My Lord! Give me a sign." The Lord said, "Your sign is that you will not be able to speak to the people for three consecutive nights."

11.Mohammad Shafi: So he came out to his people from the chamber, then he communicated to them, through signs, that they should glorify Allah morning and evening

12.Mohammad Shafi: "O John! Hold on to the Book firmly." And We granted him the authority over men while he was yet a child

13.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave him the gift of compassion from Us and of purity, and he feared Allah

14.Mohammad Shafi: And ever courteous to his parents, he was never insolent, disobedient

15.Mohammad Shafi: And peace on him on the day he was born, the day he dies, and the day he is raised to life again

16.Mohammad Shafi: And mention Mary in the Book when she withdrew from her family to stay at a place towards the East

17.Mohammad Shafi: And she screened herself from them, and We sent to her Our spirit, and it appeared before her as a man well-made

18.Mohammad Shafi: She said, "I do indeed seek the Gracious Allah's protection against you, if you do really fear Allah."

19.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "I am a Messenger of your Lord: I am sent to give you a gem of a boy."

20.Mohammad Shafi: She said, "How can I have a boy when no man has ever touched me? And I have never been unchaste."

21.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "It will be so even in those circumstances — Your Lord says, `It is easy for Me.' — so that We may make him a sign for men, and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter which has already been decreed."

22.Mohammad Shafi: So she conceived him and then withdrew with him to a remote place

23.Mohammad Shafi: And the throes of childbirth drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She said, "Oh, would that I had died before this, and had been a thing long forgotten!"

24.Mohammad Shafi: Then a voice called out to her from beneath her, "Grieve not, your Lord has surely made a canal flow beneath you."

25.Mohammad Shafi: "And shake the trunk of the palm tree towards you. It will drop on you fresh ripe dates."

26.Mohammad Shafi: So eat and drink and relax! Then if you should see any man, tell him (by signs), "I have indeed vowed unto the Gracious Allah not to speak to any man today."

27.Mohammad Shafi: And she came to her people carrying the child. They said, "O Mary! You have verily done a terrible thing."

28.Mohammad Shafi: "O sister of Aaron ! Your father was not a bad man, nor was your mother an unchaste woman."

29.Mohammad Shafi: But she pointed to him. They said, "How could we speak to a mere child in cradle?"

30.Mohammad Shafi: The child said, "I am indeed a devotee of Allah. HE has given me the Book and made me a Prophet."

31.Mohammad Shafi: "And He has made me blessed wherever I may be, and He has enjoined on me prayer and charity so long as I live."

32.Mohammad Shafi: "And to be couteous to my mother. And He has not made me insolent, impudent."

33.Mohammad Shafi: "And peace on me on the day I was born, the day I die and the day I am raised to life again."

34.Mohammad Shafi: This (as narrated in Verses to above) then is Jesus, son of Mary — the word of Truth about which they raise disputes

35.Mohammad Shafi: It is not befitting the majesty of Allah that He should beget a son. Glorified He is! When He has decreed a matter, He only says to it "Be," and it is

36.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, Allah is my Lord and your Lord; hence, worship Him. This is the Straight Path

37.Mohammad Shafi: But the tribes disagreed among themselves — and woe to those who disbelieve — about the Court of Judgment to be assembled on a tremendous Day

38.Mohammad Shafi: Make them listen to you when you speak to them about the Day they shall appear before Us, and make them understand the significance of that Day. But those who are wicked shall continue to remain grossly mistaken about the Day

39.Mohammad Shafi: And warn them of the Day of intense regret, when all matters get finally decided. And they are under a delusion and they do not believe

40.Mohammad Shafi: We do indeed inherit the earth and all those who are on it, and to Us they all shall be returned

41.Mohammad Shafi: And make mention of Abraham in the Book. He was indeed a true Prophet

42.Mohammad Shafi: When he said to his father, "O my father! Why do you worship a thing that neither hears nor sees, nor does it give you any benefit whatsoever?"

43.Mohammad Shafi: "O my father! I do have some knowledge that you do not. So follow me! I will show you the Right Path."

44.Mohammad Shafi: "O my father! Worship not the Satan. The Satan is indeed a rebel against Allah, the Gracious."

45.Mohammad Shafi: "O my father! I am afraid, a punishment from the Gracious Allah may afflict you and you may befriend the Satan."

46.Mohammad Shafi: He (Abraham's father) said, "Are you averse to my gods, O Abraham? If you do not desist I will certainly pelt you with stones. And leave me alone for now."

47.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham said, "Peace on you! I will pray to my Lord to forgive you. He is indeed ever benevolent to me."

48.Mohammad Shafi: "And I will go away from you and what you pray to besides Allah, and I will pray to my Lord; may be my prayer to my Lord shall not remain unanswered."

49.Mohammad Shafi: So when he had gone away from them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We bestowed upon him Isaac and Jacob, and We made each a Prophet

50.Mohammad Shafi: And We bestowed upon them Our mercy, and We gave them each a highly truthful tongue

51.Mohammad Shafi: And mention Moses in the Book. He was indeed pure and clean; and he was a Messenger Prophet

52.Mohammad Shafi: And We called to him from the right side of Mount Sinai, and We drew him near for a talk

53.Mohammad Shafi: And We made for him, by Our mercy, his brother Aaron a Prophet

54.Mohammad Shafi: And mention Ishmael in the Book. He was indeed true to his word, and a Messenger Prophet

55.Mohammad Shafi: And he used to enjoin his family to pray and to give in charity, and his Lord was well pleased with him

56.Mohammad Shafi: And mention Idris in the Book. He was indeed a true Prophet

57.Mohammad Shafi: And We raised him high in status

58.Mohammad Shafi: Those were men on whom Allah bestowed favours. Those were from among the Prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried in the Ark with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. Whenever Verses/signs of the Gracious Allah were recited to them, they would fall down prostrating and weeping

59.Mohammad Shafi: But then generations that followed them became negligent of prayers and followed sensual desires. And they shall encounter disaste

60.Mohammad Shafi: Except such as repent and believe and do good deeds. These shall enter the Garden, and no injustice shall be done to them

61.Mohammad Shafi: Gardens of perpetuity which the Gracious Allah has promised to those who worship Him even when they do not see Him. His promise shall indeed come to pass

62.Mohammad Shafi: They shall not hear therein any vain discourse; the discourse shall be only on peace. And they shall have all their provisions therein morning and evening

63.Mohammad Shafi: This is the garden that We cause those of Our subjects to inherit who fear Allah

64.Mohammad Shafi: And we (angels) do not descend but by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us and whatever is behind us and whatever is in between. And your Lord does not forget

65.Mohammad Shafi: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is in between them. So worship Him and be patient in worshipping Him. Do you know any one equal to Him

66.Mohammad Shafi: And says man, "When I am dead and gone, shall I even then certainly be brought out alive?!"

67.Mohammad Shafi: Does not man remind himself that We had created him before, when he was nothing

68.Mohammad Shafi: And, by your Lord, We will most certainly gather them and the satanic people together. Then shall We certainly cause them to be present around Hell on their knees

69.Mohammad Shafi: Then We will most certainly pull out from every group one who had transgressed most against Allah, the Gracious

70.Mohammad Shafi: And We do certainly know best those who deserve most to be burned therein

71.Mohammad Shafi: And there is not one of you, but shall come to it. For your Lord this is a decree already issued

72.Mohammad Shafi: And We will save (from Hell) those who fear Allah, and We will consign the wrongdoers therein on their knees

73.Mohammad Shafi: And when Our clear Verses/signs are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of the two groups of us are better in position and well organised?"

74.Mohammad Shafi: And how many of the generations have We destroyed before them who were apparently well established

75.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "The Gracious Allah will surely give a long lease to all those who have gone astray, until they see what they were warned about: the punishment or the Hour. Then they shall know who is worse in position and weaker in force."

76.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah increases guidance of those who go by the Guidance. And lasting good deeds are better for reward with your Lord and yield better return

77.Mohammad Shafi: Have you, then, seen him who suppresses the Truth in Our Verses/signs and says, "I shall certainly be given wealth and children?"

78.Mohammad Shafi: Has he gained knowledge of the unseen, or made a pact with the Gracious Allah

79.Mohammad Shafi: By no means! We write down what he says, and We will extend the duration of the punishment for him

80.Mohammad Shafi: And We will inherit from him what he talks of (his wealth and his children), and he shall come to Us alone

81.Mohammad Shafi: And they have taken gods, besides Allah, as sources of power for them

82.Mohammad Shafi: By no means! They shall soon deny their worshipping them, and they shall be adversaries to them

83.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that We have sent the devils against those who suppress the Truth, inciting them on in their pernicious deeds

84.Mohammad Shafi: So be not hasty about them. Their days are numbered

85.Mohammad Shafi: The Day on which We shall gather before Allah, the Gracious, groups of pious people

86.Mohammad Shafi: And We will drive the criminals in herds towards Hell

87.Mohammad Shafi: They shall have no power of intercession, unless one has struck a deal with the Gracious One

88.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "The Gracious One has a son."

89.Mohammad Shafi: Certainly you have come up with an atrocious thing

90.Mohammad Shafi: The heavens almost were torn asunder thereat, the earth was disturbed, and the mountains collapsed devastatingl

91.Mohammad Shafi: At that they ascribed a son to the Gracious One

92.Mohammad Shafi: And it is inconceivable that the Gracious One could have a son

93.Mohammad Shafi: None in the heavens and the earth but will come to the Gracious One obediently as a slave

94.Mohammad Shafi: Certainly He has counted them and He has given everyone a number

95.Mohammad Shafi: And all of them will come to Him, individually, on the Day of Resurrection

96.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will certainly create affection for those who believe and do good deeds

97.Mohammad Shafi: And then We have made it (the Qur'aan) easy in your tongue only so that you may give good news thereby to those who fear Allah and warn thereby a hostile people

98.Mohammad Shafi: And how many a generation before them have We destroyed! Do you have any perception of any of them or hear any sound from them?

1.Mohammad Shafi: Ta-h

2.Mohammad Shafi: We have not sent down the Quran upon you to cause you distress

3.Mohammad Shafi: It is but a Memorandum for one who fears Allah

4.Mohammad Shafi: It is a bestowal from the One Who created the earth and the lofty heavens

5.Mohammad Shafi: From the Gracious One, firmly established on the throne of absolute authority

6.Mohammad Shafi: Everything — that which is in the heavens, on the earth, in between the two, and underneath the ground — is all His

7.Mohammad Shafi: And if you say anything aloud, mind you, He knows the secret, and the hidden

8.Mohammad Shafi: Allah — there is no god but He; His are the very best attributes.

9.Mohammad Shafi: And has Moses' story come down to you

10.Mohammad Shafi: When he saw some fire, he said to his wife escorting him, "Wait! I do indeed see a fire. Maybe, I can bring to you therefrom a live burning coal or come to know about the right way from someone at the fire."

11.Mohammad Shafi: And when he came to it (the fire), he was called out, "O Moses!"

12.Mohammad Shafi: "Verily, I am your Lord; so take off your shoes! You are indeed in the sacred valley of Tuwa."

13.Mohammad Shafi: "And I have chosen you, so then listen to what is revealed."

14.Mohammad Shafi: "Indeed, I, Myself, am Allah! There is no god but I. So worship Me and establish regular prayer to remember Me."

15.Mohammad Shafi: "The Hour (Last Day) is indeed coming. I will unravel it anytime so that every soul is recompensed for what it strived."

16.Mohammad Shafi: "So let him not, who does not believe in it (the Hour) and follows his low desires, turn you away from it so that you should perish."

17.Mohammad Shafi: "And what is this in your right hand, Moses!"

18.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "It is my staff. I lean upon it and I beat the leaves with it to make them fall upon my sheep, and I have other uses for it."

19.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Cast it down, O Moses!"

20.Mohammad Shafi: And as Moses cast his staff down, it instantly became a serpent moving

21.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Hold it and be not afraid! We will restore it to its original state."

22.Mohammad Shafi: "And, another sign: put your hand under your arm, it shall come out perfectly white!"

23.Mohammad Shafi: "That We may show you some of Our great signs."

24.Mohammad Shafi: "Go to Pharaoh! He has indeed exceeded all bounds."

25.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "O my Lord! Broaden my mind for me."

26.Mohammad Shafi: "And make my task easy for me."

27.Mohammad Shafi: "And correct the stammer in my speech."

28.Mohammad Shafi: "Make them understand what I say."

29.Mohammad Shafi: "And appoint, from my family, an assistant for me."

30.Mohammad Shafi: "My brother, Aaron."

31.Mohammad Shafi: "Strengthen me with his support."

32.Mohammad Shafi: "And make him my associate in my work."
