33.Mohammad Shafi: "So that we should glorify You much."

34.Mohammad Shafi: "And remember You often."

35.Mohammad Shafi: "You do indeed see us."

36.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Your petition stands granted, O Moses!"

37.Mohammad Shafi: "And We did confer a favour on thee another time."

38.Mohammad Shafi: "When We revealed to your mother that which was revealed."

39.Mohammad Shafi: "That she should put him into a chest, and then put the chest onto the river. Then the river should throw him on the shore. There, one, who is an enemy to Me and enemy to him, should pick him up. And I made you lovable so that you might be brought up under My watchful eye."

40.Mohammad Shafi: "When your sister went and said, `May I lead you to one who will feed him?' Thus We returned you to your mother so that she should be comforted and not grieved. And you killed a man, and then We delivered you from that worry. And We tried you variously. Then you stayed for years among the people of Madyan. Then you came here as ordained, O Moses!"

41.Mohammad Shafi: "And I have made you for Myself."

42.Mohammad Shafi: "Now go, you and your brother, with My signs and be not remiss in remembering Me!"

43.Mohammad Shafi: "Go both of you to Pharaoh! He has indeed committed transgression."

44.Mohammad Shafi: "And speak to him gently. Maybe he takes heed or refrains from further evil."

45.Mohammad Shafi: Both said, "O our Lord! We do indeed fear that he may take no heed of us or that he may commit some transgression."

46.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Fear not! I, Myself, am indeed with you both; I hear and I see."

47.Mohammad Shafi: "So go you both to him and say, `We two are, indeed, Messengers of your Lord. Send the Children of Israel with us and torment them not! Verily, we have brought to you a sign from your Lord. And peace on him who follows the guidance!

48.Mohammad Shafi: `It has indeed been revealed to us that punishment will come upon him who rejects and turns away.'"

49.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh asked, "And who is the Lord of you two, O Moses?"

50.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "Our Lord is He Who gave everything its creation, and then guided it."

51.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh asked, "Then what about the earlier generations?"

52.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "The knowledge thereof is in a record with my Lord. My Lord errs not, nor does He forget."

53.Mohammad Shafi: The Lord Who made the earth for you a flattened expanse and laid for you therein paths. And He sent down water from the sky. Then thereby We have brought out diverse herbs/plants in pairs

54.Mohammad Shafi: Eat and tend your cattle. There are indeed signs in this for those who are prudent

55.Mohammad Shafi: From it (earth) We created you and into it We shall send you back and from it will We raise you a second time

56.Mohammad Shafi: And verily We showed him Our signs, all of them, but he rejected and turned arrogant

57.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "Have you come to drive us out of our land by your magic, O Moses?"

58.Mohammad Shafi: "We shall certainly then bring to you similar magic. Let us then, between us and you, have an appointment at a mutually convenient place, which we should neither of us fail to keep."

59.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "Let your appointment be on the day of the Festival and let the people be gathered together in the morning."

60.Mohammad Shafi: So Pharaoh withdrew, devised his plan of action, and then came

61.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said to them, "Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah, lest He should destroy you by a punishment. And he, who fabricates, does indeed fail."

62.Mohammad Shafi: And the magicians debated among themselves their response to Moses, but kept the discourse secret

63.Mohammad Shafi: They said (among themselves), "Indeed, these two are just magicians. They wish to turn you out of your land by their magic and to deprive you of your best traditions."

64.Mohammad Shafi: "So do combine your plan, and then come in line. And he that is superior will certainly win this day."

65.Mohammad Shafi: They said (aloud), "O Moses! Will you do your act, or shall we be the first to do it?"

66.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "No! You do it." And lo! Their ropes and their sticks appeared to him (Moses), by their magic, as if they were moving

67.Mohammad Shafi: So Moses felt a fear rising within him

68.Mohammad Shafi: WE said, "Fear not, you shall indeed have the upper hand."

69.Mohammad Shafi: "And cast down that which is in your right hand. It shall devour what they have contrived. They have contrived only what a magician could plan. And the magician shall not succeed wherever he may have come from."

70.Mohammad Shafi: And the magicians were obliged to fall prostrate! They said, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses."

71.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "You believed in him before I gave you leave. He ought to have been your superior who taught you magic. I will then certainly cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides, and I will certainly crucify you on the trunks of the palm trees. And certainly you will come to know which of us is the more severe and the more persistent in punishing."

72.Mohammad Shafi: The magicians said, "There is no question of our preferring you over Him Who made us, after what has come to us of clear signs. So decide whatever you want to. You can only decide about life in this world."

73.Mohammad Shafi: "We do indeed believe in our Lord. May He forgive us our sins and that magic which you forced upon us. And Allah is better and everlasting."

74.Mohammad Shafi: Whoever comes to his Lord as a sinner, for him indeed is Hell. He shall not die therein, nor shall he live

75.Mohammad Shafi: And whoever comes to Him as a believer with righteous deeds to his credit, he shall be among those who shall enjoy high ranks

76.Mohammad Shafi: Gardens of perpetuity, beneath which rivers flow, to abide therein. And this is the reward of one who purifies oneself

77.Mohammad Shafi: And We did reveal to Moses that he should "travel by night with My devotees, then make for them a dry path in the sea, without any fear of being overtaken or of any other sort."

78.Mohammad Shafi: And Pharaoh followed them with his armies. And so there came upon them from the sea that which came upon them.

79.Mohammad Shafi: And Pharaoh led his people astray and guided them not

80.Mohammad Shafi: O Children of Israel! We did verily deliver you from your enemy, and We made a covenant with you on the right side of the mountain, and We sent to you the manna and the quails.

81.Mohammad Shafi: Make use of the good things We have provided you with, and be not inordinate therein lest My wrath should become due upon you. And he, upon whom My wrath becomes due, certainly perishes

82.Mohammad Shafi: And I am indeed most forgiving to him who repents and believes and does good deeds, and then follows the right direction

83.Mohammad Shafi: "And what made you come here earlier than your people, O Moses?"

84.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "They are close behind me. And I hastened to You, my Lord, that You might be pleased."

85.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "But then We put your people on trial after you had left them behind, and the Samiri has led them astray."

86.Mohammad Shafi: Then Moses returned to his people, angry and sorrowful. He Said, "O my people! Did not your Lord give you a good promise? Did then the time for fulfillment of the promise seem too long to you? Or did you wish to incur wrath from your Lord, so you broke your promise to me

87.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "We did not break our promise to you of our own accord, but we were made to bear the burden of the ornaments of the people. So we got rid of that burden just as the Samiri did."

88.Mohammad Shafi: Then he (Samiri) brought out for them a body of a calf, from which emanated a low sound. Then he told them, "This is your god and the god of Moses. But he (Moses) has forgotten it."

89.Mohammad Shafi: Could they not see that it did not respond to them at all, and that it did have no power to do any harm or to bring any benefit to them

90.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly had Aaron told them earlier, "O my people! You are only being tried therewith. And, indeed, your Lord is the Gracious One. Follow me then and obey my order!"

91.Mohammad Shafi: They had said, "We will not abandon worshipping it until Moses returns to us."

92.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "O Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray

93.Mohammad Shafi: From following me? Did you then go against my instruction?"

94.Mohammad Shafi: Aaron said, "O son of my mother! Seize me not by my beard and by my head. I was indeed afraid you might say, `You have caused a rift among the children of Israel and not waited for my word.'"

95.Mohammad Shafi: Moses then asked, "What have you to say on this, O Samiri?"

96.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "I saw what they did not see. And I took a handful of traces from the messenger and flung it. And this is what my own self prompted me to do."

97.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "Begone! Indeed, it is ordained for you in this life to say, `Touch me not!' And indeed there is a prediction for you that shall not fail. And look at your god that you hovered around! We will certainly burn it. Then we will certainly reduce it to dust and scatter it in the sea."

98.Mohammad Shafi: None but Allah is worthy of your worship! He knows everything

99.Mohammad Shafi: Thus do We narrate to you some stories from the past. And We have verily given you the account (in the Qur'aan) from Ourselves

100.Mohammad Shafi: One who turns oneself away therefromhshall indeed bear a burden on the Day of Resurrection

101.Mohammad Shafi: Burdened they shall remain. And too bad for them the burden, On the Day of Resurrection

102.Mohammad Shafi: The Day, the trumpet is blown — the Day, We gather the sinful, blue with fear

103.Mohammad Shafi: Whispering among them, "You stayed but ten days."

104.Mohammad Shafi: We know best what they say; and the one among them, with the exemplary method of giving estimates, would say, "You stayed but a day."

105.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask you about the mountains. Say, "My Lord will pull them down to their roots."

106.Mohammad Shafi: And reduce it to a smooth, levelled plain

107.Mohammad Shafi: You shall not see therein any ups and downs

108.Mohammad Shafi: That Day they shall follow the caller, and they shall have no alternative but to follow him. And the voices shall be low in deference to the Gracious One and you shall not hear but a soft murmur

109.Mohammad Shafi: That day no intercession shall benefit anyone except from him whom the Gracious One permits and whose word of intercession He approves

110.Mohammad Shafi: HE knows what they are aware of, and what they are not aware of, and what is beyond the sphere of their knowledge

111.Mohammad Shafi: And the faces shall be bent down before the Living, Everlasting One. And he who bears the burden of wrongdoing is certainly doomed

112.Mohammad Shafi: And he who does some good work and is also a believer, he shall have no fear of injustice or of usurpation

113.Mohammad Shafi: And so have We sent it down as a Qur'aan in Arabic, and have detailed therein some of the things that are going to happen in the future so that they may fear Allah and take heed or that it may serve them as a Reminder of things that have gone by

114.Mohammad Shafi: And exalted is Allah, the true Sovereign! And make no haste with reciting the Quran before its revelation to you is completed. And say, "O my Lord! Increase my knowledge."

115.Mohammad Shafi: And We had verily given a commandment to Adam in the past, but he forgot! And We did not find in him the trait of resoluteness

116.Mohammad Shafi: And when We asked the angels to prostrate before Adam, prostrated they all except for Iblees. He (Iblees) refused!

117.Mohammad Shafi: And We said, "O Adam! This is an enemy to you and to your wife; so let him not drive you both out from the garden and thus make you miserable."

118.Mohammad Shafi: "It is indeed ordained for you that you shall not be hungry therein nor be naked."

119.Mohammad Shafi: "And that you shall not be thirsty therein nor shall you feel hot."

120.Mohammad Shafi: Then the Satan seduced him, saying, "O Adam! Shall I show you the tree of immortality and a kingdom that shall not decay?"

121.Mohammad Shafi: And they both succumbed to the satanic seduction, and then their sexuality got opened to them, and they both began to cover themselves with leaves of the garden. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and thus deviated from the right path

122.Mohammad Shafi: Then his Lord chose him, so He accepted his repentance and guided him

123.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Down you both (Adam & Satan) go, together, in reciprocal enmity. And whenever Guidance comes to you from Me, then all those who follow My Guidance shall not go astray or be miserable."

124.Mohammad Shafi: "And he who turns away from My Reminder shall lead a hard life. and We will raiseh him on the Day of Resurrection, blind."

125.Mohammad Shafi: He will say, "My Lord! Why have You raised me blind? And I was certainly one able to see!"

126.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will say, "Just as Our Verses/signs came to you but you neglected them, so shall you be neglected this day."

127.Mohammad Shafi: And thus do We recompense him who is negligent and believes not in the Verses/signs of his Lord. And certainly the punishment in the Hereafter is severe and abiding

128.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not take a lesson from the fact that We had destroyed many a generation before theirs, in whose dwelling-places they now move about? Indeed, there are signs in this for those who are prudent

129.Mohammad Shafi: And had it not been that the Word had already gone forth from your Lord and an appointed term fixed, the same fate (of destruction in this world) that the earlier generations met with, would certainly be theirs (the generation addressed to in this Verse) too

130.Mohammad Shafi: Exercise patience then over what they say. And glorify your Lord with His praise before the rising of the sun and before its going down. And glorify Him, during the night and during parts of the day, so that you get peace of mind. ,

131.Mohammad Shafi: And covet not that — which We have provided some couples among them with — of the glitter of this worldly life, whereby We try them. And what the Lord provides you with is better and lasting

132.Mohammad Shafi: And enjoin prayer on your followers, and be regular and steadfast thereon. We do not ask you for any provision; We give it to you. And in the end it is those who fear Allah, and abide by His instructions, that get all the good things to enjoy

133.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "Why does he not bring to us a sign from his Lord?" Has not there come to them a clear exposition of what the earlier scriptures contain

134.Mohammad Shafi: And had We destroyed them with punishment before this, they would certainly have said, "O our Lord! Why did You not send us a Messenger? For, we should then have followed Your Verses/signs before we met disgrace and shame."

135.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Everyone is waiting, so you too wait! You will soon come to know who is following the right path and who is guided."

1.Mohammad Shafi: For the human beings, their time of reckoning is near, and yet they pass their time in utter recklessness.h

2.Mohammad Shafi: No aspect of divinity comes to them from their Lord in the form of a fresh anecdote but they listen to it in jes

3.Mohammad Shafi: Just to serve as a distraction for their minds. And the wicked people secretly whisper, "Is he not just a man like you? Will you then knowingly yield to the magic spell?"

4.Mohammad Shafi: The Prophet said, "My Lord knows every word spoken anywhere in the heavens and the earth. And He is the One to hear and the One to know everything."

5.Mohammad Shafi: But they variously said, "Just a confusing mixture of dreams!" "But he has forged it." "But he is a poet." "Let him then bring to us a sign just as the earlier prophets were sent with."

6.Mohammad Shafi: Any town/village that We had destroyed before them, too, had not believed! Will they, taking this fact into account at least, believe

7.Mohammad Shafi: And We sent (as Prophets/Messengers for mankind), before you, none but men inspired with Our Revelation. Ask the people of the Reminder (divinely revealed Book) if you do not know

8.Mohammad Shafi: And We had not made them bodies that did not eat food, and they were not immortal

9.Mohammad Shafi: And We made Our promise good to them; We saved them and those whom We pleased, and We destroyed the transgressors

10.Mohammad Shafi: Verily We have revealed to you a Book in which are things for you to ponder over, remember and abide by. Do you then not use your intelligence to understand it

11.Mohammad Shafi: And many a town/village, whose inhabitants were cruel, did We shatter, and We raised up, thereafter, another people

12.Mohammad Shafi: No sooner did they perceive Our punishment coming than they began to flee therefrom

13.Mohammad Shafi: Flee not, and come back to the affluence you were accustomed to live in and to your homes for being questioned

14.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "O woe to us! We were wicked."

15.Mohammad Shafi: And this cry of theirs continued till We made them like smouldering harvested field

16.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not create the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, for fun

17.Mohammad Shafi: Had We wished to have some amusement, We would have derived it from within Ourselves, if at all.h

18.Mohammad Shafi: Nay! We cast the truth against the falsehood to demolish it (falsehood). And lo! Falsehood perishes. And woe to you for the (wrong) way you perceive things

19.Mohammad Shafi: And whoever is in the heavens and the earth is His. And those who are with Him are never too proud to worship Him, nor do they get weary

20.Mohammad Shafi: They glorify Allah, night and day, without a break

21.Mohammad Shafi: Or have they taken gods whom they themselves have fashioned/designed out of the earth!

22.Mohammad Shafi: Had there been in them any gods other than Allah, the two (the heavens and the earth) would certainly have been in a state of disorder. Glorified then is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, above all that they attribute to Him

23.Mohammad Shafi: He cannot be questioned concerning what He does but they (human beings) shall be

24.Mohammad Shafi: Or have they taken gods other than Him? Say, "Produce your evidence! This is the precept (that there is no god besides Allah) for those with me and the precept for those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, and so they are intransigent

25.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not send before you any Messenger but We revealed to him that there is no god but I, and so worship Me

26.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "The Gracious One has begotten (angels)!" Glorified is He. Nay! They are His honoured worshippers

27.Mohammad Shafi: They do not speak ahead of Him and they act at His Command

28.Mohammad Shafi: HE knows what they know of and what they do not know of. And they intercede not except for him whom He wills and they are on their guard in awe of Him

29.Mohammad Shafi: And whoever of them says that he is indeed a god besides Him, We award Hell to such a one. We do thus award the wicked people

30.Mohammad Shafi: Do those who suppress the Truth not see that the heavens and the earth were both one in kind, and then We did distinguish the two. And We have made of water everything living, will they not then believe

31.Mohammad Shafi: And We have placed mountains in the earth so that positions thereon do not move. And We have made therein passes to enable people to move about and find their way

32.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made the sky a protective roof and yet they are oblivious to its signs!

33.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who created the night and the day, the sun and the moon. All in orbit float

34.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not ordain immortality for any man before you. And so if you die, will they remain alive

35.Mohammad Shafi: Every one must taste death. And We test you with trial periods of adversity and prosperity. And to Us you shall be brought back

36.Mohammad Shafi: And when those who suppress the Truth see you, they do not take you but for one to be scoffed at, "Is this the one who talks of your gods?" And they suppress mention of the Gracious One

37.Mohammad Shafi: Man is created hasty in nature. Soon shall I show you My signs. So be not hasty!

38.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask, "When will this prediction come to pass if what you say is true?"

39.Mohammad Shafi: Had those who suppress the Truth but known that a time would come when they shall not be able to ward off the fire from their faces or from their backs! And then they shall get no help

40.Mohammad Shafi: But it (the time mentioned in Verse above) shall come on them all of a sudden and catch them unawares. And they shall not be able to avert it. And they shall not be given any respite

41.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly Messengers before you were scoffed at. But then the thing they mocked about surrounded those of them who scoffed.

42.Mohammad Shafi: Ask them, "Who can guard you, by night and by day, from the Gracious One?" And, yet, they turn away at the mention of their Lord

43.Mohammad Shafi: Or, have they gods who can defend them against Us? They shall not be able to help themselves. Nor shall they have any benefit of association with Us

44.Mohammad Shafi: But, for a prolonged period in their lives, We did provide for them and their fathers with good things of life. Have they therefore become so complacent as not to see that We are closing in on them from all sides? And does their complacency make them think that they shall still prevail

45.Mohammad Shafi: Tell them, "I warn you only because I have been divinely instructed to do so." And the deaf do not hear the call howsoever much they are warned

46.Mohammad Shafi: And if punishment of your Lord were to touch them even slightly, they would certainly say, "O woe to us! We did indeed commit wrong."

47.Mohammad Shafi: And We will set up just scales for the Day of Resurrection, so no wrong shall be done to anyone. And if there be anything as little in weight as that of a mustard seed, We will present it nevertheless. And We are sufficiently proficient in keeping accounts

48.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We did give Moses and Aaron the Criterion, a Light, and a Book often to refer to for guidance to those who would fear Allah and be pious

49.Mohammad Shafi: Those that feared their Lord without seeing Him and were anxiously concerned about the Hour (marking the end of this world and heralding the Day of Judgment in the Hereafter)

50.Mohammad Shafi: And would you then deny that this (Qur'aan) is the blessed Book, often to refer to for guidance, We have now revealed

51.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We did give Abraham, before (Moses and Aaron), his firmly right conduct. And We were aware of thi

52.Mohammad Shafi: When he asked his father and his people, "What statues are these that you are so devoted to?"

53.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

54.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham said, "Certainly you had — you and your fathers — gone far astray."

55.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "Are you telling us the truth, or just making fun of us?"

56.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "But your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. It is He Who created them out of nothing. And I am of those who bear witness to this."

57.Mohammad Shafi: "And, by Allah! I will certainly do something to your idols after you go away, turning your backs."

58.Mohammad Shafi: So he broke those (idols) into pieces, except for the biggest of them, that they (polytheists) may turn to it (to inform them as to who did the destruction of the other idols)

59.Mohammad Shafi: They asked, "Who has done this to our gods? The one who did this is certainly one of those most wicked!"

60.Mohammad Shafi: Some said, "We had heard a youth called Abraham speaking about them."

61.Mohammad Shafi: The others said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people. Let all witness."

62.Mohammad Shafi: The polytheists said, "Have you done this to our gods, O Abraham!?"

63.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham said, "Nay, it is this one — the chief of them — that has done it. So ask them, if they can speak coherently!"

64.Mohammad Shafi: Then, turning to themselves, they said, "You yourselves indeed are in the wrong."

65.Mohammad Shafi: And, their heads hanging down, they said to Abraham, "You do know they do not speak."

66.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham said, "Do you then worship, besides Allah, that which brings you no benefit at all, and no harm either?"

67.Mohammad Shafi: "Fie on you and on that which you worship besides Allah! Why do you not use your intellect?"

68.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "Put him in the fire and help your gods, if you are going to do anything."

69.Mohammad Shafi: WE ordered, "O fire! Be you a source of cool comfort and peace on Abraham."

70.Mohammad Shafi: And they had designed a plot against him, but We made them themselves the doomed ones

71.Mohammad Shafi: And We saved him and Lot and led them to the land in which We had placed Our blessings for all

72.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave him Isaac — and, in addition, Jacob — and We made them righteous

73.Mohammad Shafi: And We made them leaders who guided people by Our command. And We revealed to them how good deeds are done, how prayers are performed, and how charities are given. And Us certainly they obeyed

74.Mohammad Shafi: And Lot — We gave him wisdom and knowledge. And We delivered him from the town that did bad things. They were indeed a wicked, transgressing people (indulging in the sin of homosexuality).h

75.Mohammad Shafi: And We took him (Lot) under Our mercy. He was indeed one of the righteous men

76.Mohammad Shafi: And Noah — when he called out in an earlier period, We answered him, and delivered him and his family from the acute suffering (of drowning)

77.Mohammad Shafi: And We helped him against the people who rejected Our Verses/signs. They were indeed a wicked people, and so We drowned them all

78.Mohammad Shafi: And David and Solomon — when they gave their judgments in the matter of the field wherein the sheep of some people pastured by night. And We bore witness to their judgments.h

79.Mohammad Shafi: And We made Solomon to understand the problem better; but We gave wisdom and knowledge to each one of them. And We made the mountains, and the birds to sing Our praise with David (in the Psalms ). And We did all that

80.Mohammad Shafi: And We taught him (David) how to make for you armours that fortify you in your battles. Are you then grateful?

81.Mohammad Shafi: And to Solomon We made subservient the stormy wind, which blew at his command to the land We had blessed. And We did know all things

82.Mohammad Shafi: And of the devils there were those who dived for him and did other work besides. And We were guardians over them

83.Mohammad Shafi: And Job — as he cried to his Lord, "A calamity indeed it is that has afflicted me! And You are the most Merciful."

84.Mohammad Shafi: And We responded to him and removed whatever affliction he had. And We gave him his family, and as many more with them, out of mercy from Us and for Allah's worshippers to remember

85.Mohammad Shafi: And Ishmael and Idris and Zulkifl — they were all of those who were patient

86.Mohammad Shafi: And We admitted them to Our Mercy. They were indeed among the righteous people

87.Mohammad Shafi: And the man of the fish — when he went away in anger, thinking We would not punish him! Then, among the darknesses (of the fish belly), he cried, "There is no god but You, glorified You are! I have indeed been of those who do wrong."

88.Mohammad Shafi: Then We responded to him and delivered him from the grief. And thus do We deliver those who believe

89.Mohammad Shafi: And Zachariah — when he cried to his Lord, "O my Lord! Leave me not alone (without an heir). And You are the best of inheritors."

90.Mohammad Shafi: And We responded to him and gave him John (Yahya) and made his wife fit to bear the child. They did indeed try to surpass one another in deeds of goodness and they prayed to Us in hope and fear. And they were humble before Us

91.Mohammad Shafi: And the lady (Mary) — who guarded her chastity, and We breathed into her of Our spirit and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds

92.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed this community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord! So worship Me

93.Mohammad Shafi: And they tore apart their (common) duty (of worshipping the sole Creator) among themselves. All shall return to Us

94.Mohammad Shafi: Then one who performs some good deeds, and is a believer too — there shall be no concealment of his/her efforts! And surely indeed We will record it (the good deeds)

95.Mohammad Shafi: And an injunction against any village/town that We have destroyed: they shall not return

96.Mohammad Shafi: Until the time Gog and Magoghare let loose and they descend from every prominent position

97.Mohammad Shafi: And the true promise (of Resurrection) shall draw nigh. Then lo! The eyes of those who suppressed the Truth shall open wide in fear. They shall say, "O woe to us! We certainly were heedless of this; nay, we were wicked."

98.Mohammad Shafi: You and what you worship besides Allah are indeed the fuel of Hell-fire; to it you shall come

99.Mohammad Shafi: Had these been gods, they would not have come to it (Hell) and all shall be there eternally

100.Mohammad Shafi: For them therein wailing and they therein shall not hear.

101.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed those for whom the good has already gone forth from Us shall be kept far off from it (Hell)

102.Mohammad Shafi: They will not hear its (Hell's) faintest sound, and they shall for ever be in what they desire

103.Mohammad Shafi: The great fearful event shall not grieve them, and the angels shall meet and tell them, "This is your promised Day!"

104.Mohammad Shafi: The Day We roll up heaven like the scroll of records is rolled up! As did We originate the first creation, so shall We revive it! A promise binding on Us. We will indeed fulfill it

105.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We did write in the Zabur, after the recounting of events, that My righteous worshippers shall inherit the earth

106.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed in this is a message for people who worship

107.Mohammad Shafi: And We have hot sent you but as a Mercy to the worlds.

108.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "It is revealed to me that the Entity Whom you all ought to worship is but One and Only [Allah]! Will you then submit?"

109.Mohammad Shafi: But if they turn back, say, "I have given you a warning in fairness and I know not what you are warned of is near or far."

110.Mohammad Shafi: "HE does indeed know what is spoken openly and He knows what you hide."

111.Mohammad Shafi: "And I know not but this (your life in this world) may be a trial for you and a provision to enjoy for a time."

112.Mohammad Shafi: He (the Prophet) said, "O my Lord! Decide justly (between me and my recalcitrant people). And our Lord is the Gracious One — the One Whose help is sought against what you (the recalcitrant people) say."

1.Mohammad Shafi: O people! Fear your Lord. Indeed, the cataclysm of the Hour is a trmendous thing

2.Mohammad Shafi: That day, were you to witness it, every woman giving suck shall abandon what she suckled, and every pregnant woman shall abort what she bore. And you would see humans appear intoxicated, and they shall not be intoxicated. But the cataclysmic Act of Allah will be so severe (as to make them appear intoxicated)

3.Mohammad Shafi: And among mankind, one who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious satan

4.Mohammad Shafi: Against such a one, it is ordained that he/she shall lead astray — and guide towards the punishment of the Fire — whoever takes him/her for a very close friend (wali)

5.Mohammad Shafi: O mankind! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then — to make things clear to you — We did indeed create you from dust, then from a little seed of fertilized ovum, then from a leech-like clinging clot of curdled blood, then from a chewed-like lump of flesh (foetus) with formed and unformed parts. And We facilitate what We will in the wombs till an appointed time, and then We bring you out as babies. Then We facilitate conditions for you to attain to your maturity. And of you is he who is made to die, and of you is he who is reduced to the worst part of life (very old age), so that he does not remember anything of the knowledge he had acquired earlier. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down the water on it, it stirs to life and flourishes and produces every kind of a beautiful spouse of herbage.

6.Mohammad Shafi: That (Resurrection) is bound to happen because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He has power over all things

7.Mohammad Shafi: And because the Hour is coming and there is no doubt about it; and because Allah shall raise up those who are in the graves

8.Mohammad Shafi: And among mankind there is such a one as disputes about Allah without knowledge, without guidance and without an enlightening book.h

9.Mohammad Shafi: Such a one turns his face away in pride from divine guidance that he may lead others astray from Allah's Path. For him is disgrace in this world. And on the Day of Resurrection We will make him taste punishment in the Hell

10.Mohammad Shafi: "This punishment is for what your two hands have sent before." And remember that Allah is not in the least unjust to those whom He has created for His worship

11.Mohammad Shafi: And among mankind is he who worships Allah sitting on the fence. Then if anything good happens to him he is satisfied with that. But if he is put to trial with some adversity he turns his face away in disgust. He is doomed here and he is doomed in the Hereafter. That is the doom manifest

12.Mohammad Shafi: He prays to someone — other than Allah — who can neither harm nor benefit him. That is going far, far astray

13.Mohammad Shafi: He prays to him whose harm is closer than his benefit. Evil certainly is such guardian and evil certainly is such associate

14.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will indeed cause those who believe and do good deeds to enter gardens beneath which rivers flow. Allah does indeed do what He wills

15.Mohammad Shafi: If anyone thinks that Allah does not help him in this life and the Hereafter, let him reach out to the heavens by means available to him, then (study its functions meticulously by) cutting himself off (his earthly connection), and then see if his obstinacy gets rid of its severity

16.Mohammad Shafi: And thus have We revealed it (the Qur'aan) with Verses made clear. And Allah it is Who guides whom He wills

17.Mohammad Shafi: Those who believe (in the Qur'aan) and those who are Jews and the Saabieen and theh Christians and the Magians (Zoroastrians or Parsis or fire-worshippers) and the polytheists — Allah will indeed decide between them on the day of Resurrection. Allah indeed is a witness to all things.

18.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that it is Allah to Whom prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever in the earth — the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the living creatures and many among mankind. And among mankind there are many upon whom punishment has become due. And whomsoever Allah abases, there is none who can make him honourable. Allah does indeed do what He wills

19.Mohammad Shafi: These are two adversaries who dispute about their Lord. And garments of fire shall be cut out for those who suppress the Truth, with boiling water being poured over their heads

20.Mohammad Shafi: What there is in their bellies, and skins, shall be melted therewith

21.Mohammad Shafi: And for them there shall be cages of iron

22.Mohammad Shafi: Whenever they will, in their anguish, desire to go out from it, they shall be pushed back into it and told, "Taste punishment by the Fire."

23.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will indeed admit those who believe and do good deeds into gardens beneath which rivers flow. They shall be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein shall be of silk

24.Mohammad Shafi: And they will be guided to say good things while speaking and they will be guided onto the Path of the Praised One

25.Mohammad Shafi: As regards those indeed who suppress the Truth and hinder people away from Allah's Path and from the Sacred Place of Worship — which We have made open equally for all mankind, for the local resident as well as for the visitor — We shall make him taste a painful punishment who intends making unjust and wrongful deviations therein.

26.Mohammad Shafi: And when We assigned to Abraham the location of the House (at Makkah), Allah told him, "Worship not anyone but Me, and sanctify My House for those who take the rounds thereof and stand in prayer and bow and prostrate."

27.Mohammad Shafi: And proclaim among mankind the duty of performing the Pilgrimage. Let them come to you on foot and on every means of conveyance. They will come from every distant broad way

28.Mohammad Shafi: That they may witness benefits for themand take Allah's name, during days appointed, over what He has provided for them of the quadruped cattle. Then they eat thereof and feed the distressed, the needy

29.Mohammad Shafi: Then let them attend to personal hygiene like cutting superfluous hair and nails, and let them fulfil their vows (like praying for their near and dear ones back home) and let them take rounds of the Ancient House

30.Mohammad Shafi: And so it is better for anyone, in the eyes of his Lord, that he honours Allah's injunctions. And the cattle — except for what are mentioned to you — are made lawful for you. Avoid then the abomination of the idols and utter no falsehood

31.Mohammad Shafi: Stand firm and upright for Allah, and worship none but Him. And he who worships anyone/anything besides Allah, it is as though he had fallen from the skies, and the bird has snatched him away or the wind carried him off to a distant place.h

32.Mohammad Shafi: And so when anyone honours the sacred rites/signs sanctioned by Allah, then it is of the acts that make hearts pious

33.Mohammad Shafi: You have benefits in them (cattle brought for sacrifice during the Hajj) for a time, and then their destination is the Ancient House

34.Mohammad Shafi: And for every community We appointed a sacrificial rite that they may remember and mention Allah's name over what He has given them of the quadruped cattle. The Entity worthy of your worship then is One and Only. So to Him you all should submit. And give good tidings to the humble

35.Mohammad Shafi: Those whose hearts tremble when Allah is mentioned, and those who are patienth over what afflicts them, and those who keep up the prayer as prescribed, and spend appropriately (as prescribed in the Qur'aan) out of what We have given them

36.Mohammad Shafi: And the camel! We have made it one of those things (emblems) through which one could come to know Allah. And there is much good in it for you. Mention Allah's name over it as it is lined up (for its sacrifice during the Hajj), and then when it falls down on its sides, eat therefrom and feed the contented as well as the poor. We have thus made it subservient to you, in order that you be grateful

37.Mohammad Shafi: Its (the sacrificed animal's) flesh reaches not Allah, nor does its blood. But it is your piety that reaches Him. He has thus made it subservient to you, in order that you may glorify Allah for what He has gifted to you. And give glad tidings to those who do handsome good deeds

38.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does indeed repel evil from those who believe. Allah indeed does not love any one who is unfaithful, ungrateful

39.Mohammad Shafi: Permission to fight back is given to those who are wrongfully attacked. And indeed Allah is certainly capable of helping them

40.Mohammad Shafi: Those that have been displaced from their homes unjustly just because they say, "Our Lord is Allah." And had Allah not withstood some with others among mankind, certainly then monastries and churches and synagogues and masajid, in which Allah's name is much remembered, would have been pulled down. And surely Allah will help him who helps His cause. Certainly indeed Allah is Strong, Powerful

41.Mohammad Shafi: Those who will establish prayer, spend in charity, enjoin good and forbid evil, once We give them a foothold in the land. And with Allah is the end of all matters

42.Mohammad Shafi: And if they reject you, then so did the people of Noah and AAad and Thamood, before them, reject

43.Mohammad Shafi: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

44.Mohammad Shafi: And those that lived in Madyan (Midian in Hebrew). And Moses was rejected. I let the suppressors of Truth enjoy for a while, and then I seized them. And how severe in effect was My forsaking them

45.Mohammad Shafi: And many a town/village We did destroy when it committed injustices. And it lay in ruins with its roofs coming down.. And many a well and lofty castle were deserted

46.Mohammad Shafi: Why do they not so conduct themselves on the earth as to have minds with which to understand, or ears with which to hear? For, surely, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the minds that are in the heads, which are blind.

47.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask you to hasten with the punishment; and Allah is not the One to fail in His promise. And, indeed, a day with your Lord is a thousand years as you keep count of time

48.Mohammad Shafi: And how many an unjust town/village had I been indulgent to and patient with! And then I seized it!! And to Me is the final destination

49.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "O people! I am here only to give you a plain warning."

50.Mohammad Shafi: Those then that believe and do good deeds — they shall have forgiveness and a liberal provision

51.Mohammad Shafi: And those who strive to get the better of (or defeat the purpose of) Our Verses/signs — they shall be the inmates of the Hell

52.Mohammad Shafi: And no Messenger, nor Prophet, did we send before you, but when he delivered the divine Message to the people, the Satan cast doubts into that Message. And Allah blots out that which the Satan casts, and then does Allah make His Verses/signs prevail. And Allah is Knowledgeable, Wise

53.Mohammad Shafi: So that He may make what the Satan casts a temptation for those in whose hearts is a disease, and the means for hardening their hearts. And indeed the wrongdoers are in a state of extreme rebellion

54.Mohammad Shafi: And so that those endowed with the knowledge know that it is the truth from your Lord, and so they believe in it and their hearts do humbly submit to it. And Allah is certainly indeed the Guide, of those who believe, towards a straight path

55.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth shall not cease to be in doubt concerning it until, suddenly, the Hourcomes upon them, or, there comes upon them the torment of a day, any remedial action wherein would be fruitless

56.Mohammad Shafi: The sovereignty that day shall be absolutely Allah's; He will judge between them. And those who believe and do good deeds will be in gardens of bliss

57.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth and reject Our Verses/signs — for those will there be a disgraceful punishment

58.Mohammad Shafi: And those who migrate in Allah's way and are then killed or they die, them shall Allah give the best of provisions. And indeed Allah it is Who is the Best of the providers

59.Mohammad Shafi: He will certainly admit them to a place which they shall be well pleased with. And Allah is indeed Knowledgeable, Gentle and Kind

60.Mohammad Shafi: So shall that be! And Allah surely helps the one that retaliates to the extent one was wronged but then an excess is committed. Allah is certainly indeed Lenient, Forgiving.

61.Mohammad Shafi: That is because Allah causes the night to enter into the day and causes the day to enter into the night, and because Allah hears, sees

62.Mohammad Shafi: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they pray to besides Him — that is the falsehood. And because, Allah is the One that is high, the One that is great

63.Mohammad Shafi: Don't you see that Allah sends down water from the skies and then the earth becomes green? Allah is indeed meticulous, well-informed

64.Mohammad Shafi: His it is whatsoever there is in the heavens and whatsoever there is in the earth! And Allah indeed it is that surely is the Self-sufficient One, the Praised One

65.Mohammad Shafi: Don't you see that Allah has made everything in the earth subservient to you? And the ship sails on the sea by His command. And He keeps the heavens from falling on the earth, except with His leave. Allah is indeed Kind and Merciful to men

66.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who has brought you to life, He will then cause you to die, and then again He will bring you to life. Certainly indeed man is ungrateful

67.Mohammad Shafi: For every community We devised rites for them to observe. They should not therefore raise a dispute with you in the matter. And do invite them to your Lord! You are indeed on right guidance.h

68.Mohammad Shafi: And if they quarrel with you, say, "Allah knows what you do."

69.Mohammad Shafi: Allah will judge between you on the Day of Resurrection on matters in which you differ

70.Mohammad Shafi: Don't you know that Allah knows what is there in the heaven and the earth? That is indeed recorded in a book. That is indeed easy for Allah

71.Mohammad Shafi: And they worship, other than Allah, that for which He has sent no authority, and about which they have no knowledge. And no help shall avail those who indulge in wrong-doing

72.Mohammad Shafi: And when Our clear Verses are read out to them you will find denial in the faces of those who suppress the Truth. They well-nigh assault those who read out Our Verses to them. Say, "Shall I tell you what is worse than this? The Fire! Allah has promised it to those who suppress the Truth. And it's a horrible place to go to!"

73.Mohammad Shafi: O mankind! An example is given; listen to it: Those, whom you pray to besides Allah, cannot create a fly, even though they combine together for the purpose. And if the fly snatches away something from them, they have no power to get that something released from the fly. Weak are the seeker and the sought, both

74.Mohammad Shafi: They have not given Allah the Credit due to Him! Allah is indeed Strong, Mighty

75.Mohammad Shafi: Allah chooses Messengers from among the angels and from among mankind. Allah does indeed hear, He does indeed see

76.Mohammad Shafi: HE knows what is before them and what is behind them. And to Allah are all matters returned

77.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Bow and prostrate and worship your Lord. And do that which is good so that you may achieve success

78.Mohammad Shafi: And strive in Allah's way, as one ought to strive in His way. HE has chosen you [the pronoun is in plural] and has not laid upon you any severity in following the way of life approved by Him for you — the lifestyle of your forefather Abraham. HE named you as the Muslims before and in this (Qur'aan), so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over mankind. Hence, pray to Allah regularly and properly, give charity and hold fast unto Him! HE is your Guardian. How excellent the Guardian, and how excellent the Supporter!h

13.Mohammad Shafi: Then We made him/her a small seed (fertilized ovum) dropped into a resting-place, secure and compact

Blessed then is Allah, the Best of the creators

15.Mohammad Shafi: Then, after that, you will indeed certainly die

16.Mohammad Shafi: Then, on the day of Resurrection, you shall indeed be raised from the dead

17.Mohammad Shafi: And We did make above you seven layers. And We have not ever been heedless about what We have created.

18.Mohammad Shafi: And We send down water from the sky in measured quantities, then We cause it to settle down in the earth. And We can indeed certainly make it evaporate

19.Mohammad Shafi: Then We bring up thereby gardens of date-palm and grapes for you. There are plenty of fruits for you to eat, in those gardens

20.Mohammad Shafi: And a tree (olive) that grows out around Mount Sinai and produces oil and condiment for those who use these in their food

21.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly indeed there is a pointer for you in the cattle. We provide for you a drink out of what their bellies contain. And you have in them many benefits. And from them you get meat to eat

22.Mohammad Shafi: And on them and on the ships you are carried

23.Mohammad Shafi: And We did certainly send Noah to his people. And he said, "O my people! Worship Allah, you have no god other than Him. Will you not then fear Him?"

24.Mohammad Shafi: And then the leaders of those who suppressed the Truth from among his people said, "He is nothing but a man, like you. He desires to gain superiority over you. And if Allah had willed, He could certainly have sent down angels. We have not heard of such a thing happening during our forefathers' time."

25.Mohammad Shafi: "He is just a mad man. So keep a watch over him for some time."

26.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "My Lord! Help me; for, they have rejected me."

27.Mohammad Shafi: We then revealed our instructions to him: "Build the Ark under Our supervision and revealed instructions. And when, at Our command, the surface of the earth starts overflowing with water, put into it (Ark) two of every pair, and members of your family, except those among them against whom the Word (Allah's decree) has already been issued. And do not plead with Me on behalf of those who are cruel. They shall indeed be drowned."

28.Mohammad Shafi: "And when you and those with you go on board the Ark, say, `Praise is to Allah Who delivered us from the cruel people.'"

29.Mohammad Shafi: "And say, `My Lord! Take me to a blessed destination. And You are the One to take us to the best destination.'"

30.Mohammad Shafi: Surely indeed there are signs in this. And surely, We do put people on trial

31.Mohammad Shafi: Then We raised up after them another generation

32.Mohammad Shafi: And We sent to them a Messenger from among them to tell them, "Worship Allah! You have no god other than Him. Will you not then take heed?"

33.Mohammad Shafi: And the leaders of those among his people who suppressed the Truth and considered the appointment in the hereafter a lie, and to whom We had afforded ease and comfort in the life this world, said, "This is none but a man like you! He eats of what you eat from and drinks of what you drink."

34.Mohammad Shafi: "And if you obey but a man like you, then surely you are doomed."

35.Mohammad Shafi: "Does he promise you that when you are dead and become dust and bones you shall then be brought out alive!?"

36.Mohammad Shafi: "What you are promised of is utterly nonsense."

37.Mohammad Shafi: "There is nothing but our life in this world. We die and we live. And we shall not be raised again."

38.Mohammad Shafi: "He is none other than a man who has forged a lie against Allah. And we are not going to believe in him."

39.Mohammad Shafi: He (the Messenger) said, "O my Lord, help me! For, they have rejected me."

40.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Soon they shall be regretful."

41.Mohammad Shafi: So the divine punishment caught up with them fairly and squarely. And We turned them into rubble. And so, the wicked people perished

42.Mohammad Shafi: Then We raised, after them, other generations

43.Mohammad Shafi: They cannot bring about the end of a community before the appointed time, nor can they delay it

44.Mohammad Shafi: Then We sent Our Messengers one after another. Whenever their Messenger came to a people, they denied he was the divine Messenger sent to them. So We made one community succeed another to doom and We got them mentioned in tales. And so, people, who believed not, perished

45.Mohammad Shafi: And then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron, with Our signs and a clear mandate

46.Mohammad Shafi: We sent them to Pharaoh and his chieftains, but they behaved haughtily and they were an egoist people

47.Mohammad Shafi: And they said, "What! Shall we believe in two men like us and their people are in our service?"

48.Mohammad Shafi: So they rejected the two and became of those who were destroyed

49.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Moses the Book to guide them

50.Mohammad Shafi: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign. And We gave them shelter on a lofty quiet ground with springs

51.Mohammad Shafi: Allah told every Messenger, "Eat of the things that are good and wholesome, and act righteously. I do indeed know what you do."

52.Mohammad Shafi: "And, indeed, this community of yours, is one single community. And I am the Lord of you all! Do take due heed of Me, then."

53.Mohammad Shafi: But they divided themselves into communities pursuing different ways scripturewise. People of every sect are happy with what they have.

54.Mohammad Shafi: So leave them with their delusions for a while

55.Mohammad Shafi: Do they think that by helping them with wealth and children

56.Mohammad Shafi: We are giving good things to them in a hurry? Nay, they do not perceive (that Allah is only testing them therewith)

57.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed those that are, out of fear of their Lord, on their guard against evil

58.Mohammad Shafi: And those that believe in the Verses/signs of their Lord

59.Mohammad Shafi: And those that do not worship anything or anyone other than their Lord

60.Mohammad Shafi: And those that give what they should, with their hearts apprehending that they are bound to return to their Lord some day

61.Mohammad Shafi: Those are the ones that hasten to do good things and they are in the forefront in doing them

62.Mohammad Shafi: And We do not lay on anyone a burden except to the extent he/she can bear. And with Us is a Book that speaks the truth. And they shall not be wronged

63.Mohammad Shafi: Nay, they are deluded about this. And, besides, they have other things to do

64.Mohammad Shafi: Until, when We punish the affluent among them, they cry foul

65.Mohammad Shafi: Cry not this day! You shall indeed not be given any help from Us

66.Mohammad Shafi: My Verses were certainly recited to you, but you used to turn back on your heel

67.Mohammad Shafi: To ridicule the Verses in nocturnal confabulations

68.Mohammad Shafi: Is it then that they do not understand the Word, or is it that there has come to them that which did not come to their forefathers

69.Mohammad Shafi: Or, are they not acquainted with their Messenger, and so they deny him?h

70.Mohammad Shafi: Or do they say he is possessed? Nay! He has brought them the Truth, and most of them are averse to the Truth

71.Mohammad Shafi: And should the Truth follow their passions, there would certainly be chaos in the heavens and the earth and in everything therein. But We have brought them their Reminder, and from their Reminder they turn aside

72.Mohammad Shafi: Or, do you ask them for recompense? But the recompense of your Lord is the best! And He is the best of those who provide sustenance

73.Mohammad Shafi: And you do indeed invite them to the Straight Path

74.Mohammad Shafi: And those who do not believe in the Hereafter do indeed deviate from the Path

75.Mohammad Shafi: And if We show them mercy and free them of the distress they have, they would still blindly continue with their transgressions

76.Mohammad Shafi: And We did certainly punish them, but they did not become humble towards their Lord, nor do they submit.

77.Mohammad Shafi: Until when We open upon them a door to severe punishment, they are despaired

78.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who gave you the ears and the eyes and the minds. You thank but little

79.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who multiplied you on the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered

80.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is Who gives life and causes death. And alternation of the night and the day is His handiwork. Do you not then understand

81.Mohammad Shafi: But they say the like of what the earlier peoples said

82.Mohammad Shafi: They say, "Are we certain to be raised again to life when we are dead and become dust and bones!?"

83.Mohammad Shafi: "This promise given to us now was also certainly given to our forefathers. These are nothing but stories of the ancients."

85.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Why do you not remember [and worship Him alone] then?"

86.Mohammad Shafi: Ask, "Who is the Lord of the seven heavens and the Lord of the mighty Throne?"

87.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "Allah's." Ask, "Will you not then take heed of Him

88.Mohammad Shafi: Ask, "Who is it in Whose hand is the absolute control of all things and Who shelters, but Who needs none to shelter Him, if you do but know?"

89.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "Allah." Ask, "How then are you deluded into worshipping someone/thing other than Him?"

90.Mohammad Shafi: But We have brought them the Truth, and certainly indeed they are lying

91.Mohammad Shafi: Never did Allah take to Himself a son, and never was there with him any other god! In that case every god would certainly have taken away what he created. And they would certainly have tried to overpower one another. Glorified is Allah above what they attribute to Him

92.Mohammad Shafi: The Knower of the unseen and the seen, He is exalted far above what they worship other than Him

93.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "My Lord! If You should make me see what they are warned against"

94.Mohammad Shafi: "My Lord, place me not then with the wicked people!"

95.Mohammad Shafi: And We can certainly indeed make you see what We warn them against

96.Mohammad Shafi: Dispel evil with what is good! We do know what they say

97.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "My Lord! I seek refuge in You against satanic promptings."

98.Mohammad Shafi: "And I seek refuge in You, my Lord, lest they approach me."

99.Mohammad Shafi: Wicked people continue with their misdeeds until when death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord! Send me back."

100.Mohammad Shafi: "So that I may do good deeds in what I have left behind." Nay! It is just a wishful utterance that he makes. And before them is a barrier until the day they are raised

101.Mohammad Shafi: So when the trumpet is blown on the Resurrection Day, there shall be no ties of relationship between them, nor shall they ask of one another

102.Mohammad Shafi: Then all those are the successful ones who are heavy with good deeds

103.Mohammad Shafi: And those that are light in good deeds are the ones who have doomed themselves to live in Hell

104.Mohammad Shafi: The fire shall scorch their faces, and their lips therein shall be distorted in pain

105.Mohammad Shafi: Were not My Verses/signs recited to you and you rejected them?

106.Mohammad Shafi: They would say, "Our Lord! It was our misfortune that made us a people gone astray."

107.Mohammad Shafi: "Our Lord! Take us out of it. And if we return to evil ways as before, then we shall indeed be doing wrong."

108.Mohammad Shafi: The Lord shall say, "Get doomed therein! And speak to Me not!"

109.Mohammad Shafi: "There was indeed a group of My subjects who said, `Our Lord! We do believe. So forgive us and have mercy on us. And You are the Best Bestower of mercies.'"

110.Mohammad Shafi: "But you held them so much in ridicule that you forgot to remember Me. And you continued laughing at them!"

111.Mohammad Shafi: "Because they were patient, I have indeed rewarded them by making them (— and not you —) the winners this Day."

112.Mohammad Shafi: The Lord would ask, "How many years did you stay in the earth?"

113.Mohammad Shafi: They would say, "We stayed a day or part of a day. We are not sure. So ask those who keep count."

114.Mohammad Shafi: The Lord would say, "You did stay but a little — had you but known it."

115.Mohammad Shafi: "Did you then think that We had created you as an idle pursuit and that you shall not be returned to Us!?"

116.Mohammad Shafi: So, exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign! There is no god but He, the Lord of the noble Throne

117.Mohammad Shafi: And he who prays to Allah, as also to another god besides Him, does have no evidence of any such god existing. So his case rests with his Lord only. The suppressors of the Truth shall indeed not succeed

118.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "Forgive, my Lord, and have mercy! And You are the best Bestower of mercies."

And as for those who ask for a writ of freedom from among those whom your right hands possess (slaves), give them the writ if you know them to be good and worthy. The glass, as it were, a bright star, fuelled by a blessed tree of olive, neither of east nor of west, oil of which would glow forth even when no fire touched it! Light over light! Allah guides to His Light whom He wills. And Allah makes use of similitudes for mankind. And Allah is aware of everything!to

38.Mohammad Shafi: So that Allah may give them the best reward for what they have done, and give them more out of His grace. And Allah provides for those whom He pleases without measure

42.Mohammad Shafi: And to Allah belongs the absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the final destination
