46.Mohammad Shafi: We have certainly sent down Verses/signs making things clear, and Allah guides whom He pleases to the Right Path

47.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger and we obey." Then, after this, a section of them turns back. And these are not believers

48.Mohammad Shafi: And when they are called to Allah and His Messenger that he may establish a rule of law among them, then a section of them turns away

49.Mohammad Shafi: And if the truth lies on their side, they come to him obediently

50.Mohammad Shafi: Is there in their hearts a disease, or are they in doubt, or do they fear that Allah and His Messenger will act wrongfully towards them? Nay! They themselves are the wrong-doers

51.Mohammad Shafi: The only response of the believers — when they are invited to Allah and His Messenger that he (Messenger) may establish a rule of law among them — is to say, "We hear and we obey." And these it is that are successful

52.Mohammad Shafi: And he who obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah, and holds Him in awe — such are the ones that attain their goals

53.Mohammad Shafi: And they swear by Allah most solemnly that if you command them they would certainly come out (in Allah's path). Say, "Swear not! Due compliance (is the thing required). Allah is indeed aware of what you do."

54.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you do not, then he (Messenger) is responsible for the duty allotted to him only, and you, for what is allotted to you. And if you obey him, you are on the Right Way; and the Messenger is responsible for nothing but clear/truthful delivery of the divine Message."

55.Mohammad Shafi: Allah has promised to those of you who believe and do good deeds that He will most certainly give them the authority to rule in the earth on His behalf as He had given those before them the authority. And Allah has further promised that He will most certainly establish for them their religion which He has chosen for them, and that He will most certainly change their sense of fear with the sense of security. Let them just worship Me, and not worship any other being/thing besides Me. And whoever suppresses the Truth after this, such are the ones that transgress/rebel/pervert/profligate

56.Mohammad Shafi: And establish the prescribedh prayer and give the Zakathand obey the Messenger, so that mercy may be shown to you

57.Mohammad Shafi: Think not that those who suppress the Truth shall escape (from Allah) on the earth. And their abode is the Fire. And evil certainly is that destination

58.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Let those whom your right hands possess (slaves/servants) and those of you who have not attained to puberty ask permission of you three times: before the Morning Prayer, whenever you take off your clothes (for rest) at noon, and after the Evening Prayer. These are three times of privacy for you. No restriction on you or on them at other times. Some of you have to be around others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the Verses, and Allah is Knowledgeable, Wise

59.Mohammad Shafi: And when children among you reach the age of puberty, let them seek permission as those (who had reached the age of puberty) before them sought permission. Thus does Allah makeh clear to you His Verses, and Allah is Knowledgeable, Wise

60.Mohammad Shafi: And it is no sin for women advanced in age — who do not hope for a marriage — to put off their clothes without displaying their beauty/charm. And if they restrain themselves it is better for them. And Allah hears, knows

61.Mohammad Shafi: There is no question of any blame on the blind, the lame, the sick, or you yourselves that you eat from your houses, or your fathers' houses or your mothers' houses, or your brothers' houses, or your sisters' houses, or your paternal uncles' houses, or your paternal aunts' houses, or your maternal uncles' houses, or your maternal aunts' houses, or houses you possess the keys of, or your friends' (houses). You incur no sin that you eat together or separately. So when you enter houses, greet one another with a blessed and good salutation from Allah. Thus does Allah make clear to you the Verses so that you understand these properly

62.Mohammad Shafi: Those only are believers who believe in Allah and His Messenger. And when they are with him (Messenger) on a community matter they go not away until they ask him for permission. Indeed, they who ask for your permission are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask for your permission for some personal work, give them permission at your discretion and pray to Allah for their forgiveness. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

63.Mohammad Shafi: Make not the Massenger's call among you to be like your call to one another. Allah indeed knows those who slip away surreptitiously from among you. So then let those who go against his counsel beware lest a trial or a painful punishment afflict them

64.Mohammad Shafi: Beware! To Allah certainly belongs everything that is in the heavens and the earth. Surely, He knows your condition. And the Day when they will be brought back to Him, He will inform them of what they did. And Allah knows all things

1.Mohammad Shafi: Blessed is He who has sent down the Criterion [Qur'aan] to His Devotee that he/it may serve as a warner to the worlds.

2.Mohammad Shafi: Blessed is He to Whom belongs the the absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth, He Who has begotten no children and has no partner in His sovereignty. It is He Who has created every thing and it is He Who has given it its role

3.Mohammad Shafi: And yet they have taken, besides Him, deities who create nothing and they themselves are created, and who have no power to harm or benefit themselves and who who have no power over death, life, or Resurrection

4.Mohammad Shafi: Those who suppress the Truth say, "This is only a self- concocted lie and others have helped him in concocting it." Verily, then, they have perpetrated an injustice and a falsehood

5.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "Fables of the ancients! He has had written these down which then are rehearsed to him morning and evening."

6.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "HE has sent it down Who knows every secret that is in the heavens and on the earth. He is indeed Forgiving, Merciful."

7.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "What kind of a Messenger is this who eats food and roams in the marketplaces!? Why has no angel been sent down with him to warn us?"

8.Mohammad Shafi: "Or no treasure been sent down to him, or no garden been provided to him from which to eat?" The wrongdoers further say, "You are not following but a man bewitched!"

9.Mohammad Shafi: See what kind of attributes they expect you to have. They have thus gone astray and cannot find the right way

10.Mohammad Shafi: Blessed is He who can give you, if He wills, better things than that: gardens under which rivers flow. And He can provide palaces for you

11.Mohammad Shafi: But they deny the Hour. We have prepared a blazing Fire for those who deny the Hour

12.Mohammad Shafi: When it (the Fire) sees them from afar, they will hear it raging and roaring

13.Mohammad Shafi: When they are thrown into a narrow space therein, chained together, they will plead for destruction (death, so that they become oblivious to their suffering in the Fire)

14.Mohammad Shafi: "Plead not this day for a single destruction, but plead for many!"

15.Mohammad Shafi: Ask, "Is this better, or the Paradise of immortality which the pious/righteous have been promised? It is their reward and their destination."

16.Mohammad Shafi: They shall forever have therein for them all that they desire. This is a promise frequently asked for of your Lord

17.Mohammad Shafi: On the Day He gathers them together with those they worship besides Him, He will ask, "Did you mislead these people whom I had created to worship Me, or did they stray away by themselves?"

18.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "Your Holiness! It was not proper for us to choose any of the awliya other than You. But You gave them and their fathers the comforts of this life so much that they forgot the Remembrance (of You and Your Message, the Qur'aan) and thus became a people doomed."

19.Mohammad Shafi: They have certainly then given the lie to all your pleas and you can neither ward off punishment nor get any help. And whoever of you has committed evil, he/she shall be made by Us to taste great punishment

20.Mohammad Shafi: We had not sent any Messengers before you who did not eat food and roam the market- places. We test some of you with others, whether you exercise patience. And your Lord monitors all things

21.Mohammad Shafi: And those who do not expect a meeting with Us say, "Why are angels not sent down to us or why do we not see our Lord?" They are certainly too proud of themselves and have greatly exceeded all bounds

22.Mohammad Shafi: There will be no good tidings for the guilty on the day they see the angels. And they will cry out for an invincible partition between them and the angels

23.Mohammad Shafi: And We shall proceed to turn all that they did into scattered dust

24.Mohammad Shafi: The inhabitants of the Garden will have the best abode and the finest place of rest on that Day

25.Mohammad Shafi: On a Day when the sky will split open with its clouds and the angels after angels are sent down

26.Mohammad Shafi: Sovereignty on that Day shall return defacto and dejure to the Gracious One. And it will be a hard Day for those who suppress the Truth

27.Mohammad Shafi: On that Day, the transgressor will bite his hands and say, "Would that I had walked the Messenger's path!"

28.Mohammad Shafi: "Oh would that I had never chosen such-and-such as my friend!"

29.Mohammad Shafi: "He made me stray away from Your Message after it had reached me. And the Satan is betrayer of mankind."

30.Mohammad Shafi: And the Messenger will say, "O my Lord! My people did indeed treat this Qur'aan as a thing abandoned."

31.Mohammad Shafi: And thus did We make to every prophet an inimical front from among the sinners; but your Lord is sufficient as Guide and Support

32.Mohammad Shafi: Those who suppress the Truth say, "Why was the Qur'aan not sent down to him all at once?" We did send it down thus so that We imbue your mind therewith. And We have arranged it in good order

33.Mohammad Shafi: No sooner do they come up with a problem than We bring you the truth behind and the best solution

34.Mohammad Shafi: Those who will be dragged headlong into Hell shall have an evil place to dwell in — and they had strayed away from the Right Path

35.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Moses the Book, and made his brother Aaron his assistant

36.Mohammad Shafi: We then told them both to go to the people who had denied Our signs. We then put those people to ruin

37.Mohammad Shafi: And We drowned the people of Noah when they rejected the Messengers and We made an example of them (the people) for all mankind. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the transgressors

38.Mohammad Shafi: For AAad, Thamood, and the people of al-Rass, and for many a generation between them

39.Mohammad Shafi: To every one of them We gave warning examples and every one of them We put to annihilation

40.Mohammad Shafi: And they must have certainly come upon the town/village on which had rained down an evil rain. How could they not have seen it? Yet they have no faith in the Resurrection

41.Mohammad Shafi: Whenever they see you, they hold you not but in contempt, saying, "Is this the one Allah has sent as His Messenger?"

42.Mohammad Shafi: "Indeed, he would almost have led us away from our deities, had we not stood firmly with them!" And when they experience the punishment, they shall realize who it is that had strayed from the path

43.Mohammad Shafi: Have you seen one who has taken one's own desire to be one'a god? Can you be a guardian over such a one

44.Mohammad Shafi: Do you think most of them can hear or understand? They are nothing but like cattle. Nay, they are those astray from the Path

45.Mohammad Shafi: Have you not observed how your Lord stretches the shadow? Had He pleased, He could have made it stationary. And We made the sun a guide over it

46.Mohammad Shafi: Then We withdraw it (shadow) to Us, an easy withdrawal

47.Mohammad Shafi: And it is He Who has made for you the night as mantle, the sleep for repose, and the day for rising

48.Mohammad Shafi: It is He who sends the winds as heralds bearing good news of His ensuing mercy and We send down pure water from the sky

49.Mohammad Shafi: We send down water so that We may bring life to a dead land and slake the thirst aplenty of Our creations of cattle and mankind

50.Mohammad Shafi: And We do distribute it (rainfall) among them so that they are gratefully aware thereof, but most of mankind respond not but in ingratitude

51.Mohammad Shafi: And if We had so willed, We would have certainly raised someone to warn, in every town/village

52.Mohammad Shafi: Do not yield then to those who suppress the Truth, but counter them strenuously by means of this [Qur'aan]

53.Mohammad Shafi: It is He who has facilitated two seas to flow and meet — one palatable and sweet and the other salty and bitter — and set up a barrier and an invincible partition between them.

54.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is who has created a human being from water and then made him a link in the human relationships by blood and marriage. And your Lord is all powerful

55.Mohammad Shafi: Yet they worship besides Allah others that can neither benefit nor harm them. And the suppressor of the Truth does ever turn his back on his Lord

56.Mohammad Shafi: And We have not sent you (Prophet Muhammad) but to give good news to those who believe in Allah and abide by His Guidance given in the Qur'aan and to warn those who believe not

57.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I do not ask you for anything in return for this except that anyone who so wishes should take the Right Path to his Lord."

58.Mohammad Shafi: And have trust on the Living [Allah] Who never dies, and glorify Him with His praise. And He is well conversant with the sins His subjects commit

59.Mohammad Shafi: It is He who created the heavens and the earth, and all besides that is in and around them, in six periods of time. HE then ascended the Throne of absolute power and authority. HE is the Gracious One. Do ask any informed person about Him

60.Mohammad Shafi: When they are told to prostrate before the Gracious One, they ask, "Who is this Gracious One? Are we to prostrate to whatever you order us?" And it increases their aversion

61.Mohammad Shafi: He is the bestower of blessings who has set constellations in the heavens, as also a lamp (sun) and a moon that give light (for the inhabitants of this earth)

62.Mohammad Shafi: And He it is who has made the night and the day succeed each other — for the one who would ponder or be grateful

63.Mohammad Shafi: And human beings obedient to the Gracious One are those who walk on earth with humility and when the ignorant speak to them, they say, "Peace."

64.Mohammad Shafi: And who spend the night for their Lord, lying down and standing.h

65.Mohammad Shafi: And who say, "Our Lord! Ward off from us the punishment of Hell. Its punishment is indeed atrocious."

66.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed, it is an evil abode and an evil position to be in

67.Mohammad Shafi: And they (human beings obedient to the Gracious One) are those who are neither spendthrift nor miserly, but keep to a position in between

68.Mohammad Shafi: And who invoke no deity besides Allah, nor kill anyone whose killing, without due authority, Allah has prohibited, nor indulge in extramarital sexual intercourse. And whoever does this, he/she commits a sin

69.Mohammad Shafi: He/she shall have his suffering doubled on the Day of Resurrection and shall remain humiliated therein forever

70.Mohammad Shafi: But for those who repent, believe, and do good deeds, Allah will change their evil deeds into good ones. And Allah is forgiving, merciful

71.Mohammad Shafi: And the one who repents and reforms, he/she then has indeed turned to Allah in repentance

72.Mohammad Shafi: And they (human beings obedient to the Gracious One) are those who do not give false evidence, and when they pass by frivolity, they pass by with dignity

73.Mohammad Shafi: And who, when reminded of the Verses/signs of their Lord, do not stumble upon them, deaf and blind

74.Mohammad Shafi: And who say, "Our Lord! Give us joy in our wives and our children and make us exemplary for the righteous."

75.Mohammad Shafi: These are the ones who will be rewarded with high position because of their endurance. They will be welcomed therein with greetings and salutations of peace

76.Mohammad Shafi: They shall live there forever — the best place to reside in and the best position to be in

77.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Why would my Lord care for you, if you do not pray to and invoke Him? Verily then you have rejected the Truth. So soon shall the inevitable happen!"

1.Mohammad Shafi: Ta. Sin. Mim

2.Mohammad Shafi: These are Verses of the Book that gives clear guidance.

3.Mohammad Shafi: Would you (Prophet Muhammad) kill yourself because they do not believe

4.Mohammad Shafi: Had We so willed, We could have sent down to them a Message from on high, and then their necks would submissively bow to it

5.Mohammad Shafi: And no new aspect of divinity comes to them from the Gracious One, but they turn away from it

6.Mohammad Shafi: Then they did deny it (the Zikr) as false. But soon there will come to them the true information as to what it was that they used to scoff at

7.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not have a look at the earth to see how We grow therein produce of every noble kind

8.Mohammad Shafi: Therein indeed is a sign. And most of them will not believe

9.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, your Lord is certainly the One Who is Omnipotent, Merciful

10.Mohammad Shafi: And when your Lord called out to Moses: "Go to those wicked people."

11.Mohammad Shafi: "Go to the people of Pharaoh! They fear not (the inevitable consequence of being wicked)!"

12.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "My Lord! I do indeed fear they may not believe me,"

13.Mohammad Shafi: "And my heart is straitened and my tongue not fluent. So then send this command to (my brother) Aaron."

14.Mohammad Shafi: "And, they have a criminal charge against me, so I fear they will kill me."

15.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Worry not about it! Go then to them, both of you, with Our signs/messages. We shall indeed be with you, ever listening

16.Mohammad Shafi: And when, both of you, come before Pharaoh, tell him, `We are indeed sent by the Lord of the worlds "

17.Mohammad Shafi: "So you let the children of Israel go with us!'"

18.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "Did we not bring you up amongst us as a child? And did you not spend among us years of your life?"

19.Mohammad Shafi: And you did what you did, and you remain ungrateful (that we have not punished you)!"

20.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "I did it while I was among those who go astray."

21.Mohammad Shafi: "And I fled from you because I feared you. And then my Lord bestowed me with a command and made me one of the Messengers."

22.Mohammad Shafi: "And is this a favour you did me — that you had enslaved the children of Israel?"

23.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said: "And who is `Lord of the worlds'?"

24.Mohammad Shafi: Moses replied, "Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between them, if you would but be convinced!"

25.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said to those around him: "Do you hear?"

26.Mohammad Shafi: Moses continued, "Your Lord, and Lord of your forefathers!"

27.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh interjected, "Indeed, your `Messenger' who has been sent to you is certainly mad!"

28.Mohammad Shafi: Moses went on, "Lord of the east and the west and of all that is between the two if you would but understand!"

29.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh Said, "Verily, if you have any deity other than me, I shall certainly put you into prison!"

30.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "Even if I bring to you clear evidence?"

31.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "Produce it, then, if you are a man of truth!"

32.Mohammad Shafi: Moses then threw down his staff, and it became a veritable serpent

33.Mohammad Shafi: And he drew out his hand, and it appeared white to the beholders

34.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said to the chieftains around him: "Indeed, this one is certainly an expert magician."

35.Mohammad Shafi: "He wants to drive you out of your land by his black magic. What, then, do you advise?"

36.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "Defer the decision on him and his brother, and send callers to cities and towns."

37.Mohammad Shafi: "They will bring to you all expert magicians."

38.Mohammad Shafi: And so the magicians were assembled for public show at a set time on a certain day

39.Mohammad Shafi: And the people were asked, "Are you all gathered here,"

40.Mohammad Shafi: "So that we might cheer the magicians if it is they who prevail?"

41.Mohammad Shafi: So when the magicians came, they said to Pharaoh, "Are we not indeed entitled certainly to a reward if it is we who prevail?"

42.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "Of course! And, indeed, in that case you shall be among those who are near to me."

43.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said to them: "Cast down whatever you were to cast!"

44.Mohammad Shafi: Then they did cast down their ropes and their staffs, and said, "By Pharaoh's honour, behold, it is we certainly who shall prevail!"

45.Mohammad Shafi: And then Moses threw his staff. And lo! It swallowed up all their deceptions

46.Mohammad Shafi: And the magicians fell down in prostration

47.Mohammad Shafi: They said: "We believe in the Lord of the worlds!"

48.Mohammad Shafi: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron!"

49.Mohammad Shafi: Pharaoh said, "You believe him before I permit you? Indeed, he must be your master who has taught you magic! But you shall certainly come to know who the master is. I shall certainly cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and shall certainly crucify you, all together!"

50.Mohammad Shafi: The magicians said, "No matter! We shall indeed return to our Lord."

51.Mohammad Shafi: "We do indeed ardently desire that our Lord forgive us our faults now that we have been among the foremost to believe!"

52.Mohammad Shafi: And We conveyed to Moses Allah's instructions, "Leave with My devotees (Children of Israel) by night. You will he pursued (by Pharaoh's army)!"

53.Mohammad Shafi: And then Pharaoh sent heralds to all cities/towns

54.Mohammad Shafi: "These [Children of Israel] are but a small gang."

55.Mohammad Shafi: "And they have surely enraged us."

56.Mohammad Shafi: "And we are indeed a vigilant multitude."

57.Mohammad Shafi: And so We made them (Pharaoh's people) come out of gardens and springs

58.Mohammad Shafi: And We made them (Pharaoh's people) leave their treasures and places of honour

59.Mohammad Shafi: And [in course of time] We made the Children of Israel inheritors of such things

60.Mohammad Shafi: Then they [Pharaoh's men] went in pursuit of them (Children of Israel) eastwards

61.Mohammad Shafi: Then as the two groups of people (Moses' and Pharaoh's) came in sight of each other, Moses' people exclaimed: "We are indeed certainly overtaken!"

62.Mohammad Shafi: Moses said, "No! My Lord is with me. HE will guide me!"

63.Mohammad Shafi: We then inspired Moses to strike the sea with his staff. The sea thereupon parted, and each part appeared like a vast mountain

64.Mohammad Shafi: And We drew the other party (Pharaoh's people) near thereto

65.Mohammad Shafi: And We saved Moses and all who were with him

66.Mohammad Shafi: And then We drowned the others

67.Mohammad Shafi: Therein indeed was a sign. And yet most of them would not believe

68.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, your Lord is certainly the One Omnipotent, Merciful

69.Mohammad Shafi: And recite to them the story of Abraham

70.Mohammad Shafi: When he asked his father and his people, "What is it this that you worship?"

71.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "We worship idols, and we bow down to them in devotion."

72.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham asked, "Do these hear you when you invoke them?"

73.Mohammad Shafi: "Or do they give you any benefit or any harm?"

74.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham's people said, "But we found our forefathers doing the same!"

75.Mohammad Shafi: Abraham asked, "Have you, then, ever considered what it is that you have been worshipping?"

76.Mohammad Shafi: "You and those ancient forebears of yours?"

77.Mohammad Shafi: "And, indeed, these are enemies to me, but not the Lord of the worlds."

78.Mohammad Shafi: "The Lord Who created me and Who then has guided me."

79.Mohammad Shafi: "And Who gives me food and drink."

80.Mohammad Shafi: "And, when I fall ill, Who cures me."

81.Mohammad Shafi: "And Who will cause me to die and then will bring me back to life."

82.Mohammad Shafi: "And Who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Judgment!"

83.Mohammad Shafi: "My Lord! grant me wisdom, and put me with the righteous."

84.Mohammad Shafi: "And create a good name for me among the later generations."

85.Mohammad Shafi: "And place me among those who shall inherit the garden of bliss!"

86.Mohammad Shafi: "And forgive my father! He is indeed among those who have gone astray."

87.Mohammad Shafi: "And put me not to shame on the Day of Resurrection."

88.Mohammad Shafi: The Day on which neither wealth will be of any use, nor children

89.Mohammad Shafi: Except for a mind free of evil with which one comes before Allah

90.Mohammad Shafi: And the Garden (Paradise) will be brought near for those who had spent their worldly lives within the parameters laid down by Allah

91.Mohammad Shafi: And the Hell will be laid open before those who had allowed themselves to be seduced

92.Mohammad Shafi: And they will be asked: "Where are those you worshipped?"

93.Mohammad Shafi: "Those, other than Allah, you worshipped? Can those be of any help to you or to themselves?"

94.Mohammad Shafi: They will then be hurled into hell — they, as well as those who had seduced them

95.Mohammad Shafi: And the army of Iblees (the Satan) - all together

96.Mohammad Shafi: They will, blaming one another, say

97.Mohammad Shafi: "By Allah, we were indeed certainly in clear delusion."

98.Mohammad Shafi: "When we deemed you equal to the Lord of all the worlds!"

99.Mohammad Shafi: "And they who led us astray are none but the culprits!"

100.Mohammad Shafi: "And now we have none to intercede for us."

102.Mohammad Shafi: If only we had a return [to worldly life], so we could be among the believers!"

103.Mohammad Shafi: There is indeed a sign in this, and most of them believe not

104.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, your Lord — He alone — is the Omnipotent, the Merciful

105.Mohammad Shafi: The people of Noah did not believe the Messengers

106.Mohammad Shafi: When their brother Noah said to them, "Are you not scared of wrongful living?"

107.Mohammad Shafi: "I am indeed a trustworthy Messenger of Allah sent to you!"

108.Mohammad Shafi: "Be, then, afraid of Allah, and obey me!"

109.Mohammad Shafi: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Lord of the worlds."

110.Mohammad Shafi: "Be afraid of Allah then, and obey me!"

111.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "Are we to believe you, when those who follow you are the most abject of people?"

112.Mohammad Shafi: He said, "And what do I know what work they do?"

113.Mohammad Shafi: "It is for none but Allah to make them account for what they do, if you could but understand this!"

114.Mohammad Shafi: "And I am not one to drive away the believers."

116.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "If you desist not, O Noah, you will certainly be stoned to death!"

117.Mohammad Shafi: Noah said, "My Lord! Indeed, my people do not believe in me."

118.Mohammad Shafi: "Do settle then the matter between me and them, and save me and those of the believers who are with me!"

119.Mohammad Shafi: We then saved him and those with him in the fully-laden Ark

120.Mohammad Shafi: And We caused the rest thereafter to drown

121.Mohammad Shafi: There is indeed in this a sign, and most of them believe not

122.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, your Lord — He alone — is the Omnipotent, the Merciful

123.Mohammad Shafi: [The ancient tribe of] AAad did not believe the Messengers

124.Mohammad Shafi: When their brother Hood said to them, "Are you not scared of wrongful living?"

125.Mohammad Shafi: "I am indeed a trustworthy Messenger of Allah sent to you!"

126.Mohammad Shafi: "Be afraid of Allah then, and obey me!"

127.Mohammad Shafi: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Lord of the worlds."

128.Mohammad Shafi: "Would you wantonly build something on every elevated place?"

129.Mohammad Shafi: "And have strongly built structures to live therein forever!?"

130.Mohammad Shafi: "And when you control, you control cruelly?"

131.Mohammad Shafi: "Be afraid of Allah then, and obey me!"

132.Mohammad Shafi: "And be afraid of Him who helped you with what you know."

135.Mohammad Shafi: "I do indeed fear that punishment of a dreadful Day may befall you!"

136.Mohammad Shafi: They said. "It is all the same to us whether you preach or not."

137.Mohammad Shafi: "This is nothing but practice/custom of the earlier peoples."

138.Mohammad Shafi: "And we are not going to be punished!"

139.Mohammad Shafi: And so they disbelieved him, and We destroyed them. There is indeed in this a sign, and most of them believe not

140.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, your Lord — He alone — is the Omnipotent, the Merciful

141.Mohammad Shafi: [The ancient tribe of] Thamood did not believe the Messengers

142.Mohammad Shafi: When their brother Salih said to them: "Are you not scared of wrongful living?"

143.Mohammad Shafi: "I am indeed a trustworthy Messenger of Allah sent to you!"

144.Mohammad Shafi: "Be afraid of Allah then, and obey me!"

145.Mohammad Shafi: "And no reward whatever do I ask of you for it: my reward rests with none but the Lord of the worlds."

146.Mohammad Shafi: "Will you be left secure among things here?"

41.Mohammad Shafi: And We placed them as leaders inviting people to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped

49.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Then bring a scripture from Allah that would give guidance clearer than these two. I shall follow it, if what you say is true."

50.Mohammad Shafi: And if they answer you not, then know that what they follow is their lusts. And who could go farther astray than he who follows his lust with no guidance from Allah? Indeed! Allah guides not the wicked people

51.Mohammad Shafi: And verily We have caused the Word to contact them, that they may take heed.

52.Mohammad Shafi: Those whom We had given the Scripture before it (the Qur'aan), they too come to believe in it

55.Mohammad Shafi: And when they hear vain talk they withdraw from it and say, "To us our deeds and to you yours. Peace to you! We do not wish to behave like ignorant people."

57.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "If we were to follow the Guidance with you we should be exterminated from our land." Have We not established for them a secure sanctuary, produce of all kinds being brought to it as a provision from Us? But most of them know not

68.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord creates what He wills; and He chooses that which is good for them. Glorified is Allah and Exalted above all that they worship besides Him

75.Mohammad Shafi: And We shall take out from every community a witness and then say, "Produce your proof." They will then know that the Truth is for Allah, and all that they invented will have abandoned them

81.Mohammad Shafi: Then We sank the earth with him and his house. Then he had no force to help him against Allah, nor was he of those who are helped

82.Mohammad Shafi: And those who had coveted his (Korah's) place but yesterday exclaimed the morning after (Korah's sinking), "Ah, well! 87.Mohammad Shafi: And let them not hinder you from Allah's Verses after those have been sent down to you. And call them to your Lord, and be not of the polytheists

40.Mohammad Shafi: We then got hold of everyone for his crime. Of them were some on whom We sent a violent storm; and of them were some who were overtaken by a deafening blast; and of them were some with whom We sank the earth; and of them were some whom We drowned. And Allah wronged them not, but they wronged themselves

41.Mohammad Shafi: Those taking patrons other than Allah are like the spider building a web of a house. And, certainly indeed, the frailest of all houses is the spider's house — if they but knew

42.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does indeed know anything they invoke besides Him (to be as weak as the spider's web). And He is the One omnipotent, wise

55.Mohammad Shafi: The Day when the punishment shall cover them from above them and from underneath their feet. And He shall say, "Taste what you have been doing!"

46.Mohammad Shafi: And among His signs is that He sends the winds heralding good news (of rains), so that He might give you a taste of His Grace, that ships might sail at His Command, that you might seek His Favour, and that you might be grateful

47.Mohammad Shafi: And, before you, We did send Messengers to their respective peoples. And they came to them with clear signs. Then We punished the criminals. And it was incumbent on Us to help the believers

48.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is the One Who sends the winds. Then the interaction of the winds raises a cloud. Then He spreads the cloud across the sky as He pleases, and breaks it into fragments. Then you see the rain pouring down from within them. And when He makes the rain fall on whomsoever of His creatures He pleases, those creatures do then rejoice

49.Mohammad Shafi: And they were indeed in despair, before it (the rain) was sent down upon them,

50.Mohammad Shafi: Look then at these results of Allah's Mercy — how He gives life to the earth after it had been dead. Indeed, that (Mercy) surely shall give life to the Dead. And He is the One capable of doing anything

51.Mohammad Shafi: And if We send a wind and they see it (the green earth) turn yellow (giving man its yield), verily, they still continue ungratefully to disbelieve (in Allah's Mercy)

52.Mohammad Shafi: And you cannot indeed make the dead hear, nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and go away

53.Mohammad Shafi: And, nor can you advise the blind out of their straying. You can make none to hear except those who believe in Our Verses/signs and then submit

54.Mohammad Shafi: It is Allah who created you weak, then made you strong after being weak, and then made you weak and grey-haired after being strong. HE creates as He wills. And He is the One knowing all, capable to do anything

55.Mohammad Shafi: On the Day the Hour dawns, the criminals will swear they stayed not (in the earth) but an hour. Thus were they deluded

56.Mohammad Shafi: And those who have been endowed with knowledge and conviction will say, "Indeed you did stay there, in accordance with Allah's Book, until the Resurrection Day. Now, this is the Resurrection Day, but which you remained unaware of."

57.Mohammad Shafi: That Day then the wicked people shall not get any benefit from their excuses/apologies, nor shall they be allowed to solicit favours

58.Mohammad Shafi: And, verily, We have given, in this very Qur'aan, every kind of example for mankind. And even if you come to them with a miraculous sign, those who suppress the Truth would say, "You advocate nothing but falsehood."

59.Mohammad Shafi: Thus does Allah put a seal on the minds of those who wish not to learn

60.Mohammad Shafi: Be patient then! Allah's Promise is indeed true. And let not those who lack conviction disturb your mind.

1.Mohammad Shafi: These are among the letters, of the Arabic language, appearing at the beginning of some Qur'aanic chapters. Significance of these letters is a mystery. Omniscient Allah has perhaps purposely kept it mysterious to remind mankind of the limitation of knowledge it is bestowed with

2.Mohammad Shafi: These are Verses of the Book of Wisdom

3.Mohammad Shafi: Guidance and Mercy for those who are good

4.Mohammad Shafi: Those who establish prayer, give Zakaat, and believe in the Hereafter with conviction

5.Mohammad Shafi: Those are on guidance from their Lord, and these are the ones who are successful

6.Mohammad Shafi: And among mankind is such a one who, without adequate knowledge, bargains for the frivolous hadeeth to lead people away from Allah's path, and holds this (Qur'aan) in ridicule.h For such a one awaits a disgraceful punishment

7.Mohammad Shafi: And when Our Verses are recited to him, he turns back haughtily, as if he had not heard them — as if there was deafness in his ears. Give him then the bad news of a painful punishment

8.Mohammad Shafi: Those indeed who believe and do good deeds, for them are Gardens of bliss

9.Mohammad Shafi: They will live therein forever! Allah's promise is the Truth! And He is the One omnipotent, wise

10.Mohammad Shafi: He created the heavens without pillars that you can see. And He cast mountains on the earth lest it should shake with you, and He dispersed on it animals of every kind. And We sent down water from the sky, and caused to grow therein pairs of every noble kind

11.Mohammad Shafi: This is Allah's creation. Now show me that which those besides Him have created. Nay, these people who unjustly worship others besides Allah are in manifest error

12.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Luqman the wisdom of being grateful to Allah. And whoever is grateful, he is grateful for his own sake; and if anyone is ungrateful, then indeed Allah is Self- Sufficient, Praised

13.Mohammad Shafi: And when Luqman said to his son by way of admonishing him, "O my son! Worship none besides Allah. Worshipping others besides Allah is certainly indeed a grave injustice."

14.Mohammad Shafi: And We have commissioned man with a duty towards his parents — his mother bears him through weakness upon weakness and she feeds him on her milk for two years — that, (as Allah directs,) "Be grateful to Me and to your parents. To Me is the final destination."

15.Mohammad Shafi: "And if they (parents) try to make you worship others with Me — others of whom you have no knowledge — obey them not, but be kind to them in this world. And follow the way of him who turns to Me! Then to Me is your return, then I shall tell you what you did."

16.Mohammad Shafi: [Continuing his admonition started in Verse above, Luqman said,] "O my son! Even if it be the weight of a grain of mustard-seed, and even though it be in a rock, or in the heaven or in the earth, Allah will bring it out. Allah is indeed meticulously Aware!"

17.Mohammad Shafi: "O my son! Establish the Prayer,enjoin good, and forbid evil. And bear patiently any affliction that you may suffer. These indeed are among acts of great courage."

18.Mohammad Shafi: "And turn not rudely away from people, nor walk the streets in pride! Indeed, Allah loves not any self-conceited boaster."

19.Mohammad Shafi: "And be modest in your walk and lower your voice. The most hateful of voices is certainly indeed the ass's bray."

20.Mohammad Shafi: See you not that Allah has made subservient to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and that He has given you His bounties (like air and water) in abundance outwardly and inwardly? And among men is such a one as argues about Allah without knowledge, without guidance, and without the leading light a divine Book

21.Mohammad Shafi: And when they are asked to follow what Allah has revealed, they say, "Nay, we follow what we found our fathers with." Would they follow them even though the devil calls them to the punishment of the burning Fire!

22.Mohammad Shafi: And he who submits himself to Allah and is good to others, he has taken a firm hold of a strong link. And with Allah is the end of all matters

23.Mohammad Shafi: And let not disbelief of one who disbelieves grieve thee. To Us is their return, and then We shall inform them of what they did. Allah does indeed know what is inside their minds

24.Mohammad Shafi: We let them enjoy a little, then We shall drive them to a severe punishment

25.Mohammad Shafi: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they will say, "Allah." Say, "Praise be to Allah!" Nay, most of them know not

26.Mohammad Shafi: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, Allah is the One self- sufficient, praised

27.Mohammad Shafi: And had all the trees in the earth been pens, and the sea, after being completely used (as ink), had seven more seas to replenish it, all these would still be insufficient to cover all of Allah's words. Allah is indeed Omnipotent, Wise

28.Mohammad Shafi: Creation or Resurrection of you all is not but like (creation and resurrection of) a single soul. Allah does indeed listen to and see (all His creatures)

29.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that Allah makes the night enter the day, and He makes the day enter the night, that He has made the sun and the moon subservient — each pursues its course till an appointed time — and that Allah is Aware of what you do

30.Mohammad Shafi: That is because Allah is the Truth, what they pray to besides Him is falsehood, and Allah is the Highest, the Greatest

31.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that the ship floats on the sea by Allah's favour so that He may show you some of His signs? Certainly indeed there are signs in this for everyone who is patient, grateful

32.Mohammad Shafi: And when a wave, like dark clouds, covers them, they pray exclusively to Allah as monotheists. Then when He brings them back safely to land, some of them become neutral (between polytheists and monotheists). And none but every treacherous, ungrateful one denies Our signs

33.Mohammad Shafi: O people! Be mindful of your Lord and fear the Day when no father can avail his son in anything, nor can the child avail this father. Allah's promise is always indeed true. So let not the lives of this world deceive you, nor let the arch-deceiver (the Satan) deceive you about Allah

34.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed! The knowledge of the Hour is with Allah alone, and He sends down the pouring rain, and He knows what is in the wombs. And no one knows what he will earn the next morning. And no one knows in what land he will die. Allah does indeed know everything, He is indeed aware of everything

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Mohammad Shafi: Alif Lam Mi

2.Mohammad Shafi: Revelation of this Book is, no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds

3.Mohammad Shafi: Do they say He (Prophet Muhammad) has forged it? Nay! It is the Truth from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you. They may thereby walk the Right Path

4.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth and what is in between them in six periods of time. He then ascended the Throne of Power. You have no wali or intercessor besides Him! Will you not then take heed

5.Mohammad Shafi: He (Allah) directs the Divine Command from the heavens to the earth. Then it will come up to Him on a Day the measure of which is a thousand years as you count

6.Mohammad Shafi: That One is the Knower of the unseen and the seen. That One is the Omnipotent, the Merciful

7.Mohammad Shafi: Who perfected everything He created, and He created the first man from dust

8.Mohammad Shafi: Then He generated his progeny of an extract (sperms) from a despised liquid (semen)

9.Mohammad Shafi: Then He gave it shape and breathed into it some of His spirit. And He made ears, eyes, and minds for you. You thank but little

10.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "When we are lost in the earth, shall we then be there in a new creation?" Nay! They believe not in meeting their Lord

11.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "The angel of death, who is given charge of you, will cause you to die. Then to your Lord you will be returned."

12.Mohammad Shafi: And could you but see the guilty when they hang down their heads before their Lord! "Our Lord! We have seen and heard enough. Now send us back! We will do righteous deeds. We now do certainly believe."

13.Mohammad Shafi: And had We so willed, We could have given every soul its guidance. But (as Allah declares,) "The word from Me is bound to come true that I will certainly fill Hell with the jinn and the humans together."

14.Mohammad Shafi: So taste the consequence: because you were oblivious of your appointment for this Day, We are indeed oblivious of you now! And taste the eternal punishment for what you did

15.Mohammad Shafi: They — only they — believe in Our messages who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrate and glorify their Lord with His praise, and they are not proud

16.Mohammad Shafi: They keep themselves out of their beds, praying to their Lord in fear and in hope. And they spend out of what We have given them

17.Mohammad Shafi: And no person knows what is kept hidden for them, of delights of the eyes, as reward for what they did

18.Mohammad Shafi: Can he then who is a believer be like him who has been a transgressor/profligate!? They cannot be equal

19.Mohammad Shafi: And for those who believe and do good deeds, there are Gardens to live in — a hospitable resort for what they did

20.Mohammad Shafi: And for those who transgress, the Fire is their abode! Whenever they try to get out from it, they are taken back into it. And it is said to them, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you disbelieved in."

21.Mohammad Shafi: And certainly We will make them taste the lower punishment before the great one so that they may turn (to the Right Path)

22.Mohammad Shafi: And who can be more unjust than he who is reminded of the Verses/signs of his Lord, but then turns away from them!? We do exact retribution from the offenders

23.Mohammad Shafi: And We did indeed give Moses the Book — doubt not then the meeting with Him — and We made it a guide for the Children of Israel

24.Mohammad Shafi: And We made, from among them, leaders to guide them with patience by Our command. And they were certain in their belief of Our Verses/signs

25.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord it is, indeed, Who will judge amongst them, on the Day of Resurrection, on matters they differed in

26.Mohammad Shafi: How many a generation — in whose erstwhile dwelling places they now move about — have We destroyed before them? Does not this fact give guidance to them? Indeed there are signs in this. Do they not then hear (about those generations)

27.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not see that We drive the water to the barren land, then bring out thereby an agricultural produce of which their cattle and they themselves eat? Do they not then understand what they see

28.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "When will this Inauguration (of the Hereafter) come, if what you say is true?"

29.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "On the Day of the Inauguration, belief of those who (now) disbelieve will not profit them, nor will they be given any respite."

30.Mohammad Shafi: So leave them alone and wait! They too are indeed waiting

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Mohammad Shafi: O Prophet! Fear Allah and obey not the disbelievers (suppressors of the Truth) and the hypocrites. Allah is indeed Knowledgeable, Wise

2.Mohammad Shafi: And follow what is revealed to you from your Lord. Allah is indeed ever Aware of what you (all people) do

3.Mohammad Shafi: And have trust in Allah! And Allah is sufficient as dispenser of affairs

4.Mohammad Shafi: Allah has not made for any man two hearts within him. And He has not made your wives, whom you desert by Zihar (i.e. by uttering that your wives' backs are like your mothers' backs), your mothers. And He has not made your adopted sons your sons. These are just words uttered by your mouths. And Allah tells the truth and it is He Who shows the way

5.Mohammad Shafi: Call them by names linking them to their fathers; this is the equitable thing to do by Allah's standards. And if you know not their fathers, then they are your brethren in faith and your wards. And there is no blame on you in that you make a mistake therein without any bad intention. And Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

6.Mohammad Shafi: The Prophet is closer to the believers than they are to themselves. And his wives are their mothers. And the womb (blood) relations are closer one to another, in Allah's Writ, than to the other believers and the migrants, except for what good you do to your bosom friends. This is as recorded in the Book

7.Mohammad Shafi: And when We took a covenant from the prophets and from you (O Muhammad) — and from Noah, Abraham, Moses and Jesus son of Mary — We took from them a solemn covenant

8.Mohammad Shafi: (The covenant taken was for the purpose) that He (Allah) may question the truthful of their truth, and He has prepared for the suppressors of the Truth a painful punishment

9.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Remember Allah's favour to you when there came against you armies against whom We sent a strong wind and armies that you saw not. And Allah does ever see what you do

10.Mohammad Shafi: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes swooned and the hearts rose up to the throats, and you began to have misgivings about Allah

11.Mohammad Shafi: There the believers were put on trial and shaken with a severe shaking

12.Mohammad Shafi: And when the hypocrites and people with sick minds said, "Allah and His Messenger have promised us nothing but delusions."

13.Mohammad Shafi: And when a section of them said, "O people of Yathrib! You cannot make a stand, so go back. And a group of them sought permission of the Prophet, saying, "Our houses are exposed." And their houses were not exposed; they just wanted to run away

14.Mohammad Shafi: And had an entry been made upon them from behind, and then they (hypocites) were asked to defect, they would certainly have done it with little hesitation

15.Mohammad Shafi: And they did make a pledge with Allah before, that they would not turn their backs. And a pledge with Allah is bound to be questioned about

16.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Fleeing will profit you not, if you flee from death, natural or violent. And even then, (when, with Allah's will, you are given respite from death for the time being,) you will not be allowed to enjoy life on this earth but a little

17.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Who is it that can shield you from Allah, if He intends to harm you or He intends to show you mercy?" And they will find none as a wali to them or to help them besides Allah

18.Mohammad Shafi: Allah does know those among you who hinder others and those who say to their brethren, "Come to us!" And they hardly come to fight in a battle

19.Mohammad Shafi: They grudge any help to you. But when fear grips them, you will see them look at you with eyes rolling, as if death has overtaken them. But when fear is gone, they lash you with sharp tongues grudging over wealth. These people are not believers, so Allah has rendered their deeds null and void. And that is easy for Allah

20.Mohammad Shafi: They (hypocrites) think the confederates are not gone. And should the confederates come again, they would like to be in the deserts with the Bedouins asking for news about you. And were they to be with you, they would hardly fight

21.Mohammad Shafi: Certainly you have in the Messenger of Allah an excellent example for anyone who turns to Allah and the Last Day, and remembers Allah much

22.Mohammad Shafi: And when the believers saw the Confederates, they said, "This is what Allah and His Messenger promised us, and Allah and His Messenger spoke the truth. And it increased in them nothing but faith and submission

23.Mohammad Shafi: Of the believers there are men who are true to the promise they made to Allah. And of them is he who has fulfilled his vow, and of them is he who is waiting (to fulfill it). And they have not changed in the least

24.Mohammad Shafi: (Mankind is variously tested in this world) so that Allah may reward the truthful for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if He so pleases, or pardon them. Allah is indeed ever Forgiving, Merciful

25.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah repelled the disbelievers consumed in their rage; they gained no advantage (in their armed invasion against Medina). And Allah sufficed the believers in the war. And Allah is Strong, Omnipotent

26.Mohammad Shafi: And He sent down those of the People of the Book who backed them (the Confedrates) from their fortresses and He cast terror into their minds; some you killed and some you took captive

27.Mohammad Shafi: And He made you heirs to their land and their dwellings and their property, and to lands on which you have not yet set foot. And Allah has power over all things

28.Mohammad Shafi: O Prophet, tell you wives, "If you desire the life of this world and its glitter, well then, I will make an adequate provision for you and give you a gracious release."

29.Mohammad Shafi: And if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the abode of the Hereafter, then Allah has indeed prepared a great reward for the virtuous ones among you

30.Mohammad Shafi: O wives of the Prophet! Whoever of you is guilty of manifestly improper conduct, double is the punishment for her. And this is easy for Allah

31.Mohammad Shafi: And whoever of you (Prophet's wives) is devoted to Allah and His Messenger and performs good deeds, We shall reward her twice, and We have prepared for her a generous provision

32.Mohammad Shafi: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other woman. If you fear Allah, be not soft in speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease be moved by desire. And speak in a normal, appropriate, matter-of-fact manner

33.Mohammad Shafi: And stay at home and display not the display of the ignorance of yore. And establish prayer, give charity, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only desires to rid you of anything bad and unclean, O people of the (Prophet's) household, and to cleanse you thoroughly

34.Mohammad Shafi: And remember what is recited in your houses of the Verses of Allah and the Wisdom. Allah is indeed ever Meticulous, Aware

35.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed, the men who submit and the women who submit, and the men who believe and the women who believe, and the men devoted to Allah and the women devoted to Allah, and the truthful men and the truthful women, and the men exercising patience and the women exercising patience, and the humble men and the humble women, and the men who give sadaqah and the women who give sadaqah, and the men who fast and the women who fast, and the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard, and the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember — Allah is prepared to forgive them and grant them a great reward

36.Mohammad Shafi: And it behoves not a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah — and His Messenger — has decided an affair, to exercise a choice in their matter. And whoever revolts against Allah and His Messenger, he surely and clearly goes astray

37.Mohammad Shafi: And when you said to him whom Allah and you had shown favour to, "Keep your wife to yourself and fear Allah!" And you concealed in your heart what Allah would bring to light. And you feared men, and Allah has a greater right that you should fear Him! So when Zaid completed necessary divorce formalities from her (Zaid's wife), We gave her in marriage to you, so that there should be no difficulty for the believers about the wives of their adopted sons, when they (adopted sons) have completed necessary divorce formalities from them (their wives). And Allah's decree does ever get implemented.

38.Mohammad Shafi: There can be nothing forbidden for the Prophet in what Allah has ordained for him. Such has been the way of Allah with those who have gone before. And Allah's decree is a thing destined

39.Mohammad Shafi: [And such shall be the way of Allah with] those who convey Messages of Allah and fear Him, and fear none but Allah. And Allah is Sufficient to keep accounts

40.Mohammad Shafi: Muhammad is not father to any of you men, but he is Messenger of Allah and Seal of the Prophets. And Allah does know all things

41.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Remember Allah much and often

42.Mohammad Shafi: And glorify Him morning and evening

43.Mohammad Shafi: He it is Who blesses you — and so do His angels — that He may bring you out of darkness into light. And He is ever Merciful to the believers

44.Mohammad Shafi: Their salutation on the day they meet Him will be, "Peace!" And He has prepared for them a noble reward

45.Mohammad Shafi: O Prophet! We have indeed sent you as a witness, and to convey good news (to the people) and to warn (them)

46.Mohammad Shafi: And as one who invites people to Allah with His permission, and as a lighted lamp

47.Mohammad Shafi: And give the believers the good news that they shall have a great favour from Allah

48.Mohammad Shafi: And obey not those who suppress the Truth and obey not the hypocrites, and tolerate the annoyance they cause you, and trust Allah. And Allah is sufficient as dispenser of affairs

49.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! When you marry believing women and then divorce them before you touch them, you have in their case no waiting period which you should observe. However make a good provision for them and set them free in a fair manner

50.Mohammad Shafi: O Prophet! We have made lawful to you your wives whom you have given their dowries, and those whom your right hand possesses out of those whom Allah has given you as prisoners of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts, and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who migrated with you; and a believing woman, if she gives herself to the Prophet, if the Prophet desires to marry her. This is a special provision for you only, not for the (other) believers. We do know what We have ordained for them concerning their wives and concerning those whom their right hands possess. We give this clarification in order that no blame may lie on you. Andh Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

51.Mohammad Shafi: You (Prophet) may defer the turn of any you please of them (Prophet's wives), and take to you any you please. And you may wish for any of those you had put off — no blame on you. They are thus more likely to calm down and not grieve, and be pleased, all of them, with what you give them. And Allah knows what is in your minds. And Allah is Knowledgeable, Kind

52.Mohammad Shafi: No more wives are allowed to you after this. Nor are you allowed to exchange them (existing wives) for other wives, though the latters' beauty be pleasing to you, except those whom your right hand possesses (slaves). And Allah is Watchful over everything

53.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Enter not the houses of the Prophet unless invited there for a meal, but then go not there too early as to wait for the meal to be ready. But enter at the time you are invited, and as soon as you have finished your meals, disperse! And linger not for a customary talk. This does indeed cause inconvenience to the Prophet, but he is too embarrassed to tell you. And Allah is not embarrassed to express the truth. And when you ask for anything from them (ladies of the Prophet's household), ask of them from behind a curtain. This would be better for the purity of your hearts and of theirs. And it behoves you not to cause inconvnience to the Messenger of Allah, nor to marry his wives after him. This is indeed a matter of great significance with Allah

54.Mohammad Shafi: Whether you do a thing openly or do it in secrecy, Allah does in any case know everything

55.Mohammad Shafi: No blame on them (ladies of Prophet's household) in respect of their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their own women, or of what their right hands possess (slaves).And O ladies! Fear Allah and obey Him. Allah is indeed Witness over all things

56.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed, Allah and His angels bless the Prophet. O you who believe! Bless him and greet him nicely

57.Mohammad Shafi: Allah has cursed those who do indeed displease Allah and His Messenger — cursed them in this world and the Hereafter. And He has prepared for them a disgracful punishment

58.Mohammad Shafi: And those who harm believing men and believing women unjustly, they become guilty of slander and manifest sin

59.Mohammad Shafi: O Prophet! Tell your wives and your daughters and the women of believers to put on their outer-garments over their bodies in such a way that they are recognised and not molested.h And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

60.Mohammad Shafi: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who spread rumours and trouble in Madinah desist not, We shall certainly urge you on against them. And then they shall not be your neighbours therein but for a little while

61.Mohammad Shafi: Accursed, they will be seized and slain wherever found

62.Mohammad Shafi: That was the way Allah dealt with those who have gone before. And you will find no change in Allah's way

63.Mohammad Shafi: People ask you about the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin). Say, "Information about it is only with Allah. And what do you know, the Hour may be nigh?"

64.Mohammad Shafi: Allah has indeed cursed the suppressors of Truth and prepared for them a burning Fire

65.Mohammad Shafi: They will abide therein forever. They will find neither a wali nor anyone to help

66.Mohammad Shafi: That day when their faces are turned about in the Fire, they will say, "Woe to us! Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!"

67.Mohammad Shafi: And they will say, "Our Lord! We only obeyed our bosses and our seniors. And they led us astray from the right path."

68.Mohammad Shafi: "Our Lord! Give them a double punishment and give them a severe curse."

69.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Be not like those who offended Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said. And he had an honourable standing with Allah

70.Mohammad Shafi: O you who believe! Fear Allah and speak in appropriate and straight (unambiguous and to the point) words

71.Mohammad Shafi: He (Allah) will improve your deeds for you, and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, he/she does certainly achieve a great success

72.Mohammad Shafi: We did indeed offer the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they were unwilling to bear its burden and were apprehensive of it. And man bore that burden! He has indeed been unjust and ignorant

73.Mohammad Shafi: That Allah may punish the hypocrites, men and women, and the polytheists, men and women. And Allah will turn mercifully to the believing men and the believing women. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

1.Mohammad Shafi: Praise to Allah! To Him belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth. And to Him belongs praise in the Hereafter! And He is the One wise, aware

2.Mohammad Shafi: He knows what goes down into the earth and what comes out of it, and what comes down from the heavens and what goes up there. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving

3.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth say, "The Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin) is not going to come to us ever." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, the Knower of the unseen! It is certainly going to come to you." No mass (weight) particle is hidden from Him, either in the heavens or in the earth. And nor is there anything less than that nor greater, but clearly recorded

4.Mohammad Shafi: (The Hour is indeed going to come) in order that He (Allah) may reward those who believe and do good deeds. For them there is forgiveness and a noble provision

5.Mohammad Shafi: And for those who strive hard to defeat the purpose of Our Messages, there is punishment of a painful scourge

6.Mohammad Shafi: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the Truth, and that it guides towards the path of the Omnipotent, the Praised One

7.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth say, "Shall we show you a man who informs you that, when you are completely shred into tiny pieces, you will even then be created anew!?"

8.Mohammad Shafi: "Has he forged a lie against Allah or has he gone mad?" Nay! Those who believe not in the Hereafter are suffering a far-reaching delusion

9.Mohammad Shafi: See they not what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We so will, We can cause the earth to swallow them or bring down upon them a chunk of the heavens. There is indeed a sign in this for every obedient human turning in repentance to Allah

10.Mohammad Shafi: And We certainly granted David favours from Us. "O mountains and the birds! Sing Allah's praises with him (David)." And We softened the iron for him

11.Mohammad Shafi: "Make armour (with the softened iron), and measure its links correctly. And do good deeds. I (Allah) do indeed see what you do."

12.Mohammad Shafi: And for Solomon (We made) the wind (subservient). It sailed a distance of a month's journey in the morning and a month's journey in the evening. And We made a fountain of molten brass to flow for him. And of the jinn there were those who worked under him by his Lord's command. And whoever from among them failed to act upon Our command, We made him taste the punishment of burning

13.Mohammad Shafi: They made for him what he pleased — of prayer halls and statues, and bowls like water reservoirs and fixed cooking-pots. "Do your work thankfully, O people of David!" And few among My human subjects are grateful

14.Mohammad Shafi: And when We decreed death on him (Solomon), nothing made them aware of his death but a creature of the earth that ate away the stick he was leaning on. So when he fell down, it made the jinn aware that, if they had knowledge of the unseen, they would not have continued to suffer in humiliation

15.Mohammad Shafi: Certainly there was a sign for Sheba in their abode: two gardens, on the right and on the left. Eat of your Lord's provision and give thanks to Him. A good land and a Forgiving Lord

16.Mohammad Shafi: But they turned away (from the Right Path). Then We sent upon them an inundating flood. And in place of their two gardens, We gave them two gardens yielding bitter fruit and growing tamarisk and some stunted Sidr.

17.Mohammad Shafi: We punished them thus because they suppressed the Truth. And We punish none but those who suppress the Truth

18.Mohammad Shafi: And between them and the towns which We had blessed with our bounties, We had placed other townships within sight of one another to facilitate secure journeys therein, by night and by day

19.Mohammad Shafi: But then they said, "Our Lord! Make the stages of our journeys longer." And they wronged themselves! And We reduced them to just a tale among numerous other tales, and scattered them completely. Therein indeed are signs for anyone who is patient and grateful

20.Mohammad Shafi: And the devil did certainly find his opinion concerning them come true. And they followed him, except for a group of the believers

21.Mohammad Shafi: And he (Satan) holds no authoritative power over them, but that for Us his (satanic) influence distinguishes him who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it. And your Lord monitors everything

22.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Call upon those whom you consider gods besides Allah; they control not even the weight particle in the heavens or in the earth, nor have they any partnership in either creation. And He has no assistant from among them

23.Mohammad Shafi: And intercession is of no avail with Him, except from him whom He permits. Until when fear is removed from their hearts, they (seekers of intercession) ask (those whom they considered to be their intercessors), "What is it that your Lord said?" They say, "The Truth. And He is the Most High, the Great."

24.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "Allah! And indeed either of us — we or you — are on right guidance or in manifest error."h

25.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "You will not be asked what we may be guilty of, nor shall we be asked of what you do."

26.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Our Lord will gather us together. Then He will judge between us on the basis of truth. And He is the Best Judge, the Best One to know."

27.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Show me those whom you worship besides Him. No! But it is Allah, the Omnipotent, the Wise, alone Who is worthy of worship."

28.Mohammad Shafi: And We have not sent you but as a bearer of good news and as a warner to the entire mankind, but most of mankind knows not

29.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask, "When is this promise going to be fulfilled, if what you say is true?"

30.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "The fulfillment of the promise for you is on a Day which you cannot postpone nor prepone even by a moment."

31.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth say, "We do not believe in this Qur'aan, nor in that which has preceded it." And if you could but see the wrongdoers, when they are made to stand before their Lord, blaming one another! Those deemed to be weak say to those who were proud, "Had it not been for you, we would have been believers!"

32.Mohammad Shafi: The proud ones say to those deemed weak, "Did we turn you away from the guidance after it had come to you!? Nay, you yourselves were guilty."

33.Mohammad Shafi: And those deemed weak say to those who had been proud, "Nay, it was your night-and- day schemings to prod us to be ungrateful to Allah and set up other gods besides Him." And they keep their remorse to themselves when they see the punishment. And We put shackles on the necks of those who suppress the Truth. Are they getting back anything but for what they did

34.Mohammad Shafi: And We sent not anyone to warn a township but the well-to-do in it said, "We do indeed disbelieve what you are sent with."

35.Mohammad Shafi: And they said, "We have abundance of wealth and children, and we are not going to be punished!"

36.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "My Lord does indeed amplify and straiten provisions for whomsoever He wills, but most of mankind knows this not."

37.Mohammad Shafi: And it is not your wealth, nor your children, that bring you close to Us; but (the piety of) one who believes and does good deeds. Such ones are entitled to double reward for what they do. And they are secure in their high positions

38.Mohammad Shafi: And those who strive to work against Our Verses/signs, those will be brought for punishment

39.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Surely my Lord gives the provision for living in ample measure — and restricts it — to whom He wills of His subjects. And whatsoever you spend, He compensates therefor. And He is the Best Provider."

40.Mohammad Shafi: And the Day He will gather them all together, and then ask the angels, "Did they worship you?"

41.Mohammad Shafi: They [the angels] will say, "Glory to You! You are our Wali — not they! Nay, they worshipped the jinn; in them, most of them believed."

42.Mohammad Shafi: So that Day you will not be able to benefit or harm one another. And We will say to those who were wicked, "Taste punishment by the Fire, which you used to deny!"

43.Mohammad Shafi: And when Our clear Verses are recited to them, they say, "This is not but a man who wants to turn you away from that which your fathers worshipped." And they say, "It is nothing but a concocted lie!" And those who suppressed the Truth say of the Truth when it comes to them, "This is nothing but magic manifest!"

44.Mohammad Shafi: And We had not given them any Books to read, nor did We send them, before you, a warner

45.Mohammad Shafi: And those before them rejected the Truth. And these here now have not yet attained a tenth of what We gave them, and yet they (those before) rejected My Messengers! And how severe in effect was My forsaking them!

46.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I exhort you only to one thing: that you stand up for Allah in twos and alone, then ponder! There is no madness in your companion (Muhammad). He is but one to warn you of a severe punishment."

47.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Whatever reward I ask of you, it is only for you yourselves. It is for Allah to give me my reward. And He is a Witness over all things."

48.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "My Lord, Knower of the unseen, does indeed project the Truth."

49.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "The Truth has come, and falsehood neither originates creation, nor reproduces it."

50.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "If I err, I err only to my own detriment. And if I am right, it is because of what my Lord reveals to me. He does indeed listen, and He is indeed close."

51.Mohammad Shafi: And if you could see them get terrified! But then there would be no escape; and they would be easily caught

52.Mohammad Shafi: And they would say, "We do believe in it." And how could they attain salvation from a place out of bounds from the place (earth) where they could attain to it

53.Mohammad Shafi: And they did disbelieve in it before. And they threw stones at the unseen from a place too distant

54.Mohammad Shafi: And a barrier would be placed between them and that which they desire, as was done with those of their kind before. The sceptics would indeed be ever in doubt

1.Mohammad Shafi: The praise is for Allah, Who originated the heavens and the earth, Who made the angels as messengers flying on wings, two, three, and four. He increases in creation what He wills. Allah is indeed Capable of doing anything

2.Mohammad Shafi: Whatever of mercy Allah opens for mankind, there is none to wit old it. And what He wit olds none can send it thereafter. And He is Omnipotent, the Wise One

3.Mohammad Shafi: O Mankind! Recall Allah's favours upon you. Is there any creator besides Allah who provides for you from the heavens and the earth? There is none worthy of worship but He. How then are you fooled by falsehood

4.Mohammad Shafi: And if they reject you, Messengers before you were rejected too. And to Allah return all matters

5.Mohammad Shafi: O mankind! Allah's promise is indeed true. So let not the lives of this world deceive you, nor let the arch-deceiver (the Satan) deceive you about Allah

6.Mohammad Shafi: The devil is indeed your enemy, so take him for an enemy. He only invites his followers to be companions of the burning Fire

7.Mohammad Shafi: Those who suppress the Truth, for them is a severe punishment. And those who believe and do good deeds, for them is forgiveness and a great reward

8.Mohammad Shafi: Does he, whose evil deed is made to look enticing to him, consider it good!? Now, indeed, Allah lets go astray whom He wills and guides to the Right Path whom He wills. So let not yourself (Prophet) get affected with anxiety for them. Allah does indeed know what they do

9.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah it is Who sends the winds to raise a cloud. Then We drive it on to a dead land, and therewith give life to the earth after it had been dead. Likewise will the Resurrection happen

10.Mohammad Shafi: If any do seek power and glory, then to Allah belongs all power and glory! To Him do words of purity rise, and He does exalt the good deed. And those who plan evil, for them there shall be a severe punishment! And their plan will perish

11.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah created you from dust, then from fertilized ovum, and then He made male and female pairs of you. And no female bears, or delivers, except with His knowledge. And no one is granted a long life, or a shortened one, but it is all recorded in a book. This is indeed easy for Allah

12.Mohammad Shafi: And the two seas are not alike: one sweet, thirst-queching, pleasant to drink; and the other salty, bitter. And from both you eat fresh flesh and bring out jewels which you wear. And you see the ships in the sea cut through its water so that you might seek His bounty and be thankful

13.Mohammad Shafi: Allah makes the night enter the day, and He makes the day enter the night. And He has made the sun and the moon subservient, each pursuing its course till an appointed time. That is Allah, your Lord; His is the kingdom! And those whom you pray to besides Him own not even so much as skin of a date-stone

14.Mohammad Shafi: If you pray to them, they hear not your call; and if they hear, they cannot answer you. And on the day of Resurrection they will deny you worshipped them besides Allah. And none can give you information like the One All-Aware

15.Mohammad Shafi: O mankind! It is you who are in need of Allah. And Allah is the Self-Sufficient One, the Praised One

16.Mohammad Shafi: If He so wills, He can destroy you and bring a new creation

17.Mohammad Shafi: And this is not at all beyond Allah's power

18.Mohammad Shafi: And no bearer of burdens shall bear another's burden. And if any body weighed down by a burden calls attention to its heavy load, nothing of it will be carried by another, even though the latter be near of kin. You can warn only those who fear their Lord without seeing Him, and have established the Prayer. And whoever has purified himself, purifies only for his own good. And to Allah is the final destination

19.Mohammad Shafi: And the blind and the one who is able to see are not alike

20.Mohammad Shafi: Nor are the darkness and the light alike

21.Mohammad Shafi: Nor are the shade and the heat alike

22.Mohammad Shafi: And the living and the dead are not alike. Allah does indeed make one hear whom He wills. And you cannot make those ones hear who are in the graves.

23.Mohammad Shafi: You (Prophet Muhammad) are but a warner

24.Mohammad Shafi: We have indeed sent you with the Truth as a bearer of good news and a warner. And not a people, but a warner had been among them

25.Mohammad Shafi: And if they reject you, those before them did also reject! Their Messengers came to them with clear signs, and with scriptures, and with the illuminating Book

26.Mohammad Shafi: Then I seized those who suppressed the Truth. And how severe in effect was My forsaking them!

27.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the clouds, and then We bring out therewith fruits of various hues and kinds? And in the mountains are streaks, white and red of various shades and very black

28.Mohammad Shafi: And, similarly, there are mankind, beasts and cattle of various hues and colours. Only those of His subjects fear Allah who possess knowledge. Allah is indeed Omnipotent, Forgiving

29.Mohammad Shafi: Those indeed who have recited the Book of Allah, established the Prayer and spent secretly and openly out of what We have given them, look forward to a bargain that never fails

30.Mohammad Shafi: So that He may pay them back their rewards fully and give them more out of His grace. He is indeed Forgiving, Appreciative

31.Mohammad Shafi: And that which We have revealed to you of the Book, that is the Truth, confirming that which is before it. Allah is indeed Aware, Observer of His subjects

32.Mohammad Shafi: And then We have given the Book in inheritance to those whom We have chosen from among Our subjects. And of them is he who wrongs himself, and of them is he who takes a middle course, and of them is he who is foremost in deeds of goodness by Allah's permission. That is the great favour
