33.Mohammad Shafi: Gardens of perpetuity they enter into, to be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls. And their dress therein is silken

34.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "The praise is for Allah, Who has taken away the sorrow from us! Our Lord is indeed certainly Forgiving, Appreciative."

35.Mohammad Shafi: "Who by His grace has settled us in a house abiding forever. Neither any calamity nor any fatigue afflicts us therein."

36.Mohammad Shafi: And those who suppress the Truth, for them is Hell-fire. It does not finish them that they die there, (but they continue to suffer without dying) and the punishment thereof is not lightened for them. We thus do retribute every ingrate

37.Mohammad Shafi: And therein they wail, "Our Lord! Take us out. We will do good deeds — other than what we used to do!" "Did We not give you a long life so that he, who would, could do it? And there came to you the warner! So suffer now; for, wicked persons have no one to help them."

38.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is indeed the Knower of the unseen in the heavens and the earth. He does inded know the secrets of the minds

39.Mohammad Shafi: It is He Who has made you His representatives on the earth. So whoever suppresses the Truth, suppresses it to his own detriment. And their suppression increases the suppressors in nothing but hatred with their Lord. And their suppression increases the suppressors in nothing but loss

40.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Have you seen your gods whom you pray to besides Allah? Show me what sort of earth they have created! Or have they any share in the heavens? Or, have We given them a Book a clear edict whereof they follow?" Nay! The wicked people hold out promises to one another only to deceive

41.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed, Allah upholds the heavens and the earth lest they degenerate. And if they degenerate, none can uphold them after He lets them degenrate. He is indeed Forbearing, Forgiving

42.Mohammad Shafi: And they swore their strongest oaths, by Allah, that if a warner came to them, they would be better guided than any of the communities. And when a warner did come to them, it only increased their aversion (to right guidance)

43.Mohammad Shafi: Displaying arrogance on earth and planning evil. And the evil plan affects none but the planners themselves. Do they then wait for nothing but the way the ancients were dealt with? But you will find neither change nor deviation in Allah's way

44.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not travel on earth and see what end those before them met with? And those before them were stronger in power than they! And Allah is not such that anything in the heavens or the earth could frustrate Him. He is indeed Knowledgeable, Powerful

45.Mohammad Shafi: And were Allah to get hold of people for punishments they earn, He would not leave a single creature living! But He gives them time till an appointed term. And when their terms end, then, of course, Allah does have the overall picture of His subjects. h

1.Mohammad Shafi: These are among the letters, of the Arabic language, appearing at the beginning of some Qur'aanic chapters. Significance of these letters is a mystery. Omniscient Allah has perhaps purposely kept it mysterious to remind mankind of the limitation of knowledge it is bestowed with

2.Mohammad Shafi: By the Qur'aan, full of wisdom

3.Mohammad Shafi: You (Prophet Muhammad) are indeed one of the Messengers (of Allah for mankind)

4.Mohammad Shafi: [Who (the Messengers) are] on Straight Path

5.Mohammad Shafi: (The Qur'aan is) sent down by the Omnipotent, the Merciful

6.Mohammad Shafi: So that you (Prophet Muhammad) may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and are therefore unaware

7.Mohammad Shafi: Divine verdict has already been passed against most of them, so they believe not

8.Mohammad Shafi: We have indeed placed on their necks chains reaching up to the chins, so that they have their heads held up

9.Mohammad Shafi: And We have set a barrier in front of them and a barrier behind. Then We have so covered them up that they see not

10.Mohammad Shafi: And whether you warn them or not, it is all the same to them; they believe not

11.Mohammad Shafi: You can warn only him who follows the Zikr (Qur'aan) and fears the Gracious One without actually seeing Him. Give him then the good news of forgiveness and generous reward

12.Mohammad Shafi: We do indeed bring the dead to life. And We do write down what they send ahead and what they leave behind. And We record everything in a clear document

13.Mohammad Shafi: And recount to them the story of the town-people, when the Messengers came to the town

14.Mohammad Shafi: When We sent to them two Messengers, they rejected them both. Then We aided them with a third. And they said, "We have indeed been sent to you."

15.Mohammad Shafi: They (the town-people) said, "You are none but mortals like us. And, the Gracious One has sent nothing! You are none but liars."

16.Mohammad Shafi: They (the Messengers) said, "Our Lord knows that we are indeed sent to you as His Messengers."

17.Mohammad Shafi: "And our responsibility is only to deliver the divine Message clearly."

18.Mohammad Shafi: They (the town-people) said, "We do indeed consider you to be portents of evil. If you desist not, we will surely stone you, and a painful punishment from us will certainly afflict you."

19.Mohammad Shafi: They said, "Your evil portents be with you. Do you consider it evil that you are reminded of your duty to Allah!? Nay, you are a people transgressing all bounds."

20.Mohammad Shafi: And from the remote part of the city there came a man running. He said, "O my people! Follow the Messengers."

21.Mohammad Shafi: "Follow those who ask of you no reward! And the Messengers are rightly guided."

22.Mohammad Shafi: "And what reason have I that I should not worship Him Who created me?! And to Him you will be returned."

23.Mohammad Shafi: "Shall I take to worshipping any god besides Him — gods whose intercession, if the Gracious One should desire to afflict me with harm, will avail me naught, and who can save me not?"

24.Mohammad Shafi: "I shall then indeed be in clear error."

25.Mohammad Shafi: "I do indeed believe in your Lord, so give me a hearing."

26.Mohammad Shafi: It was said, "Enter the Garden." He said, "Would that my people knew"

27.Mohammad Shafi: "How my Lord has forgiven me and made me one among those honoured!"

28.Mohammad Shafi: And We did not send down upon his people any army from heaven, after him, nor did We need send any

29.Mohammad Shafi: It was just a single deafening blast, and then they were silenced by death

30.Mohammad Shafi: Alas for the subjects! Never does a Messenger come to them but they mock him

31.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not see how many generations We did destroy before them — generations that return to them not

32.Mohammad Shafi: And all of them, certainly indeed, will be brought before Us together

33.Mohammad Shafi: And a sign to them is the dead earth. We make it alive, and bring out from it grain of which they eat

34.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made therein gardens of date-palms and grapes and We have made some springs to flow therein

35.Mohammad Shafi: That they may eat of the fruit thereof — fruit that their hands have not made. Will they not then be thankful

36.Mohammad Shafi: Glory to Him Who created pairs of all things — pairs of what the earth grows, pairs of their own kind, and pairs of what they know not

37.Mohammad Shafi: And a sign to them is the night: We take out the day therefrom and then they are those in darkness

38.Mohammad Shafi: And the sun moves on in the way (orbit) fixed for it. That is a course laid down by the Omnipotent, the Knowledgeable

39.Mohammad Shafi: And the moon: We have laid down phases for it till it returns in shape (curved) to an old dry palm-stalk

40.Mohammad Shafi: Neither is it possible for the sun to overtake the moon (for their paths are different), nor can the night take the place of the day. And all float on in orbit

41.Mohammad Shafi: And a sign to them is that We bore their race in the laden ship (Noah's Ark)

42.Mohammad Shafi: And We have created for them the like thereof, whereon they ride

43.Mohammad Shafi: And if We so will, We may drown them, then there would be no one to respond to their cries for help, nor can they be rescued

44.Mohammad Shafi: (They cannot be rescued) except by mercy and provision from Us for a given time

45.Mohammad Shafi: And then it would be said to them, "Take heed of what is ahead of you and what is behind you, so that mercy is shown to you."

46.Mohammad Shafi: And there comes to them no Verse of the Verses of their Lord but they turn away from it

47.Mohammad Shafi: And when it is said to them, "Spend out of what Allah has given you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Shall we feed him whom, if Allah wills, He could feed? You are not but clearly in error."

48.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "When will this promise (of the Last Day happening) come to pass, if what you say is true?"

49.Mohammad Shafi: They await but a single deafening blast, which will overwhelm them while they squabble

50.Mohammad Shafi: Then they will not be able to make a bequest, nor return to their families

51.Mohammad Shafi: And when the trumpet is blown, to their Lord they will rush from their graves

52.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our graves? This is what the Gracious One had promised! And the Messengers did tell the truth

53.Mohammad Shafi: It will but be a single dafening blast, after which they all shall be brought before Us

54.Mohammad Shafi: That Day then none shall be wronged even a bit; and you shall not be recompensed aught but for what you did

55.Mohammad Shafi: The inhabitants of the Garden (Paradise) shall indeed on that Day be merrily occupied

56.Mohammad Shafi: They and their wives shall be in shaded places, reclining on couches

57.Mohammad Shafi: They shall have fruits therein, and they shall have whatever they desire

58.Mohammad Shafi: Peace shall be the greeting from the Merciful Lord

59.Mohammad Shafi: And stand aside this Day, O guilty ones

60.Mohammad Shafi: Did I not send guidance to you, O children of Adam, that you should not worship the Satan? He is indeed an open enemy to you

61.Mohammad Shafi: And that you worship Me. This is the Straight Path

62.Mohammad Shafi: And he (Satan) did certainly lead many a generation from among you astray. Could you not then understand

63.Mohammad Shafi: This is the Hell you were being warned of

64.Mohammad Shafi: Suffer it this Day since you suppressed the Truth

65.Mohammad Shafi: This Day We seal their mouths and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will bear witness as to what they earned

66.Mohammad Shafi: And had We so willed, We would have covered their eyes. Then, how would they see to get to the (Straight) Path?

67.Mohammad Shafi: And had We so willed, We would have degraded them in their position, then they would be able neither to proceed, nor turn back

68.Mohammad Shafi: And one whom We give a long life, We cause a reversal of creation in that one. Do they not understand

69.Mohammad Shafi: And We have not taught him (Prophet Muhammad) poetry, nor does it befit him. This (Qur'aan) is nothing but a clear Narrative and Reading

70.Mohammad Shafi: (The Qur'aan is meant) to warn him who is alive, and to expose those that suppress the Truth therein

71.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not see that We have created — of things Our hands have wrought — cattle for them, so they become their masters

72.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made the cattle subservient to them, so some of them they ride, and some they eat

73.Mohammad Shafi: And for them therein there are other benefits, and they get milk therefrom to drink. Will they not then be grateful

74.Mohammad Shafi: And they take gods besides Allah hoping to be helped

75.Mohammad Shafi: They (gods other than Allah) are incapable of helping them, and yet they (the polytheists) consider them (the gods) a host at their beck and call

76.Mohammad Shafi: So let not what they say grieve you. We do indeed know what they conceal and what they proclaim

77.Mohammad Shafi: Does not man see that We have created him from a little thing of fertilized ovum? And, lo, he has become an open adversary

78.Mohammad Shafi: And he (man) compares us to material things and forgets his own creation. He says, "Who will bring the bones to life, when they are rotten?"

79.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "He will bring life back to them, Who had brought them into existence in the first place. And He knows the entire creation."

80.Mohammad Shafi: "He Who makes fire for you out of the green tree, the fire with which then you kindle."

81.Mohammad Shafi: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth capable of creating the like thereof? Yes, of course! And He is the Creator, fully aware of all things

82.Mohammad Shafi: When He intends anything, His command to it is just to say, "Be", and it is

83.Mohammad Shafi: Glory then to Him in Whose hand is the sovereignty over all things! And to Him is your return

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Mohammad Shafi: By those that line up in row

2.Mohammad Shafi: And then charge fiercely (at the enemy

3.Mohammad Shafi: Reciting Allah's Greatness (Allaho-akbar)

4.Mohammad Shafi: Indeed! There is only One Entity Whom you should worship

5.Mohammad Shafi: (And the One Whom you should worship is the) Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is in between, and Lord of the easts!

6.Mohammad Shafi: We have indeed adorned the sky of this world with the glitter of the stars

7.Mohammad Shafi: And We have made it (the sky of this world) a safeguard against every defiant devil

8.Mohammad Shafi: They cannot listen to the deliberations of the Highest Assembly up there. And they are repelled from every side

9.Mohammad Shafi: They (the defiant devils) are driven off. And for them is perpetual punishment

10.Mohammad Shafi: In the exceptional case of a devil snatching away any secret, a piercing flame trails him

11.Mohammad Shafi: Ask them then whether what they have created was more difficult or what We have created. We have indeed created them of clinging clay

12.Mohammad Shafi: Nay! You wonder, while they mock

13.Mohammad Shafi: And when reminded, they take no heed

14.Mohammad Shafi: And when they see a (miraculous) sign (like Moses' staff turning into serpent), they mock at it

15.Mohammad Shafi: And say, "This is nothing but obvious magic."

16.Mohammad Shafi: "When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be raised to life again!?"

17.Mohammad Shafi: "We or our fore-fathers

18.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Yes! And you will be humble."

19.Mohammad Shafi: And it will but be one big shout, and then they will see

20.Mohammad Shafi: And they will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment."

21.Mohammad Shafi: This is the Day of Distinction (of those going to Paradise from those going to Hell), which you used to deny

22.Mohammad Shafi: Gather all those who wronged (themselves and others) and their associates, and what they worshippe

23.Mohammad Shafi: Besides Allah, and then lead them up the way to Hell

24.Mohammad Shafi: And stop them there to be questioned

25.Mohammad Shafi: "What is the matter with you that you help not one another?"

26.Mohammad Shafi: Nay! That day they will be submissive

27.Mohammad Shafi: And they will confront one another questioningly

28.Mohammad Shafi: Saying, "You did indeed use to come to us from the right side (exercise control over us)."

29.Mohammad Shafi: The others will say, "Nay! You (yourselves) were not believers."

30.Mohammad Shafi: "And we had no authority over you, but you (yourselves) were a transgressing people."

31.Mohammad Shafi: "And the word of our Lord has come true over us: we do indeed have to taste it."

32.Mohammad Shafi: "We led you astray, for we ourselves had gone astray."

33.Mohammad Shafi: So, that Day they will share the punishment

34.Mohammad Shafi: Thus do We deal with the criminals

35.Mohammad Shafi: They had indeed behaved arrogantly, when they were told, "There is no god but Allah!"

36.Mohammad Shafi: And they had said, "Shall we abandon our gods for the sake of a mad poet?"

37.Mohammad Shafi: Nay, he has come with the Truth and confirms what the Messengers (had come with before)

38.Mohammad Shafi: You shall indeed taste the painful punishment

39.Mohammad Shafi: And you shall be paid back nothing but for what you did

40.Mohammad Shafi: Save those who worship Allah alone devotedly

41.Mohammad Shafi: For them is sustenance as expecte

42.Mohammad Shafi: Of fruits. And they are honoured

43.Mohammad Shafi: In Gardens of bliss

44.Mohammad Shafi: On couches, facing one another

45.Mohammad Shafi: A bowl of pure original drink will be made to go around them

46.Mohammad Shafi: White in colour, delicious in taste

47.Mohammad Shafi: There will be nothing destructive in it, nor will they get intoxicated therewith

48.Mohammad Shafi: And with them will there be those with restraining looks from beautiful eyes

49.Mohammad Shafi: As if they were eggs, carefully shielded

50.Mohammad Shafi: Some of them will then accost others inquisitively

51.Mohammad Shafi: One of them will say, "I used to have a companion."

52.Mohammad Shafi: "Who asked, `Are you indeed of those who accept?

53.Mohammad Shafi: `When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then be brought to justice?'"

54.Mohammad Shafi: Another (person in Paradise) will say, "Will you have a look?"

55.Mohammad Shafi: Then he looked down and saw him (companion on earth of the man in Paradise) in the ignominy of Hell

56.Mohammad Shafi: He will say, "By Allah! You had almost ruined me."

57.Mohammad Shafi: "And had it not been for the largesse of my Lord, I should have been among those brought there!"

58.Mohammad Shafi: "Are we to have no death

59.Mohammad Shafi: Except for our previous death!? And are we not to be punished!?"

60.Mohammad Shafi: "This indeed is the highest success!!"

61.Mohammad Shafi: For the like of this, then, let the people do their work

62.Mohammad Shafi: Is this better as hospitable reception or Zaqqum, the tree of Hell

63.Mohammad Shafi: We have indeed made it [Zaqqum] a calamity for the wicked people

64.Mohammad Shafi: It is a tree that springs up at the bottom of Hell

65.Mohammad Shafi: Its shoots repulsive as devils' heads

66.Mohammad Shafi: Then indeed they will eat therefrom and fill their bellies therewith

67.Mohammad Shafi: Then indeed for them thereupon will there be a drink made of boiling water.

68.Mohammad Shafi: Then indeed their return shall be to the Hell

69.Mohammad Shafi: They indeed had found their fathers astra

70.Mohammad Shafi: So they hasten to follow in their (fathers') footsteps.

71.Mohammad Shafi: And most of the ancient peoples did go astray before them

72.Mohammad Shafi: And We did send warners among them

73.Mohammad Shafi: Then see what end those warned met with

74.Mohammad Shafi: Except for those who devotedly worship Allah alone

75.Mohammad Shafi: And Noah did certainly call out to Us, and how excellent was our response

76.Mohammad Shafi: And We saved him and the people with him from the great grief

77.Mohammad Shafi: And made his offspring the only survivors

78.Mohammad Shafi: And left on him [the salutation] among the later generations

79.Mohammad Shafi: "Peace on Noah among the worlds !"

80.Mohammad Shafi: Thus indeed do We reward the good people

81.Mohammad Shafi: He was indeed one of Our believing worshippers

82.Mohammad Shafi: We then drowned the others

83.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, Abraham was of his ilk

84.Mohammad Shafi: When he came to his Lord with a sound mind

85.Mohammad Shafi: When he said to his father and his people, "What is it that you worship?"

86.Mohammad Shafi: "Do you desire to perpetrate the lie that there are gods besides Allah?"

87.Mohammad Shafi: "What do you then think about the Lord of all the worlds?"

88.Mohammad Shafi: He then cast a glance at the stars

89.Mohammad Shafi: And said, "I am sick indeed!"

90.Mohammad Shafi: So they turned away from him

91.Mohammad Shafi: Then he secretly turned to their gods and asked them, "Don't you eat?"

92.Mohammad Shafi: "What is the matter with you that you do not speak?"

93.Mohammad Shafi: Then, unseen by anyone, he turned upon them, hitting them with his right hand

94.Mohammad Shafi: Then they (the people) came rushing to him

95.Mohammad Shafi: He (Abraham) asked, "Do you worship that which you (yourselves) carve out!?"

96.Mohammad Shafi: "And Allah has created you and your work."

97.Mohammad Shafi: They (the people) said, "Cast him (Abraham) into the flaming fire from a structure specially built for him."

98.Mohammad Shafi: And they devised a plan against him, but We brought them down

99.Mohammad Shafi: And he (Abraham) said, "I do indeed betake myself to my Lord — He will guide me."

100.Mohammad Shafi: "My Lord, grant me a righteous son."

101.Mohammad Shafi: So We gave him the good news of a gentle and kind son

102.Mohammad Shafi: And then when he (son) grew up to be able to work with him, he (Abraham) said, "O my son! I have seen in a dream that I sacrifice you. Now consider how you see it." He (son) said, "O my father! Act upon what is commanded to you. Allah willing, you will find me patient."

103.Mohammad Shafi: And then when they had both submitted to Allah's Will, and he (Abraham) had laid him (son) upon his forehead

104.Mohammad Shafi: And We called out to him, "O Abraham!"

105.Mohammad Shafi: "You have certainly fulfilled the obligation laid upon you in the vision. We do thus reward the good people."

107.Mohammad Shafi: And We ransomed him (Abraham) with a great sacrifice,

108.Mohammad Shafi: And left on him [the salutation] among the later generations

110.Mohammad Shafi: We do thus reward the good people

111.Mohammad Shafi: He was indeed one of Our believing worshippers

112.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave him the good news of (his son) Isaac, (who would also be) a prophet from among the righteous people

113.Mohammad Shafi: And We bestowed blessings on him and on Isaac. And of their offspring some have been good, but some, evidently unjust to themselves

114.Mohammad Shafi: And We did certainly confer a favour on Moses and Aaron

115.Mohammad Shafi: And We saved them both and their people from the great grief

116.Mohammad Shafi: And We helped them, and then they were the ones with the upper hand

117.Mohammad Shafi: And We gave them both the Book (Torah) that made things clear

118.Mohammad Shafi: And We guided them on the Straight Path

119.Mohammad Shafi: And left on them both [the salutation] among the later generations

121.Mohammad Shafi: Thus do We indeed reward the good people

122.Mohammad Shafi: They both were indeed among Our believing subjects

123.Mohammad Shafi: And Elias (Elijah) was indeed among those sent as Messengers

124.Mohammad Shafi: When he asked his people, "Are you not scared of wrongful living?"

125.Mohammad Shafi: "Do you pray to Ba'l (idol worshipped by Elias' people) and forsake the Best of the creators — "

126.Mohammad Shafi: " — Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"

127.Mohammad Shafi: But they rejected him (Elias), so they shall indeed certainly be presented (for punishment before the Lord)

128.Mohammad Shafi: Excpt for those who worship Allah alone devotedly

129.Mohammad Shafi: And We left on him [the salutation] among the later generations

131.Mohammad Shafi: We do indeed thus reward the good people

132.Mohammad Shafi: He was indeed among Our believing subjects

133.Mohammad Shafi: And Lot was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers

134.Mohammad Shafi: When We saved him and his family, all —

135.Mohammad Shafi: Except for an old woman who was left among those who remained behind

136.Mohammad Shafi: Then We destroyed the others [— other than those saved]

137.Mohammad Shafi: And you do indeed pass by them in the morning

138.Mohammad Shafi: And at night. Do you not then understand

139.Mohammad Shafi: And Jonah was certainly indeed one of those sent as Allah's Messengers

140.Mohammad Shafi: When he ran away to the laden ship

141.Mohammad Shafi: And then he (Jonas) embarked the ship with others but was one of those thrown overboard (into the sea).

142.Mohammad Shafi: And then the big fish swallowed him and he was himself to blame

143.Mohammad Shafi: But had he not indeed been of those who glorify (Allah)

144.Mohammad Shafi: He would have remained in its belly till the Day people are resurrected

145.Mohammad Shafi: Then We flung him on to the open shore, and he was sick

146.Mohammad Shafi: And We caused a gourd vine to grow up over him

147.Mohammad Shafi: And We sent him to a constituency of a hundred thousand or more

148.Mohammad Shafi: And they believed, so We let them enjoy life for a while

149.Mohammad Shafi: Now ask them (your people, O Muhammad) whether your Lord has daughters and they would like to have sons for themselves!

150.Mohammad Shafi: Did We create the angels as females, and did they witness their creation

151.Mohammad Shafi: Are they not just telling some of the lies they have themselves concocted

152.Mohammad Shafi: And (they say), "Allah has children." And they certainly are liars

153.Mohammad Shafi: Has He preferred to have daughters over sons

154.Mohammad Shafi: What is the matter with you? How poorly do you judge

155.Mohammad Shafi: Would you not yet take heed

156.Mohammad Shafi: Or, do you have any clear authority

157.Mohammad Shafi: Then produce your document, if what you say is true

158.Mohammad Shafi: And they assume a relationship between Him and the jinn. And the jinn do certainly know that they will be brought up for judgment

159.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is far more glorious than how they describe Him

160.Mohammad Shafi: Except for those who devotedly worship Allah alone

161.Mohammad Shafi: So you indeed and what you worship

162.Mohammad Shafi: Are incapable of tempting anyone against Him

163.Mohammad Shafi: Save him who is destined to burn in the flaming Fire

164.Mohammad Shafi: And there is none of us (Angels) but has an assigned place

165.Mohammad Shafi: And we are indeed those ranged in ranks

166.Mohammad Shafi: And we do indeed certainly glorify Him

167.Mohammad Shafi: And they did indeed use to say

168.Mohammad Shafi: "If only we had a scripture from the ancestors,"

169.Mohammad Shafi: "We would have devotedly worshipped Allah alone."

170.Mohammad Shafi: And so they now disbelieve in it (the Qur'aan), and so they will soon come to know

171.Mohammad Shafi: And Our word has certainly already gone forth to those of Our subjects sent as the Messengers

172.Mohammad Shafi: That they indeed are surely those who shall be helped

173.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, Ours will be the triumphant army

174.Mohammad Shafi: So turn away from them for a while

175.Mohammad Shafi: And observe them, they too will observe

176.Mohammad Shafi: Would they want Our punishment hastened

177.Mohammad Shafi: It will be a bad day for those who wait for the punishment, as it would descend in their yard

178.Mohammad Shafi: And turn away from them for a while

179.Mohammad Shafi: And observe, they too will observe

180.Mohammad Shafi: Your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, is far more glorified than how they describe Him

181.Mohammad Shafi: And peace on those sent as Messengers

182.Mohammad Shafi: And praise to Allah, the Lord of the worlds!

1.Mohammad Shafi: Sad. By this Qur'an, that contains all that one should remember and all that matters

2.Mohammad Shafi: But, verily, the suppressors of the Truth are lost in false pride, and deeply out of tune with Reality

3.Mohammad Shafi: How many a generation have We destroyed before them! They (the earlier generations) prayed to Us when it was too late for them to escape

4.Mohammad Shafi: And people deem it strange that a person from among themselves should have come to warn them! And the sppressors of the Truth say, "This one is but a lying magician!"

5.Mohammad Shafi: "Has he converted all deities into one single God? This is indeed a strange thing!"

6.Mohammad Shafi: And the leaders among them egged them on, "Go and persevere with your deities. This (what Muhammad is propounding) is indeed a thing designed!"

7.Mohammad Shafi: "We have not heard of this in any recent society! This is nothing but fabrication!"

8.Mohammad Shafi: "Is it upon him — from amongst us all — that the divine Scripture has been sent down!?" Nay! It is My Scripture that they doubt. Nay! They have not tasted the punishment I give

9.Mohammad Shafi: Or, do they have the treasures of your Lord's Mercy — the Lord Omnipotent, the Bestower of Grace!

10.Mohammad Shafi: Or, do they possess the absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth and all that is in between!? Let them then ascend in vehicles

11.Mohammad Shafi: The confederate forces are bound to suffer defeat there.

12.Mohammad Shafi: Before them, Noah's people, and the tribe of AAad, and Pharaoh of the many tent-pegs (i.e. with means and power), denied the Truth

13.Mohammad Shafi: And so did the tribe of Thamood, and the people of Lot, and the dwellers of the wood [Midian]: those were the peoples allied against the Truth

14.Mohammad Shafi: Not one among them but denied the Messengers. So they deserved My penalty

15.Mohammad Shafi: And these people (of this age) need wait for no more than one single blast (to be annihilated)

16.Mohammad Shafi: And they (the polytheists) say (mockingly), "Our Lord! Hasten on to us our share before the Day of Reckoning!"

17.Mohammad Shafi: Bear patiently what they (the polytheists) say, and remember Our devotee David, a man of strength. He was indeed of those who always turned to Us

18.Mohammad Shafi: We did indeed cause the mountains to join him (David) in extolling Our Glory at sunset and at sunrise

19.Mohammad Shafi: And the birds in their assemblies: they all would always turn to Him

20.Mohammad Shafi: And We strengthened his (David's) kingdom, and bestowed upon him wisdom and decisiveness in speech

21.Mohammad Shafi: And has the information of the litigants come to your knowledge when they climbed over the walls of (King David's) private chamber

22.Mohammad Shafi: When they confronted David, he shrank back in fear of them. They said, "Fear not! We are two litigants. One of us has wronged the other. So judge between us with justice, and deviate not from what is right, and show both of us the right path."

23.Mohammad Shafi: "This man here is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes, whereas I have one ewe. And he asks me to hand over to him even the one I have. And he prevailed over me in the discourse we had."

24.Mohammad Shafi: David said (to the complainant), "He has certainly wronged you by demanding that your ewe be added to his ewes! And indeed do many associates — except those who believe in Allah and do righteous deeds — wrong one another; but how few are those exceptions!" And David at once realized that We had tested him (by presenting to him the case of the ewes)! And so he asked his Lord to forgive him, and bowed down, and turned to Him in repentance.h

25.Mohammad Shafi: And We forgave him (David) that [the impropriety that he had committed]. And, indeed, he will certainly be among those near to us — the best place to return to

26.Mohammad Shafi: "O David! We have indeed made you a vicegerent on earth. Establish, then, a just rule among the people, and follow not vain desire, lest it lead you astray from Allah's Path. Those who go astray from Allah's Path shall indeed suffer severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Reckoning!"

27.Mohammad Shafi: AND We have not created the heaven and the earth and all that is in between in vain. That is what those who suppress the Truth think. Woe then from the Fire unto all those who suppress the Truth

28.Mohammad Shafi: Would We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who spread corruption on the earth!? Would We treat those who are Allah-fearing like those that are wicked!

29.Mohammad Shafi: Blessed is the Book We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad,] so that people may ponder over its Verses, and that those who are endowed with insight may pass on their understanding to others

30.Mohammad Shafi: And We bestowed Solomon — an excellent devotee — [as a son] to David. He would indeed always turn to Us

31.Mohammad Shafi: As, towards the close of day, well-bred horses were brought before him (Solomon)

32.Mohammad Shafi: He (Solomon) said, "I have indeed come to love the good things in life as these remind me of my Lord (Who has created them)!" And when they (the horses) were out of sight under the veil of darkness (of the night)

33.Mohammad Shafi: (Solomon ordered,) "Bring them (the horses) back to me!" And then he would [lovingly] stroke their legs and their necks

34.Mohammad Shafi: And We did certainly put Solomon on trial by placing upon his throne a [lifeless] body; and thereupon he turned in repentance to Us

35.Mohammad Shafi: He (Solomon) prayed, "O my Lord! Forgive me my sins, and bestow upon me a kingdom which may not suit anyone after me. You are indeed the bestower of gifts!"

36.Mohammad Shafi: We then made the wind subservient to him, so that it blew gently at his behest in the direction he willed

37.Mohammad Shafi: And (We made) the devils (work for him) in every kind of construction activity and in diving

38.Mohammad Shafi: And there were others too (who worked for him while) linked together in fetters

39.Mohammad Shafi: [And We told him,] "This is Our special Grant; whether you help others with it or not, no account will be taken!"

40.Mohammad Shafi: And, indeed, he (Solomon) will certainly be among those near to us — the best place to return to

41.Mohammad Shafi: And recall when Our devotee Job prayed to his Lord, "The Satan has indeed afflicted me with illness and suffering!"

42.Mohammad Shafi: [He was told,] "Stamp your foot!" [Water springs out from the ground.] "This is cool water to wash with and to drink!"

43.Mohammad Shafi: And We restored to him his family and as many more with them, as an act of grace from Us, and as a source of inspiration to all who are endowed with insight

44.Mohammad Shafi: [And We told him,] "Now take a handful of herbs and strike therewith, and you shall not break your oath!" We did indeed find him patient in adversity — an excellent devotee, who would always turn to Us

45.Mohammad Shafi: And recall Our servants Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, who were all endowed with inner strength and vision

46.Mohammad Shafi: We did indeed purify them by means of the purity of the remembrance of the life to come

47.Mohammad Shafi: And they were certainly indeed, in Our sight, among the selected best of humankind

48.Mohammad Shafi: And recall Ishmael and Elisha, and Zulkifl : every one of them was among the best of humankind

49.Mohammad Shafi: This [Qur'aan] is a Reminder/Narrative [of all that leads mankind to Paradise and all that leads them to Hell]. And, certainly indeed, the most beauteous of all goals awaits those who are pious and Allah-fearing

50.Mohammad Shafi: The goals are gardens of perpetual bliss with gates kept open for them [the pious and Allah-fearing]

51.Mohammad Shafi: They will be comfortable and at ease therein, frequently calling for fruits and drinks

52.Mohammad Shafi: And they will have with them companions of modest gaze

53.Mohammad Shafi: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning

54.Mohammad Shafi: This, certainly indeed, shall be Our inexhaustible provision

55.Mohammad Shafi: This [provision would of course be there as promised!] And, certainly indeed, the most evil of all goals awaits those who transgress the bounds of what is right

56.Mohammad Shafi: Hell! They will suffer therein. And how vile a resting-place

57.Mohammad Shafi: This, [then, is for them.] So let them taste it: boiling water (to drink) and a pus-like thing (to eat!

58.Mohammad Shafi: And other torments in pairs of similar nature [— similar to those mentioned in the preceding Verse]

59.Mohammad Shafi: This crowd of people who went headlong with you into sin — no welcome to them either! They shall indeed suffer the Fire

60.Mohammad Shafi: They [the seduced] will say [to the seducers], "Nay, but it is you who are not welcome! You have brought this upon us: and it is a vile state to be in!"

61.Mohammad Shafi: They will say, "Our Lord! Increase the punishment in the Fire twofold for those who brought this upon us!"

62.Mohammad Shafi: And they will say, "How come we do not see men whom we counted among the evil?"

63.Mohammad Shafi: "We used to hold them in ridicule! Or is it that our eyes have missed them?"

64.Mohammad Shafi: That, indeed, will in truth be the mutual wrangling among the people of the Fire

65.Mohammad Shafi: Say [O Muhammad], "I am only a warner! And there is none worthy of worship other than Allah, the One and Only, the Almighty."

66.Mohammad Shafi: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is in between, the Omnipotent, the Ultimate Forgiver!"

67.Mohammad Shafi: Say: "This is a Message of the greatest importance!"

68.Mohammad Shafi: "[And] you turn away from it!"

69.Mohammad Shafi: "I could have had no knowledge of the angels up there when they argued [against the creation of man]."

70.Mohammad Shafi: "[I could have no knowledge of it] if it had not been revealed to me [by Allah's permission.] I am but a plain warner."

71.Mohammad Shafi: When your Lord said to the angels, "I am indeed about to create a human being out of clay."

72.Mohammad Shafi: "And when I have completed his form and breathed into him of My spirit, lie down before him in prostration!"

73.Mohammad Shafi: The angels then prostrated all of them together

74.Mohammad Shafi: [All] except Iblees, who became arrogant, and [thus] became one of those who suppress the Truth

75.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "O Iblees! What has prevented you from prostrating before what I have created with My hands? Are you proud or are you of those who think of themselves as high and mighty!?"

76.Mohammad Shafi: Iblees replied, "I am better than he. You have created me out of fire [energy], and You have created him out of clay [matter]."

77.Mohammad Shafi: Allah said, "Get out from here; for, indeed, you are expelled!"

78.Mohammad Shafi: "And My curse shall be on you till the Judgment Day!"

79.Mohammad Shafi: Iblees said, "My Lord! Give me respite then till the Day of Resurrection!"

80.Mohammad Shafi: Allah Ta'ala said, "So shall you indeed be among those given respite"

81.Mohammad Shafi: "For a period of time the duration of which is fixed."

82.Mohammad Shafi: Iblees said, "Then I swear by Your Honour that I shall certainly seduce them all,"

83.Mohammad Shafi: "All except those subjects of Yours who are sincerely devoted to You!"

84.Mohammad Shafi: Allah Ta'ala said, "The Truth, then — and in Truth do I state:"

85.Mohammad Shafi: "Certainly will I fill Hell with you and with all those who shall follow you among them!"

86.Mohammad Shafi: Say [O Prophet], "I ask of you no reward for this [Qur'aan]. And I am not pretentious."

87.Mohammad Shafi: "This [Qur'aan] is nothing but that which all human beings need to constantly refer to for rightful decisions and actions in their respective worlds."

88.Mohammad Shafi: "And you will certainly come to know its [Qur'aan's] Message [of the greatest importance] after some time! "

1.Mohammad Shafi: Revelation of the Book is from Allah, the Omnipotent, the Wise

2.Mohammad Shafi: We have revealed the Book to you [Prophet Muhammad] in Truth, indeed! Worship Allah, then, consecrating your lifestyle exclusively for Him

3.Mohammad Shafi: Is it not for Allah that the pure way of life is!? And those who have taken awliya besides Allah (say), "We worship them not but that they may bring us nearer to Allah." Allah will indeed decide among them concerning what they differ in. Allah does indeed not guide anyone who is a lying suppressor of the Truth

4.Mohammad Shafi: Had Allah wanted to have a son, He could have chosen anyone He willed out of those whom He created. Glorified is He! He is Allah: the One and Only, the Almighty

5.Mohammad Shafi: He created the heavens and the earth; and it was His privilege to create them. He wraps the day over the night and wraps the night over the day. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each to run its course until an appointed time. Is He not the Omnipotent, the Ultimate Forgiver!

6.Mohammad Shafi: He (Allah) created you from a single being (Adam), and from that single being He made its mate. And He sent down for you eight cattle in pairs.ah He creates you in your mothersԠwombs, giving you one form after another inside three layers of darkness. That is Allah, your Lord. His is the sovereignty over all things. There is none worthy of worship other than Him. So what has made you turn away

7.Mohammad Shafi: If you suppress the Truth, then indeed Allah stands in no need of you. And He likes not that His subjects should suppress the Truth. And if you are grateful, He likes that for you. None shall bear anotherճ burden. Then to your Lord is your return and He will tell you what you had been doing. He is indeed well aware of what lies hidden in your minds

8.Mohammad Shafi: When any affliction affects man, he cries out to his Lord, turning to Him alone. Then when his Lord bestows His favour upon him, he forgets what he had cried out to Him for before, and sets up rivals to Allah that they may lead others astray from His Path. Say, (O Prophet), "Enjoy your suppression of the Truth for a while. Indeed, you will be among the inmates of the Fire."

9.Mohammad Shafi: Or [take the example of] one who remembers Allah assiduously during parts of the night, prostrating and standing, fears the Hereafter, and seeks His Lord's mercy [and] ask, "Are those who know [like that one] equal to those who do not know?" Only those endowed with insight take heed

10.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "O my fellow subjects of Allah who believe, fear your Lord! A good reward awaits those who are good in this world. And Allah's earth is spacious. Indeed those who persevere shall be granted their reward without measure beyond what is due to them."

11.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I am indeed commanded to worship Allah, consecrating my lifestyle exclusively to Him."

12.Mohammad Shafi: "And I am commanded to be the first of those who surrender to Him."

13.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I do indeed fear the punishment of a dreadful Day if I disobey my Lord,."

14.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Allah shall I worship, consecrating my lifestyle exclusively to Him."

15.Mohammad Shafi: "You worship whomsoever you please, then, apart from Him." Say, "Those, indeed, shall be the losers who will have lost their own selves and their kith and kin on the Day of Resurrection! Is that not obviously the real loss?"

16.Mohammad Shafi: For them, sheets of fire above them and sheets beneath them! This is what Allah warns His subjects against. "Fear me then, O you subjects of Mine!"

17.Mohammad Shafi: And those who eschew worshipping false gods and return penitently to Allah — good news for them! (O Prophet!) Give good news to My subjects

18.Mohammad Shafi: Those who pay heed to the Word [Qur'aan] and follow the the good guidance thereof. Those are the ones whom Allah has guided. And those are the ones endowed with insight

19.Mohammad Shafi: What about the one on whom the sentence of punishment is decreed — can you save the one already in the Fire?"

20.Mohammad Shafi: But for those who fear their Lord there shall be chambers built over chambers beneath which rivers flow. Allahճ promise — and never does Allah fail to fulfill His promise

21.Mohammad Shafi: Do you not see that Allah sent down water from the sky, then made it flow on earth as resources of water, and then with it He brings out vegetation of various hues. Then this vegetation withers, and you see it turn yellow, and then He reduces it to rubble? Indeed there is a lesson in this for those endowed with insight

22.Mohammad Shafi: Is one then whose head Allah has opened for Islam and who is guided by the light from his Lord (be likened to) those — woe to them — whose minds are hardened against any remembrance of Allah. Those are the ones who have obviously gone astray

23.Mohammad Shafi: Allah has sent down the best hadeeth [Qur'aan], a Book with oft-repeated passages resembling one another. Thereat shiver the skins of those that fear their Lord! And then their skins and their minds become receptive to Allahճ remembrance. That is Allahճ Guidance! He guides therewith whosoever He wills. And one whom Allah lets go astray has none to guide him

24.Mohammad Shafi: How about the one who has to face the severe punishment on the Day of Resurrection? Wrong-doers [like that one] shall be told, "Taste what you earned." acwe. Kaththaba allatheena min qablihim faatahumu alAAathabu min haythu la yashAAuroon

25.Mohammad Shafi: The peoples that lived before them denied the Truth. Then the punishment came upon them from where they knew not

26.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah made them taste disgrace in the life of this world, and certainly the punishment of the Hereafter will be much more grievous. If only they knew

27.Mohammad Shafi: And We have certainly quoted for mankind from every kind of situations [they may face] in this Qurաn for them to remember and relate from

28.Mohammad Shafi: An Arabic Qurաn, without crookedness, for them to take heed from

29.Mohammad Shafi: Allah quotes an example: a man shared by several contending masters, and another submitting to one man. Can the two be alike? All praise to Allah! But most of them know not

30.Mohammad Shafi: You (Prophet Muhammad) are mortal and so are they

31.Mohammad Shafi: Then [after death] all of you will be contesting before your Lord on the Day of Resurrection

32.Mohammad Shafi: Who, then, can be more wicked than he who lied against Allah and denied the Truth when it came to him? Is not in Hell an abode for those who suppress the Truth

33.Mohammad Shafi: And one who came with the Truth, and one who confirmed it as true — such are the ones who practice piety

34.Mohammad Shafi: For them there shall be, with their Lord, whatever they desire. That is the reward for good people

35.Mohammad Shafi: [The reward of the good people is] such that Allah remits their bad deeds and compensates them well for their good deeds

36.Mohammad Shafi: Is Allah not sufficient for His subject? They frighten you of others besides Him. And there is none to guide the one whom Allah lets go astray

37.Mohammad Shafi: And one whom Allah guides, none can lead that one astray. Is not Allah Omnipotent, with power to give a fitting retribution

38.Mohammad Shafi: And if you ask them `Who created the heavens and the earth?' they will surely reply `Allah.' Tell them, `What do you think, then, of those whom you pray to instead of Allah? If Allah should will to harm me, will those remove the harm inflicted by Him? Or if Allah should will to be merciful to me, will they be able to wit old His Mercy from me?' Say, "Allah is sufficient for me. In Him should put their trust — all those who do trust!"

39.Mohammad Shafi: Tell them, "O my people! Do what you do, as hard as you may, I too will do what I should. You shall soon know."

40.Mohammad Shafi: "[You shall soon know] who suffers a disgracing punishment and whom the everlasting punishment is due upon."

41.Mohammad Shafi: We have sent down the Book upon you [Prophet Muhammad] with the Truth for all mankind. So one who takes guidance therefrom, one does so to one's own benefit. And one, who goes astray therefrom, shall hurt only one's own self by straying. You are not a manager of their affairs

42.Mohammad Shafi: It is Allah Who takes away the souls of people at their death; and in their sleep, of those that have not died. Then He retains the souls of those against whom He had decreed death and returns those of others till an appointed time. In that indeed are signs for people who reflect

43.Mohammad Shafi: Or have they taken intercessors other than Allah? Say, "Can they intercede even if they have no power and do not even understand?"

44.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "All intercession lies with Allah. His is the absolute sovereignty over the heavens and the earth. And to Him will all of you be returned."

45.Mohammad Shafi: And when Allah alone is mentioned, minds of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink away with aversion. And when others are mentioned besides Allah, they are filled with joy

46.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "O Allah, the Maker of the heavens and the earth, the Knower of the unseen and the seen! You are the One to judge among Your subjects in matters they have been differing in."

47.Mohammad Shafi: Had the wrong-doers at their disposal the treasures of the earth in their entirety and as much besides, they would gladly offer it on the Day of Resurrection to redeem themselves from the harrowing punishment. For, there will appear to them from Allah something (sinister) they had never even imagined

48.Mohammad Shafi: The evil that they earn will be apparent to them, and that which they scoffed at shall besiege them

49.Mohammad Shafi: When an affliction affects man, he prays to Us. Then when We bestow upon him a favour from Us, he says, "I have been given this because of my knowledge." Nay! This favour is a test; but most of them know not

50.Mohammad Shafi: The people before them had said the same, but their earnings were of no avail to them

51.Mohammad Shafi: And the evil they earned hit them. The wrongdoers among these now will also be hit by the evil they earn. They will not escape

52.Mohammad Shafi: Do they not know that Allah gives the provision in ample measure to whom He wills and restricts it to whom He wills? Therein are signs for those that believe

53.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "O my fellow subjects of Allah — those who have committed excesses against themselves! Despair not of Allah's Mercy. Allah does indeed forgive all sins; He is indeed the One forgiving, merciful."

54.Mohammad Shafi: "Turn to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes to you. Thereafter, you will receive no help."

55.Mohammad Shafi: "Follow the good admonition that has been sent down for you from your Lord before the punishment catches you unawares."

56.Mohammad Shafi: Lest anyone should say, "Oh! I am so sorry for neglecting my duty towards Allah and for being among those that scoffed."

57.Mohammad Shafi: Or should anyone say, "If only Allah had guided me, I should have been among the pious."

58.Mohammad Shafi: Or should anyone say on seeing the (gravity of the) punishment, "O that I could have another chance, and then be among those who do good deeds!"

59.Mohammad Shafi: Yes (you had your chances)! My signs did come to you but you rejected them. And you behaved arrogantly and were among those who suppressed the Truth

60.Mohammad Shafi: And on the Day of Resurrection you shall see the faces, of those who had lied against Allah, blackened! Is not the (proper) abode, for arrogant people, in Hell

61.Mohammad Shafi: And Allah will save the Allah-fearing on account of their success in resisting the evil. No harm shall touch them nor shall they grieve

62.Mohammad Shafi: Allah is the Creator of everything. And He is the Manager of affairs for everything.

63.Mohammad Shafi: He (Allah) has the keys of the heavens and the earth. And those who suppress Allahճ signs — they will be the doomed ones

64.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "O you ignorant people! Do you tell me to worship anyone other than Allah!?"

65.Mohammad Shafi: And, most certainly, it was revealed to you and to all Prophets before you that if you worship anyone besides Allah, your deeds will certainly be worthless and you will certainly be among the doomed ones

66.Mohammad Shafi: So then worship Allah alone and be among those that are grateful

67.Mohammad Shafi: And they have not given Allah the Honour that is due to Him! On the Day of Resurrection the entire earth will be in His grasp, and the heavens shall be folded up in His Right Hand. Glorified and Exalted is He from all that they worship besides Him.

68.Mohammad Shafi: And the Trumpet shall be blown and all who are in the heavens and the earth shall fall down dead save those whom Allah wills. Thereafter the Trumpet shall be blown again, and then all of them will be up on their feet, looking all around

69.Mohammad Shafi: And the earth shall shine with the light of its Lord, the Book (of deeds) shall be produced, the Prophets and all witnesses shall be brought, cases among them shall be justly decided, and they shall not be wronged

70.Mohammad Shafi: And everyone shall be paid in full for all that he/she did. And Allah knows what they do

71.Mohammad Shafi: And the suppressors of Truth shall be led in groups towards Hell until when they arrive there, its gates shall be opened. And its keepers shall ask them, "Did Messengers from among yourselves not come to you, reciting Verses/signs of your Lord to you and warning you of your meeting on this Day?" They will say, "Yes, they did come!" But the sentence of punishment was bound to be executed against the suppressors of Truth

72.Mohammad Shafi: They will be told, "Enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein!" Evil then is the abode of those that are arrogant

73.Mohammad Shafi: And those who feared their Lord shall be led in groups towards Paradise until when they arrive there, its gates shall be opened. And its keepers shall say to them, "Peace upon you; you did well! So enter it (Paradise) to abide eternally therein."

74.Mohammad Shafi: And they will say, "The praise is for Allah Who has made His promise to us come true, and Who gave us the earth to inherit. We may now dwell in Paradise wherever we please." Excellent is the reward of those who did good deeds

75.Mohammad Shafi: And you shall see the angels thronging around the Throne, glorifying their Lord with His praise. Cases among them will be justly decided. And it will be said, "The praise is for Allah, the Lord of the worlds."

1.Mohammad Shafi: These are among letters of the Arabic language that appear at the beginning of some Qur'aanic chapters. Significance of these letters is a mystery. Omniscient Allah has perhaps purposely kept it mysterious to remind mankind of the limitation of knowledge it is bestowed with

2.Mohammad Shafi: Sending down of the Book (Qur'aan) is from Allah, the Omnipotent, the Knowledgeable

3.Mohammad Shafi: Forgiver of the sin and Acceptor of the repentance, severe in giving punishment, limitless in reach. None is worthy of worship other than He. To Him is the final destination

4.Mohammad Shafi: No one calls Allah's Verses in question, but those who suppress the Truth! Hence, let not their activity among the populace deceive you

5.Mohammad Shafi: People of Noah, before them, denied the Truth. And the tribes, after them, did the same. And every people tried hard to engage their Messenger in false arguments and smother the Truth thereby. But then I caught hold of them! And how did I punish them!

6.Mohammad Shafi: And thus was the word of your Lord concerning those who suppressed the Truth fulfilled — that they would be inmates of the Fire

7.Mohammad Shafi: Those that bear the Throne, and are around It, hymn the praise of their Lord and do believe in the praise they hymn. And they pray for forgiveness for those who believe, "Our Lord! You comprehend all things in mercy and knowledge. Do forgive those who repent and follow Your way, and save them from the punishment of Hell."

8.Mohammad Shafi: "Our Lord! And admit them to the Gardens of Eden which You have promised them, and admit thereinto such of their fathers and their wives and their descendants as mend their ways. You are indeed the One Omnipotent, Wise."

9.Mohammad Shafi: "And save them from bad deeds! And one whom You have saved from bad deeds, that one, verily, You have taken into mercy that day. That is the highest success."

10.Mohammad Shafi: An announcement is indeed made to those who had suppressed the Truth, "Allah's abhorrence is certainly more terrible than your abhorrence one of another, when you were called towards belief but you declined!"

11.Mohammad Shafi: They say, "Our Lord! Twice have You kept us in a dead state, and twice have You given us life. Now that we do confess to our sins, is there any way out?"

12.Mohammad Shafi: "You are in this plight because, when only Allah was invoked, you would suppress your belief, but when someone besides Him was invoked, you would demonstrate your belief. The command then is only with Allah, Who is the One, and only, High and Great."

13.Mohammad Shafi: He it is Who shows you His signs, and sends down for you provision from the sky. And none pays attention save one who turns to Him in repentance

14.Mohammad Shafi: So pray to Allah, making your way of life exclusively for Him, and even if the suppressors of Truth be averse

15.Mohammad Shafi: Exalter of the Ranks, Lord of the Throne (Seat of absolute authority)! He transmits the Spirit of His command upon whom He wills of His subjects to warn people of the Day of Meeting

16.Mohammad Shafi: The Day they emerge (from the graves), nothing of them being hidden from Allah! Whose is the Sovereignty that day? Allah's — the One, the Almighty

17.Mohammad Shafi: This day everyone is rewarded what one had earned; no wrong, this day! Allah indeed is swift at accounts

18.Mohammad Shafi: And warn them of the Approaching (Judgment) Day, when the hearts will be choking at the throats, when shall there be no friend for the wrong-doers, nor shall any intercessor be heeded

19.Mohammad Shafi: He knows the traitor of the eyes, as well as that which the heads (minds) hide

20.Mohammad Shafi: Allah's decision is based on truth, and those whom they pray to besides Him decide nothing. Allah is indeed the One Who listens, sees

21.Mohammad Shafi: Have they not travelled on the earth to see what happened to those who lived before them? Those were stronger than these in power and influence on the earth. Yet Allah seized them for their sins, and none could defend them from Allah

22.Mohammad Shafi: That was because their Messengers did bring them clear evidences (of Allah's Sovereignty) but they suppressed those evidences and Allah caught hold of them. He is indeed strong, severe in punishment

23.Mohammad Shafi: And We did send Moses with Our signs and a clear warran

24.Mohammad Shafi: Towards Pharaoh and Haman and Korah, but they called Moses a lying sorcerer

25.Mohammad Shafi: Then as he (Moses) brought them the Truth from Us, they ordered, "Kill the sons of those who believe with him, and spare their women." And the plot of those who suppress the Truth cannot but be faulty

26.Mohammad Shafi: And Pharaoh said, "Leave killing of Moses to me, and let him pray to his Lord. I do indeed fear that he will change your way of life or that he will cause anarchy to spread in the land

27.Mohammad Shafi: And Moses said, "I do indeed seek refuge in my Lord and your Lord from every arrogant person who believes not in the Day of Account-taking."

28.Mohammad Shafi: And a believing man of Pharaoh's family, who concealed his faith, said, "Would you kill a man because he says, `My Lord is Allah,' and has brought you clear evidences from your Lord? If he is lying, he will himself suffer therefor; and if he is truthful, then something of what he warns you of will strike you. Allah does indeed guide not one who is a lying transgressor."

29.Mohammad Shafi: "O my people! Today, you have the ruling authority, you having the upper land. But who would save us from the wrath of Allah should it come to us?" Pharaoh said, "I do but show you what I see, and I do but guide you to wise way."

30.Mohammad Shafi: And a believer said, "O my people! I do indeed fear for you a day like that faced by the confederates."

31.Mohammad Shafi: "Like what happened to Noah's folk, and AAad and Thamood, and those that lived after them, and Allah wills no injustice for His subjects."

32.Mohammad Shafi: "And, O my people, I do indeed fear for you a Day of (general) Summons to all (dead) people [when they shall all rise alive and gather together for Allah to pronounce His judgment on everyone and everything]."

33.Mohammad Shafi: A Day when you will turn to flee, having none to defend you from Allah. And there is none to guide one whom Allah sends astray

34.Mohammad Shafi: And verily Joseph had come to you earlier with clear signs, yet you ceased not to be in doubt concerning what he had come to you with; till, when he died, you said, "Allah will not raise any Messenger after him." Thus does Allah let a doubting transgressor go astray

35.Mohammad Shafi: [Allah lets] those [go astray] who quarrel over Allah's Verses/signs without having any authority — a greatly hateful behaviour in the sight of Allah and in the sight of those who believe. Allah thus does set a seal [of abhorrence] on arrogant mind of every tyrant

36.Mohammad Shafi: And Pharaoh said, "O Haman! Build for me a tower that I may get to the means."

37.Mohammad Shafi: "The means of access to the heavens to rise up to the Entity Moses worships, though indeed I consider him a liar." Thus did the evil in what Pharaoh did seem good to him, and he was debarred from the path of righteousness. And Pharaoh's plan was bound to come to naught

38.Mohammad Shafi: And the man who believed said, "O my people! Follow me. I will show you the way of right conduct."

39.Mohammad Shafi: "O my people! Life of this world is but a temporary provision, and the Hereafter — that is the permanent home."

40.Mohammad Shafi: Whoever does an ill-deed, he will not be repaid but by the like thereof. And everyone, male or female, doing a righteous deed and believing, will enter the Garden to be provided with therein without measure

41.Mohammad Shafi: And (the believing man from among Pharaoh's people continued,) "O my people! What is the matter with me that I call you to salvation while you call me to the Fire!?"

42.Mohammad Shafi: "You call me to suppress my belief in the Oneness of Allah and to worship others besides Him — others of whom I have no knowledge! And I call you to the Omnipotent, the Forgiver."

43.Mohammad Shafi: "There is no doubt that the thing you call me to has no claim to being of any substance in this world or in the Hereafter, that our return will be to Allah, and that the transgressors will be the inmates of the Fire."

44.Mohammad Shafi: "And you will remember what I say to you. I entrust my cause to Allah. Allah does indeed see all that His subjects do."

45.Mohammad Shafi: Allah then protected him from the evils of what they plotted. And the scourge of punishment encompassed Pharaoh's people

46.Mohammad Shafi: The Fire — they (Pharaoh's people) were warned about it morning and evening. And the day the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin) arrives (it will be said,) "Put Pharaoh's people to the most severe punishment."

47.Mohammad Shafi: And when they quarrel in the Fire, the weak ask the proud, "We were just your followers. Would you therefore relieve us of a portion of the Fire?"

48.Mohammad Shafi: The proud say, "We are all together in this. Allah has already pronounced the Judgment on His subjects."h

49.Mohammad Shafi: And those in the Fire plead with the guards of Hell, "Entreat your Lord that He gives us this day some relief from the punishment."

50.Mohammad Shafi: They [the guards] say, "Did not your Messengers come to you with clear evidences?" They [those in the Fire] say, "Yes, they did." The guards say, "Then you yourself make the prayer to Allah! And the prayer of those that suppress the Truth is but in vain."

51.Mohammad Shafi: We do indeed help Our Messengers, and those who believe, in the life of the world and on the Day the witnesses arise

52.Mohammad Shafi: The Day when the excuse of the wrong-doers shall avail them not. And for them is the curse, and for them the ill abode

53.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Moses the guidance, and We made the Children of Israel inherit the Book

54.Mohammad Shafi: [The Book was] guide and message for men of understanding

55.Mohammad Shafi: Do have patience then! Allah's promise is indeed true. And ask for forgiveness of your sin, and hymn the praise of your Lord in the evening and in the early morning

56.Mohammad Shafi: Those indeed who raise disputes concerning Allah's Verses without any divine authority having come to them, there is nothing in their minds but greatness which they will never attain. So take refuge in Allah. He — He alone — indeed is the One to hear, see

57.Mohammad Shafi: Creation of the heavens and the earth is certainly greater than creation of mankind. However, most people know not

58.Mohammad Shafi: And the blind man and one who is able to see are not equal, neither are those who believe and do good works equal to the evil one. Little do you reflect

59.Mohammad Shafi: The Hour is certainly coming, no doubt thereof! However, most people believe not

60.Mohammad Shafi: And your Lord has said, "Pray to Me and I will respond to you. Those indeed who are too proud to worship Me — those will enter Hell humiliated."

61.Mohammad Shafi: It is Allah Who has made night for you to rest therein, and He has made day for you to see well therein. Allah is indeed most gracious on mankind, yet most people give no thanks

62.Mohammad Shafi: That (Gracious One) is Allah, your Lord, the Creator of all things! There is none worthy of worship but He. How then are you fooled by falsehood

63.Mohammad Shafi: Thus are they fooled who reject Allah's Verses

64.Mohammad Shafi: It is Allah Who made the earth a dwelling-place for you and the sky, a generator of means to provide sustenance. And He shaped you and perfected your shapes, and has provided you with good things. That is Allah, your Lord. Blessed then is Allah, the Lord of the worlds

65.Mohammad Shafi: He is the ever-living One. None is worthy of worship but He. So pray to Him, keeping your way of life exclusively for Him. Praise to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds

66.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "I am indeed forbidden to worship those whom you pray to besides Allah since clear evidences have come to me from my Lord, and I am commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

67.Mohammad Shafi: It is He Who created you from dust, then from a tiny seed of fertilized ovum, then from a clinging leech-like clot of blood. He then brings you out as a child, then facilitates you to attain to full strength and then to become old — though some among you die before — so that you reach an appointed term, and so that you understand (sentence continued to next Verse

68.Mohammad Shafi: (That) it is He Who gives life and causes death. When He ordains a thing, He just tells it, "Be" and it is

69.Mohammad Shafi: Have you not seen those who dispute Allah's Verses/signs, how they are deviated?

70.Mohammad Shafi: Those who deny the Bookand that wherewith We sent Our Messengers. But they will come to know the Truth

71.Mohammad Shafi: When they are dragged by chains, with iron collars around their necks

72.Mohammad Shafi: Through boiling waters. Then they are burned in the Fire

73.Mohammad Shafi: Then they are asked, "Where are all those whom you worshipped"

74.Mohammad Shafi: "(Worshipped) besides Allah?" They reply, "They have failed us; but what we used to pray to besides Allah before had no legitimacy to pray to at all!" Thus does Allah send astray those that suppress the Truth

75.Mohammad Shafi: (They are told,), "You are in this sorry plight because you used to exult on earth without right, and because you used to be insolent."

76.Mohammad Shafi: "Enter now the gates of Hell, to dwell therein. Evil then is the abode of the arrogant."

77.Mohammad Shafi: Do have patience then! Allah's promise is indeed true. And whether we let you see something of what We promise them, or We cause you to die, still to Us they will be brought back

78.Mohammad Shafi: And We did send Messengers before you. We have told you about some of them, and We have not told you about the others. And it was not given to any Messenger that he should bring a (miraculous) sign save by Allah's leave. Then as Allah's decree comes, every matter is judged in accordance with the Truth, and the followers of falsehood will then be lost

79.Mohammad Shafi: It is Allah Who has made cattle for you to ride on some of them — and you eat some of them

80.Mohammad Shafi: And you have in them (cattle) benefits — and to satisfy by their means a need in your minds, you are carried upon them, as upon the ship

81.Mohammad Shafi: And He continues to show you His signs. Which, then, of the signs of Allah do you deny

82.Mohammad Shafi: Have they not travelled on earth to see what happened to those before them? Those were more in number than them, and stronger in power and influence on the earth. But what they earned availed them not

83.Mohammad Shafi: And when their Messengers brought them clear evidences (of divine Presence) they exulted in the knowledge they themselves had. And the thing they mocked at besieged them

84.Mohammad Shafi: Then, as they saw the severity of Our punishment, they said, "We believe in Allah, the One and Only, and reject all those whom we had worshipped besides Him."

85.Mohammad Shafi: But their believing after seeing the severity of our punishment will be of no avail to them. This has always been Allah's law for His subjects. And then the suppressors of Truth will be doomed

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Mohammad Shafi: Ha Mi

2.Mohammad Shafi: [This is] sent down from the Gracious, the Merciful

3.Mohammad Shafi: [It is] a Book with its Verses well explained, [and it is] a recitation in Arabic for people with knowledge

4.Mohammad Shafi: Heralding good news and giving warnings. And most of them turn away and listen not

5.Mohammad Shafi: And they say, "Our minds are immune to what you call us to, our ears are deaf thereto, and there is a barrier between us and you. So you act your way, we do indeed act our way."

6.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Although I am a man like you, it is revealed to me that the Entity worthy of worship by all of you is One and only One. So take the straight path to Him, and ask for gorgiveness of Him. And woe to all those who worship others besides Allah."

7.Mohammad Shafi: "Those that do not give the Zakaat, and do not believe in the Hereafter."

8.Mohammad Shafi: Those indeed that believe and do righteous deeds, those will have an uninterrupted reward

9.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Do you really deny Him Who created the earth in two spans of time, and set up equals to Him — Him, the Lord of all the worlds!?"

10.Mohammad Shafi: "And, in four spans of time, He placed firm mountains rising above its surface, blessed it with plenty and growth, and ingrained within itself its provisions, sufficient for all needs. "

11.Mohammad Shafi: "Then He turned to the heaven, and it was all smoke. And He said to it and to the earth, `Come you both, willingly or unwillingly!' They both said, `We do willingly come.'"

12.Mohammad Shafi: Then He decreed it to become seven heavens in two spans of time, and ingrained in every heaven its function. And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps (stars), and set it up as a guard (to protect the earth and life thereon). This is how the One Omnipotent, All-knowing has decreed

13.Mohammad Shafi: If even then they turn away, tell them, "I forewarn you of a thunderbolt like the one that struck (the ancient people of) AAad and Thamood."

14.Mohammad Shafi: When the Messengers came to them or to those who lived before or after them asking them not to worship any one but Allah, they all said, "If our Lord had so pleased He would certainly have sent the angels down. So we do indeed reject what you are sent with."

15.Mohammad Shafi: So as regards AAad, they unjustly turned arrogant on earth, and said, "Are there any people stronger than us?" Did they not see that Allah Who created them was far greater in power than they? Yet they arrogantly denied Our signs

16.Mohammad Shafi: Then We let loose on them a blowing wind for several calamitous days to make them taste a disgraceful punishment here in this world. And the punishment in the Hereafter will be far more disgraceful! And they will have none to help them

17.Mohammad Shafi: And as regards Thamood, We did give them guidance, but they loved blindness over guidance! Then the thunderbolt of a humiliating punishment seized them because of what they earned

18.Mohammad Shafi: And We saved those who believed and were pious

19.Mohammad Shafi: And the Day Allah's enemies are gathered at the Fire and are then set in rows

20.Mohammad Shafi: By the time they reach it (Fire), their ears and eyes and skins would have testified to what they had done

21.Mohammad Shafi: And they ask their skins, "Why did you testify against us?" They reply, "Allah — who gave all things the power of speech — made us speak. It is He who created you the first time, and to Him you will return."

22.Mohammad Shafi: You could never prevent your ears or eyes or skins from testifying against you. And you thought that Allah was mostly unaware of what you did

23.Mohammad Shafi: It is this false notion you had of your Lord that ruined you, and you find yourselves among those doomed

24.Mohammad Shafi: Whether they patiently bear their suffering or not, they shall continue to abide is Hell! And if they beg for favour, they shall not be among the recepients thereof

25.Mohammad Shafi: And We had assigned to them companions who made their present and their past look good to them. And the fate that had once befallen the communities of jinns and men before them befell upon them. They were indeed doomed

26.Mohammad Shafi: And those that suppress the Truth say, "Do not listen to this Qur'an, and insert frivolities in it, so that you may prevail over the believers."

27.Mohammad Shafi: We shall make all those who suppress the Truth taste the severe punishment, and pay them back for the evil that they had perpetrated

28.Mohammad Shafi: This — the Hell — is the requital for Allah's enemies. They will have therein their eternal home, as punishment for arrogantly denying Our signs

29.Mohammad Shafi: Those who had suppressed the Truth will say, "O Lord! Show us those among the jinns and human beings who had led us astray that we may trample them under our feet to render them among the lowliest of creatures."

30.Mohammad Shafi: Those indeed who say `Allah is Our Lord' and then remain steadfast, the angels come down to them saying, "Fear not, nor regret, but rejoice in the glad news of Paradise that has been promised to you!"

31.Mohammad Shafi: "We are your close friends in this life and in the Hereafter. And in the Hereafter, you will get whatever you desire, and you will have therein whatsoever you ask for"

32.Mohammad Shafi: "As gift from the One forgiving, merciful."

33.Mohammad Shafi: And who speaks better than one who calls to God, does things righteously, and says, "I am indeed among those who submit to Allah?"

34.Mohammad Shafi: And good and evil are not alike. Repel evil with what is good. Then one, between whom and you there was enmity, will be like a close friend

35.Mohammad Shafi: And it is granted to none but those who exercise patience. And it is granted to none but those with a great endowment

36.Mohammad Shafi: And if a mischief from the Satan affects you, seek refuge in Allah. HE is indeed the One who hears, knows

37.Mohammad Shafi: And some signs of His are the night, the day, the sun and the moon. Prostrate not to the sun and the moon, and prostrate to Allah who created them, if you do truly worship Him

38.Mohammad Shafi: But if they [Allah's subjects] are too arrogant to worship Him, then those that are close to your Lord do never get weary of singing His praises night and day

39.Mohammad Shafi: And it is among His signs that the barren earth you see begins to stir and sprout when We send down rain upon it. He who gives it life will indeed also give life to the dead. He indeed has power over everything

40.Mohammad Shafi: Those that effect distortion in Our Verses — they indeed are not hidden from Us! Who then is better: he who will be cast into Hell, or he who will come out safe on the Day of Resurrection? Do whatever you want; He does indeed see whatever you do

41.Mohammad Shafi: Those that suppress the Reminder (Qur'aan) when it has come to them! It is certainly indeed a powerful Book

42.Mohammad Shafi: Falsehood can enter it neither overtly nor covertly. It is a revelation sent down from One, wise and praiseworthy

43.Mohammad Shafi: You have been told nothing but what was told to other Messengers before you. Your Lord is certainly indeed full of forgiveness, but also capable of giving severe punishment

44.Mohammad Shafi: And had We made it a Qur'aan in a non-Arab tongue, they would surely have said, "Why are its Verses not explained clearly — non-Arabic into Arabic?" Say, "It is guidance and cure for those who believe; and for those who do not believe, their ears are deaf thereto and their eyes blind. They are those to whom one calls from a place far away."

45.Mohammad Shafi: And We did give Moses the Book; but differences were created therein. And had the Word of your Lord not preceded it, matters would have been settled then and there among them. They are deeply in doubt and suspicion about it

46.Mohammad Shafi: If one does a good deed, one does it for oneself. And if one does a bad deed, one bears its consequence oneself. And your Lord is not cruel to His subjects

47.Mohammad Shafi: To Him goes back the knowledge of the Hour (the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin). No fruit comes out of its spathe, no female conceives or gives birth, but with His knowledge. And that Day He will call them out, "Where are those whom you worshipped besides Me?" They will answer, "We confess to You none of us has seen them!"

48.Mohammad Shafi: And those they prayed to before, will desert them. And they will realise there is no place for them to escape to

49.Mohammad Shafi: Man never tires of praying for good. And if evil befalls him he gives up all hope

50.Mohammad Shafi: And if We let him have a taste of Our mercy after some distress had afflicted him, he says, "It was my due. I do not think the Hour will ever happen. And even if I am sent back to my Lord, there will surely still be the best for me with Him." We shall tell those who suppress the Truth what they used to do, and make them suffer severe punishment

51.Mohammad Shafi: And when We shower Our favours upon man he keeps himself arrogantly aloof. And when anything bad happens to him, he prays a great deal

52.Mohammad Shafi: Say, "Do you see if this is from Allah and you deny it, would there be anyone more astray than he who is in such extreme rebellion?"

53.Mohammad Shafi: We will show Our signs to them in the wide world outside and within themselves, until it becomes clear to them that it (Qur'aan) is the truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is Witness over all things

54.Mohammad Shafi: Beware! They are indeed in doubt concerning their meeting their Lord. Beware! He does indeed encompass all things

1.Mohammad Shafi: Ha-meem

2.Mohammad Shafi: AAayn-seen-qa
